?_. MEDICAL_NNP ASPECTS_NNP OF_NNP PLAGUE_NNP ._. ]_NN
69_CD The_DT official_JJ returns_NNS of_IN deaths_NNS from_IN plague_NN were_VBD for_IN various_JJ reasons_NNS not_RB very_RB accurate_JJ ._.
A_DT fairly_RB correct_JJ estimate_NN of_IN the_DT mortality_NN can_MD be_VB obtained_VBN ,_, however_RB ,_, by_IN taking_VBG as_IN plague_NN mortality_NN the_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT weekly_JJ mortality_NN and_CC the_DT mean_NN of_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ weeks_NNS during_IN the_DT preceding_VBG five_CD years_NNS ,_, as_IN there_EX was_VBD no_DT other_JJ unusual_JJ cause_NN of_IN sickness_JJ present_NN ._.
It_PRP must_MD be_VB remembered_VBN that_IN the_DT average_JJ weekly_JJ mortality_NN during_IN the_DT preceding_VBG five_CD years_NNS was_VBD taken_VBN on_IN a_DT population_NN of_IN 800,000_CD ,_, and_CC that_IN owing_VBG to_TO the_DT exodus_NN which_WDT occurred_VBD after_IN the_DT outbreak_NN of_IN the_DT epidemic_JJ the_DT population_NN was_VBD reduced_VBN by_IN from_IN a_DT fourth_JJ to_TO a_DT third_JJ of_IN that_DT number_NN ._.
The_DT true_JJ incidence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD consequently_RB considerably_RB heavier_RBR during_IN the_DT later_JJ weeks_NNS than_IN shown_VBN in_IN the_DT table_NN ,_, and_CC this_DT error_NN was_VBD a_DT gradually_RB increasing_VBG one_CD growing_VBG with_IN the_DT decrease_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN stated_VBN that_IN in_IN other_JJ places_NNS outbreaks_NNS were_VBD often_RB preceded_VBN by_IN the_DT appearance_NN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN painless_NN buboes_NNS unaccompanied_VBN by_IN vomiting_VBG ,_, fever_NN ,_, headache_NN or_CC other_JJ symptoms_NNS of_IN plague_NN ,_, but_CC this_DT was_VBD not_RB observed_VBN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
It_PRP may_MD here_RB be_VB noted_VBN that_IN the_DT great_JJ difficulty_NN which_WDT arises_VBZ in_IN tracing_VBG the_DT mode_NN of_IN infection_NN and_CC the_DT course_NN of_IN plague_NN ,_, as_IN compared_VBN with_IN the_DT other_JJ more_JJR common_JJ infectious_JJ diseases_NNS ,_, is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO two_CD factsviz._NN ,_, that_WDT animals_VBZ such_JJ as_IN rats_NNS readily_RB contract_NN and_CC afterwards_NNS spread_VBP the_DT disease_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT microbe_NN is_VBZ capable_JJ of_IN thriving_VBG and_CC multiplying_VBG outside_IN the_DT animal_JJ body_NN ,_, as_IN is_VBZ seen_VBN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, when_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ cultivated_VBN in_IN broth_DT or_CC on_IN ghee_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ evident_JJ that_IN infection_NN may_MD be_VB carried_VBN by_IN rats_NNS to_TO persons_NNS who_WP have_VBP never_RB been_VBN brought_VBN into_IN contact_NN with_IN plague_NN patients_NNS ,_, nor_CC with_IN persons_NNS visiting_VBG plague_NN patients_NNS ,_, and_CC whose_WP$ food_NN and_CC clothing_NN could_MD not_RB have_VB been_VBN contaminated_VBN in_IN any_DT other_JJ way_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, the_DT germs_NNS may_MD be_VB conveyed_VBN by_IN persons_NNS who_WP are_VBP themselves_PRP insusceptible_JJ to_TO plague_VB ,_, and_CC having_VBG grown_VBN and_CC multiplied_VBN on_IN suitable_JJ media_NNS and_CC under_IN favourable_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, may_MD infect_VB large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN people_NNS who_WP have_VBP never_RB come_VBN into_IN contact_NN with_IN plague_NN patients_NNS ,_, their_PRP$ attendants_NNS or_CC plague-stricken_JJ rats_NNS ._.
The_DT development_NN of_IN plague_NN in_IN an_DT epidemic_JJ form_NN was_VBD believed_VBN by_IN many_JJ persons_NNS to_TO be_VB due_JJ to_TO rotten_VB grain_NN which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN buried_VBN underground_JJ ,_, and_CC ,_, it_PRP was_VBD thought_VBN by_IN some_DT ,_, infected_VBN with_IN plague_NN germs_NNS ._.
Had_NNP rotten_NN or_CC diseased_VBN grain_NN been_VBN sold_VBN as_IN food_NN (_( and_CC there_EX was_VBD no_DT evidence_NN that_IN this_DT took_VBD place_NN )_) ,_, it_PRP would_MD in_IN all_DT probability_NN have_VBP given_VBN rise_NN to_TO digestive_JJ disorders_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN so_RB far_RB have_VBP predisposed_VBN to_TO plague_VB ;_: but_CC if_IN the_DT grain_NN had_VBD been_VBN infected_VBN with_IN plague_NN bacilli_NN ,_, the_DT disease_NN would_MD have_VB appeared_VBN in_IN several_JJ localities_NNS simultaneously_RB ,_, wherever_IN the_DT infected_JJ grain_NN had_VBD been_VBN eaten_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ impossible_JJ to_TO believe_VB too_RB that_DT large_JJ stores_NNS of_IN infected_VBN grain_NN could_MD have_VB been_VBN sold_VBN without_IN giving_VBG rise_NN to_TO an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN disease_NN among_IN grain-sellers_NNS throughout_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN that_IN this_DT spreading_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN far_RB and_CC wide_JJ among_IN grain-dealers_NNS did_VBD not_RB occur_VB ,_, and_CC the_DT 54_CD grain_NN and_CC flour-sellers_NNS ,_, millers_NNS ,_, and_CC grain-parchers_NNS who_WP died_VBD from_IN plague_NN between_IN the_DT months_NNS of_IN September_NNP 1896_CD and_CC January_NNP 1897_CD ,_, died_VBD principally_RB in_IN infected_JJ localities_NNS in_IN the_DT neighbourhood_NN of_IN the_DT Docks_NNP ,_, where_WRB the_DT disease_NN first_RB appeared_VBD ,_, but_CC did_VBD not_RB themselves_PRP form_VBP centres_NNS from_IN which_WDT the_DT disease_NN spread_NN in_IN unaffected_JJ districts_NNS ._.
The_DT epidemic_NN was_VBD observed_VBN to_TO increase_VB notably_RB during_IN the_DT cold_JJ season_NN and_CC to_TO decline_VB during_IN the_DT hot_JJ weather_NN ._.
This_DT increase_NN during_IN the_DT cold_JJ months_NNS was_VBD probably_RB due_JJ ,_, to_TO a_DT great_JJ extent_NN ,_, to_TO the_DT sick_JJ and_CC healthy_JJ occupying_VBG the_DT same_JJ rooms_NNS during_IN the_DT day_NN and_CC sleeping_VBG together_RB at_IN night_NN ,_, and_CC also_RB to_TO the_DT depressing_JJ effects_NNS of_IN cold_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT warm_JJ months_NNS the_DT poor_JJ live_JJ under_IN much_RB more_JJR sanitary_JJ conditions_NNS than_IN in_IN the_DT cold_JJ season_NN ._.
The_DT influence_NN of_IN animals_NNS in_IN spreading_VBG the_DT disease_NN was_VBD ,_, with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN rats_NNS ,_, probably_RB inappreciable_JJ ._.
A_DT searching_VBG inquiry_NN at_IN Damaun_NNP ,_, where_WRB there_EX were_VBD great_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN pigs_NNS at_IN large_JJ in_IN the_DT streets_NNS ,_, elicited_VBD no_DT evidence_NN of_IN a_DT single_JJ death_NN ,_, or_CC even_RB of_IN an_DT appear-_JJ ance_NN of_IN sickness_NN among_IN pigs_NNS ,_, although_IN an_DT exceptionally_RB severe_JJ epidemic_NN of_IN plague_NN had_VBD visited_VBN 13_CD ?_. 70_CD [_JJ CHAP_NNP ._.

the_DT town_NN ._.
Sheep_NNP ,_, goats_NNS ,_, horses_NNS and_CC cows_NNS were_VBD unaffected_JJ ._.
There_EX was_VBD evidence_NN (_( post-mortem_NN )_) of_IN a_DT dog_NN having_VBG been_VBN affected_JJ ,_, but_CC none_NN that_WDT cats_VBZ contracted_VBD the_DT disease_NN ._.
Birds_NNS were_VBD not_RB at_IN all_DT affected_JJ ._.
In_IN the_DT epidemic_NN at_IN Hardwar_NNP ,_, monkeys_NNS were_VBD infected_VBN and_CC died_VBN in_IN considerable_JJ numbers_NNS ._.
The_DT grey_NN monkey_NN is_VBZ very_RB susceptible_JJ to_TO plague_VB and_CC rarely_RB recovers_NNS ;_: the_DT brown_JJ monkey_NN is_VBZ much_RB less_RBR severely_RB affected_JJ ._.
The_DT influence_NN of_IN ants_NNS and_CC bugs_NNS in_IN spreading_VBG the_DT disease_NN was_VBD considered_VBN by_IN Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP to_TO be_VB unimportant_JJ ._.
All_DT observers_VBZ up_RP to_TO the_DT present_JJ time_NN have_VBP connected_VBN the_DT occurrence_NN and_CC diffusion_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN with_IN want_NN and_CC filth_NN ,_, and_CC there_RB seems_VBZ to_TO be_VB no_DT doubt_NN that_IN these_DT factors_NNS do_VBP favour_VB it_PRP in_IN so_RB far_RB as_IN they_PRP lower_VBP the_DT general_JJ health_NN and_CC diminish_JJ natural_JJ immunity_NN ._.
But_CC it_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_IN filth_NN per_IN se_NN has_VBZ but_CC little_JJ influence_NN ,_, from_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN there_EX occurred_VBN in_IN the_DT House_NNP of_IN Correction_NNP ,_, Byculla_NNP ,_, where_WRB cleanliness_NN is_VBZ brought_VBN as_IN nearly_RB to_TO perfection_NN as_IN is_VBZ attainable_JJ ,_, an_DT outbreak_NN which_WDT exceeded_VBD in_IN severity_NN that_IN in_IN any_DT of_IN the_DT filthy_JJ chawls_NN and_CC tenements_NNS around_IN ._.
There_EX were_VBD 345_CD prisoners_NNS confined_VBN in_IN this_DT jail_NN when_WRB plague_NN broke_VBD out_RP there_RB on_IN the_DT 23rd_CD January_NNP 1897_CD ;_: the_DT outbreak_NN lasted_VBD for_IN 15_CD days_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN that_DT time_NN 33_CD prisoners_NNS were_VBD attacked_VBN ,_, 17_CD of_IN whom_WP died_VBD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ a_DT significant_JJ fact_NN ,_, too_RB ,_, in_IN this_DT connection_NN ,_, that_IN out_IN of_IN 1,579_CD patients_NNS treated_VBN at_IN the_DT Arthur_NNP Road_NNP and_CC Parel_NNP Hospitals_NNP there_EX were_VBD only_RB 16_CD sweepers_NNS ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT halalcores_NNS who_WP remove_VBP the_DT night-soil_NN from_IN the_DT houses_NNS ,_, and_CC who_WP form_VBP probably_RB the_DT dirtiest_JJS portion_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN ,_, were_VBD notably_RB free_JJ from_IN plague_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ true_JJ they_PRP are_VBP a_DT strong_JJ well-_NN nourished_JJ class_NN ,_, of_IN whom_WP only_RB the_DT fittest_JJS have_VBP survived_VBN ,_, and_CC they_PRP are_VBP highly_RB paid_VBN and_CC live_JJ well_NN ._.
The_DT predisposing_NN causes_NNS were_VBD mainly_RB those_DT leading_VBG to_TO a_DT lower_JJR state_NN of_IN vitality_NN ,_, and_CC which_WDT consequently_RB lessened_VBD the_DT natural_JJ resistance_NN of_IN the_DT individual_NN to_TO infection_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT way_NN ,_, as_IN above_NN mentioned_VBD ,_, the_DT long-continued_JJ and_CC exceptionally_RB hot_JJ season_NN of_IN 1896_CD ,_, the_DT un-_JJ usually_RB heavy_VBP rainfall_NN which_WDT followed_VBD ,_, and_CC which_WDT confined_VBD the_DT poor_JJ constantly_RB in_IN their_PRP$ over-_NN crowded_VBN and_CC insanitary_JJ dwellings_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT great_JJ heat_NN which_WDT succeeded_VBD the_DT rains_NNS ,_, were_VBD power-_JJ ful_JJ factors_NNS in_IN lowering_VBG vitality_NN ._.
Then_RB came_VBD scarcity_NN due_JJ to_TO dearness_VB of_IN food_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT cold_JJ season_NN the_DT unhealthy_JJ condition_NN of_IN chawls_NN (_( native_JJ flats_NNS )_) and_CC houses_NNS in_IN the_DT city_NN was_VBD ren-_JJ dered_JJ worse_JJR by_IN overcrowding_VBG ,_, the_DT inmates_NNS being_VBG unable_JJ to_TO sleep_VB and_CC work_VB in_IN the_DT open_JJ ,_, as_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN them_PRP are_VBP accustomed_VBN to_TO do_VB during_IN the_DT warmer_JJ months_NNS ._.
Indeed_RB ,_, the_DT effect_NN of_IN cold_JJ alone_NN on_IN the_DT feeble_JJ and_CC on_IN those_DT who_WP are_VBP insufficiently_RB clothed_VBN ,_, as_IN already_RB mentioned_VBN ,_, is_VBZ a_DT powerful_JJ factor_NN in_IN lessening_VBG resistance_NN to_TO infection_NN ._.
The_DT largest_JJS number_NN of_IN admissions_NNS to_TO hospital_VB occurred_PRP between_IN the_DT ages_NNS of_IN 20_CD and_CC 30_CD years_NNS ._.
At_IN the_DT Arthur_NNP Road_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, Bombay_NNP ,_, out_IN of_IN 1,275_CD admissions_NNS ,_, 445_CD or_CC 34.9_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.

between_IN 10_CD and_CC 20_CD years_NNS ;_: and_CC 255_CD or_CC 20_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.

In_IN the_DT Poona_NNP Plague_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, out_IN of_IN 1,130_CD admissions_NNS ,_, 263_CD or_CC 23.27_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.

A_DT constant_JJ source_NN of_IN error_NN in_IN these_DT statistics_NNS is_VBZ that_IN the_DT ages_NNS of_IN those_DT admitted_VBN are_VBP seldom_RB or_CC never_RB exactly_RB known_VBN ,_, consequently_RB those_DT given_VBN are_VBP only_RB approximate_JJ ._.
Another_DT source_NN of_IN error_NN is_VBZ that_IN in_IN young_JJ children_NNS death_NN from_IN plague_NN frequently_RB occurs_VBZ before_IN the_DT nature_NN af_VBZ the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ recognised_VBN ,_, so_IN they_PRP are_VBP not_RB admitted_VBN into_IN the_DT plague_NN hospitals_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN children_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT very_RB small_JJ number_NN of_IN admissions_NNS (_( vide_IN Tables_NNP I._NNP and_CC II_NNP ._. )_)

71_CD place_NN on_IN the_DT outbreak_NN of_IN the_DT epidemic_NN was_VBD very_RB largely_RB confined_VBN to_TO women_NNS and_CC children_NNS ._.
The_DT withdrawal_NN of_IN the_DT women_NNS gave_VBD rise_NN to_TO a_DT marked_JJ decrease_NN in_IN the_DT birth-rate_NN of_IN the_DT city_NN ,_, which_WDT during_IN the_DT ten_JJ months_NNS under_IN review_NN fell_VBD below_IN the_DT mean_NN of_IN the_DT preceding_VBG five_CD years_NNS for_IN the_DT same_JJ priod_NN by_IN 3,685_CD ._.
*_NN That_DT young_JJ adults_NNS should_MD give_VB the_DT highest_JJS number_NN of_IN admission_NN is_VBZ not_RB surprising_JJ ,_, as_IN they_PRP form_VBP the_DT largest_JJS proportion_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN ,_, and_CC they_PRP travel_VBP about_IN more_JJR ,_, and_CC so_RB are_VBP brought_VBN more_RBR frequently_RB into_IN contact_NN with_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
The_DT greatest_JJS number_NN of_IN admissions_NNS into_IN hospital_NN occurred_VBD among_IN domestic_JJ (_( cooks_NNS ,_, hamals_NNS ,_, massalchis_NN )_) and_CC personal_JJ servants_NNS ,_, (_( vide_IN Table_NNP V._NNP )_) who_WP formed_VBD 20.88_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
;_: mill-hands_NNS came_VBD next_JJ ,_, forming_VBG 11.52_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
:_: coolies_NNS ,_, 8.8_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT comparatively_RB large_JJ number_NN of_IN dhobies_NNS (_( native_JJ washermen_NNS )_) ,_, darzis_FW (_( tailors_NNS )_) ,_, golis_FW (_( milkmen_NNS )_) ,_, and_CC hajjms_NN (_( barbers_NNS )_) deserves_VBZ notice_RB ,_, as_IN from_IN their_PRP$ occupation_NN they_PRP are_VBP likely_JJ to_TO spread_VB the_DT disease_NN ._.
The_DT large_JJ percentage_NN of_IN admissions_NNS among_IN domestic_JJ servants_NNS is_VBZ doubtless_JJ due_JJ to_TO the_DT disease_NN being_VBG detected_VBN early_RB ,_, and_CC to_TO their_PRP$ masters_NNS seeing_VBG that_IN they_PRP were_VBD taken_VBN to_TO hospital_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ impossible_JJ to_TO estimate_VB the_DT influence_NN of_IN race_NN and_CC caste_NN on_IN susceptibility_NN to_TO plague_VB ,_, owing_VBG to_TO Europeans_NNPS living_VBG under_IN very_RB different_JJ sanitary_JJ conditions_NNS from_IN natives_NNS ,_, and_CC to_TO the_DT effect_NN of_IN social_JJ position_NN in_IN altering_VBG the_DT conditions_NNS obtaining_VBG among_IN natives_JJ themselves_PRP ;_: besides_NNS ,_, correct_JJ statistics_NNS can_MD not_RB be_VB obtained_VBN as_IN to_TO the_DT native_JJ population_NN present_NN during_IN the_DT epidemic_JJ and_CC the_DT numbers_NNS attacked_VBN by_IN plague_NN ._.
That_DT more_JJR males_NNS than_IN females_NNS were_VBD attacked_VBN (_( vide_IN Table_NNP IV_NNP )_) is_VBZ probably_RB entirely_RB owing_VBG to_TO the_DT former_JJ having_VBG been_VBN present_JJ in_IN larger_JJR number_NN ._.
The_DT exciting_JJ cause_NN of_IN plague_NN is_VBZ the_DT plague_JJ bacillus_NN of_IN Kitasato_NNP ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ believed_VBN to_TO gain_VB admission_NN to_TO the_DT body_NN ,_, usually_RB through_IN an_DT abrasion_NN of_IN the_DT skin_NN ,_, or_CC more_RBR rarely_RB of_IN a_DT mucous_JJ surface_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN instances_NNS in_IN the_DT present_JJ epidemic_JJ points_NNS of_IN inoculation_NN were_VBD found_VBN on_IN the_DT extremities_NNS of_IN plague_NN patients_NNS ,_, from_IN which_WDT plague_NN cultures_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN ._.
and_CC in_IN these_DT cases_NNS buboes_NNS were_VBD found_VBN above_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN inoculation_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN instances_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, no_DT local_JJ indication_NN could_MD be_VB found_VBN marking_VBG the_DT point_NN at_IN which_WDT the_DT microbe_NN was_VBD implanted_VBN ._.
Less_RBR frequently_RB infection_NN is_VBZ believed_VBN to_TO have_VB occurred_VBN in_IN the_DT respiratory_NN organ_NN or_CC in_IN the_DT digestive_JJ tract_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT disease_NN appears_VBZ in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN primary_JJ plague-pneumonia_NN ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB caused_VBN by_IN the_DT inhalation_NN of_IN bacilli_NN disseminated_VBN in_IN the_DT air_NN by_IN patients_NNS as_IN they_PRP cough_VBP ,_, or_CC it_PRP may_MD be_VB carried_VBN by_IN the_DT blood_NN vessels_NNS ,_, or_CC lymphatic_JJ vessels_NNS to_TO the_DT lungs_NNS ,_, where_WRB it_PRP develops_VBZ ._.
When_WRB a_DT monkey_NN is_VBZ inoculated_VBN by_IN pricking_VBG its_PRP$ hand_NN with_IN a_DT needle_JJ dipped_NN in_IN plague_JJ culture_NN ,_, the_DT slight_NN wound_NN made_VBD disappears_NNS in_IN a_DT couple_NN of_IN days_NNS ,_, and_CC leaves_VBZ no_DT indication_NN of_IN the_DT point_NN at_IN which_WDT inoculation_NN was_VBD performed_VBN ._.
After_IN four_CD or_CC five_CD days_NNS a_DT bubo_NN appears_VBZ in_IN the_DT axilla_NN or_CC at_IN the_DT bend_NN of_IN the_DT elbow_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT symptoms_NNS of_IN plague_NN develop_NN ._.
The_DT lymph_NN from_IN the_DT bubo_NN in_IN these_DT cases_NNS contains_VBZ plague_JJ bacilli_NN in_IN great_JJ numbers_NNS ,_, from_IN which_WDT cultures_NNS can_MD be_VB made_VBN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN man_NN also_RB ,_, as_IN already_RB mentioned_VBN ,_, the_DT point_NN at_IN which_WDT inoculation_NN occurred_VBD was_VBD but_CC rarely_RB discovered_VBD ._.
Plague_NNP bacilli_NN could_MD ,_, however_RB ,_, be_VB obtained_VBN in_IN immense_JJ numbers_NNS ,_, and_CC cultures_NNS made_VBN from_IN lymph_NN taken_VBN from_IN buboes_NNS ._.
In_IN septimic_JJ cases_NNS they_PRP could_MD be_VB obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT blood_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN from_IN lymph_NN from_IN enlarged_JJ glands_NNS ;_: and_CC in_IN pneumonic_JJ cases_NNS they_PRP were_VBD obtainable_JJ from_IN the_DT sputa_NN and_CC from_IN enlarged_VBN glands_NNS when_WRB present_NN ._.
Bacilli_NNP were_VBD probably_RB also_RB present_JJ as_IN a_DT rule_NN in_IN the_DT sputa_NN ,_, vomit_NN ,_, urine_JJ and_CC fces_NNS of_IN plague_NN patients_NNS ,_, but_CC they_PRP were_VBD hardly_RB ever_RB found_VBN in_IN the_DT blood_NN taken_VBN from_IN the_DT finger_NN in_IN cases_NNS where_WRB a_DT bubo_NN was_VBD present_JJ from_IN the_DT first_JJ ._.

Primary_JJ plague-pneumonia_NN was_VBD also_RB met_VBN with_IN ,_, but_CC this_DT form_NN of_IN plague_NN (_( which_WDT was_VBD first_JJ recognized_VBN and_CC described_VBN by_IN Surgeon-Captain_NNP Childe_NNP )_) during_IN the_DT present_JJ epidemic_NN is_VBZ so_RB important_JJ as_IN to_TO require_VB a_DT detailed_JJ description_NN ._.
In_IN connection_NN with_IN the_DT digestive_JJ system_NN ,_, the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN vomiting_VBG at_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, in_IN some_DT instances_NNS accompanied_VBN by_IN diarrha_NN ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN referred_VBN to_TO above_VB ._.

75_CD bilious_JJ in_IN character_NN ,_, the_DT motions_NNS numbering_VBG five_CD or_CC six_CD in_IN twenty-four_JJ hours_NNS ,_, the_DT stools_NNS being_VBG always_RB very_RB offensive_JJ and_CC sometimes_RB tinged_VBN with_IN blood_NN ._.

These_DT cases_NNS were_VBD very_RB fatal_JJ ._.

As_IN the_DT disease_NN progressed_VBD ,_, respiration_NN became_VBD very_RB frequent_JJ (_( forty_JJ to_TO sixty_VB in_IN the_DT minute_NN )_) and_CC difficult_JJ ,_, and_CC duskiness_NN of_IN the_DT face_NN appeared_VBD ._.

The_DT expectoration_NN ,_, bronchitic_JJ at_IN the_DT beginning_NN ,_, very_RB soon_RB became_VBD watery_JJ and_CC profuse_NN ;_: it_PRP often_RB contained_VBD little_JJ whitish_JJ specks_NNS floating_VBG in_IN it_PRP ,_, and_CC on_IN examination_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO contain_VB plague_JJ bacilli_NN in_IN great_JJ numbers_NNS ._.

There_EX was_VBD great_JJ prostration_NN from_IN the_DT first_JJ ;_: the_DT pulse_JJ soon_RB became_VBD feeble_JJ and_CC very_RB frequent_JJ ,_, so_IN that_IN the_DT alteration_NN in_IN the_DT pulse-respiration_NN ratio_NN ordinarily_RB met_VBN with_IN in_IN pneumonia_NN was_VBD not_RB observed_VBN ;_: the_DT temperature_NN was_VBD high_JJ and_CC ran_VBD an_DT irregular_JJ course_NN (_( vide_JJ Charts_NNP XI_NNP ,_, XII_NNP ,_, XVII_NNP ,_, XIX_NNP ,_, XXIX_NNP ,_, XXX_NNP ,_, XXXI_NNP )_) ,_, the_DT tongue_NN was_VBD coated_VBN white_JJ ,_, except_IN at_IN the_DT tip_NN and_CC edges_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT bowels_NNS were_VBD confined_VBN ._.
The_DT physical_JJ signs_NNS present_JJ were_VBD those_DT of_IN broncho-pneumonia_NN ,_, patches_NNS of_IN con-_JJ solidation_NN being_VBG found_VBN in_IN one_CD or_CC both_DT lungs_NNS ,_, the_DT right_NN generally_RB being_VBG the_DT one_CD most_JJS affected_JJ ._.

Death_NNP generally_RB ensued_VBD in_IN three_CD or_CC four_CD days_NNS ,_, and_CC was_VBD preceded_VBN by_IN incessant_JJ cough_NN and_CC by_IN blueness_NN of_IN the_DT skin_NN due_JJ to_TO deficient_JJ aeration_NN of_IN blood_NN ,_, caused_VBD mainly_RB by_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN fluid_NN in_IN the_DT air_NN vesicles_NNS ._.
The_DT complications_NNS met_VBD with_IN in_IN plague_NN were-in_VBP the_DT nervous_JJ system_NN delusions_NNS ,_, in_IN one_CD case_NN ending_VBG in_IN insanity_NN ;_: motor_NN paralysis_NN ,_, local_JJ or_CC general_JJ ;_: impaired_JJ sense_NN of_IN touch_NN ;_: sometimes_RB diminished_VBD sensibility_NN to_TO pain_VB ,_, sometimes_RB hypersthesia_NN ;_: deafness_NN ;_: ulceration_NN of_IN the_DT cornea_NN ,_, conjunctivitis_NN ,_, and_CC sub-conjunctival_JJ hmorrhage_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT circulatory_NN system_NN ,_, softening_VBG of_IN the_DT muscular_JJ tissue_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN with_IN enfeebled_JJ cardiac_JJ action_NN and_CC dilation_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT respiratory_NN system_NN ,_, bronchitis_NN ;_: hypostatic_JJ congestion_NN and_CC dema_NN of_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ;_: secondary_JJ pneumonia_NN ;_: pleurisy_CC ;_: and_CC rarely_RB pulmonary_JJ hmorrhage_NN ._.

In_IN the_DT urinary_JJ system_NN ,_, albuminuria_RB ;_: renal_JJ congestion_NN ,_, and_CC renal_JJ hmorrhage_NN ,_, in_IN one_CD case_NN causing_VBG death_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT reproductive_JJ system_NN ,_, menorrhagia_NN at_IN the_DT menstrual_JJ period_NN ;_: and_CC abor-_JJ tion_NN in_IN many_JJ cases_NNS of_IN pregnancy_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT cutaneous_JJ system_NN ,_, sloughing_VBG of_IN the_DT skin_NN and_CC boils_NNS ._.
The_DT sequel_NN most_RBS frequently_RB met_VBN with_IN were_VBD deafness_NN in_IN one_CD or_CC both_DT ears_NNS ;_: impairment_NN of_IN vision_NN due_JJ to_TO degeneration_NN of_IN the_DT choroid_NN and_CC retina_NN ;_: dumbness_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT loss_NN of_IN memory_NN of_IN words_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO laryngeal_VB paralysis_NN ;_: paralysis_NN of_IN the_DT muscles_NNS of_IN the_DT eyes_NNS or_CC face_NN ;_: paresis_NN or_CC 20_CD 78_CD [_JJ CHAP_NNP ._.
II_NNP ._.
paralysis_NN of_IN the_DT muscles_NNS of_IN the_DT extremities_NNS either_CC hemiplegic_NN or_CC paraplegic_NN ;_: inco-ordination_NN of_IN the_DT muscles_NNS of_IN the_DT face_NN ,_, tongue_NN and_CC extremities_NNS ;_: impairment_NN of_IN cutaneous_JJ sensibility_NN to_TO pain_VB ._.
The_DT duration_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN 902_CD fatal_JJ cases_NNS admitted_VBN into_IN hospital_NN was_VBD 19_CD hours_NNS in_IN one_CD case_NN ,_, one_CD day_NN in_IN 5_CD ,_, two_CD in_IN 43_CD ,_, three_CD in_IN 99_CD ,_, four_CD in_IN 143_CD ,_, five_CD in_IN 129_CD ,_, six_CD in_IN 85_CD ,_, seven_CD in_IN 76_CD ,_, eight_CD in_IN 56_CD ,_, nine_CD in_IN 42_CD ,_, and_CC ten_VB in_IN 24_CD cases_NNS ._.
It_PRP must_MD be_VB remembered_VBN that_IN probably_RB very_RB few_JJ of_IN the_DT cases_NNS dying_VBG during_IN the_DT first_JJ twenty-four_JJ hours_NNS were_VBD brought_VBN to_TO hospital_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN many_JJ of_IN the_DT cases_NNS dying_VBG on_IN the_DT second_JJ and_CC third_JJ day_NN were_VBD also_RB not_RB detected_VBN and_CC sent_VBN to_TO hospital_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ duration_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN from_IN attack_NN to_TO death_NN in_IN seventeen_JJ fatal_JJ cases_NNS among_IN native_JJ prisoners_NNS in_IN the_DT House_NNP of_IN Correction_NNP ,_, Byculla_NNP ,_, was_VBD five_CD and_CC a_DT half_JJ days_NNS ._.
Second_JJ attacks_NNS from_IN plague_NN occurred_VBN in_IN two_CD cases_NNS which_WDT have_VBP been_VBN recorded_VBN ._.
In_IN the_DT first_JJ case_NN ,_, the_DT patient_NN who_WP had_VBD suffered_VBN from_IN plague_NN at_IN Hongkong_NNP in_IN June_NNP 1894_CD was_VBD attack-_JJ ed_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP on_IN the_DT 6th_CD December_NNP 1896_CD ,_, had_VBD rigors_NNS ,_, vomiting_VBG ,_, high_JJ fever_NN (_( 105_CD F._NNP )_) ,_, severe_JJ headache_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT bubo_NN in_IN the_DT right_JJ groin_NN ._.
The_DT fever_NN and_CC other_JJ symptoms_NNS subsided_VBD within_IN a_DT week_NN and_CC she_PRP recovered_VBD ._.
The_DT second_JJ case_NN was_VBD that_IN of_IN a_DT cooly_NN admitted_VBN into_IN the_DT Arthur_NNP Road_NNP Hospital_NNP in_IN November_NNP 1896_CD for_IN plague_NN ._.
He_PRP was_VBD discharged_VBN cured_VBN in_IN December_NNP and_CC con-_JJ tinued_NN to_TO work_VB until_IN February_NNP 1897_CD ,_, when_WRB he_PRP was_VBD re-admitted_JJ for_IN plague_NN and_CC died_VBD ._.
The_DT diagnosis_NN of_IN plague_NN in_IN its_PRP$ most_RBS typical_JJ form_NN is_VBZ easy_JJ ._.
The_DT sudden_JJ onset_NN ,_, rapid_JJ rise_NN in_IN temperature_NN ,_, vomiting_VBG ,_, headache_NN ,_, sleeplessness_NN ,_, the_DT stupid_JJ expression_NN ,_, injection_NN of_IN the_DT eyes_NNS ,_, thick_JJ speech_NN and_CC great_JJ prostration_NN point_NN to_TO plague_VB ;_: and_CC later_RB ,_, the_DT condition_NN of_IN the_DT tongue_NN ,_, the_DT frequent_NN and_CC very_RB feeble_JJ pulse_NN ,_, the_DT enlarged_JJ and_CC painful_JJ lymphatic_JJ glands_NNS ,_, the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT temperature_NN (_( showing_VBG a_DT marked_JJ fall_NN on_IN the_DT second_JJ or_CC third_JJ day_NN followed_VBN by_IN a_DT further_JJ fall_NN to_TO normal_JJ or_CC subnormal_JJ between_IN the_DT fifth_NN and_CC seventh_JJ days_NNS )_) and_CC the_DT rapidly_RB fatal_JJ course_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN cases_NNS ,_, render_VBP the_DT diagnosis_NN unmistakable_JJ ._.
When_WRB however_RB the_DT disease_NN takes_VBZ the_DT form_NN of_IN primary_JJ plague-pneumonia_NN ,_, it_PRP becomes_VBZ exceedingly_RB difficult_JJ to_TO diagnose_VB ,_, whilst_NN at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN ,_, owing_VBG to_TO the_DT danger_NN of_IN infection_NN from_IN the_DT sputa_NN which_WDT contain_VBP plague_JJ bacilli_NN in_IN great_JJ numbers_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ most_RBS important_JJ to_TO recognise_VB it_PRP early_RB ._.
In_IN primary_JJ plague-pneumonia_NN the_DT absence_NN of_IN acute_NN or_CC subacute_NN bronchitis_NN before_IN the_DT attack_NN ;_: the_DT rapidity_NN with_IN which_WDT high_JJ fever_NN ,_, severe_JJ headache_NN and_CC marked_JJ prostration_NN occur_NN after_IN the_DT onset_NN ;_: the_DT character_NN of_IN the_DT expectoration_NN ,_, less_JJR viscid_NN from_IN the_DT first_JJ and_CC early_JJ becoming_VBG profuse_NN and_CC watery_NN ,_, and_CC generally_RB tinged_VBN with_IN blood_NN or_CC reddish_VB from_IN admixture_NN of_IN blood_NN ;_: the_DT rapidity_NN with_IN which_WDT signs_NNS of_IN dema_NN of_IN the_DT lungs_NNS appear_VBP ;_: the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT pulse_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ never_RB full_JJ and_CC bounding_NN ,_, and_CC soon_RB becomes_NNS very_RB soft_JJ and_CC frequent_JJ ,_, serve_VB to_TO distin-_JJ guish_JJ it_PRP from_IN ordinary_JJ broncho-pneumonia_NN or_CC lobar-pneumonia_NN in_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN cases_NNS ;_: and_CC the_DT presence_NN in_IN all_DT cases_NNS of_IN immense_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN plague_NN bacilli_NN in_IN the_DT sputa_NN ,_, from_IN which_WDT cultures_NNS can_MD be_VB obtained_VBN ,_, renders_VBZ the_DT diagnosis_NN certain_JJ ._.
Severe_JJ cases_NNS of_IN malarial_JJ fever_NN may_MD be_VB distinguished_VBN from_IN plague_NN by_IN the_DT nature_NN of_IN the_DT onset_NN ,_, the_DT cold_JJ stage_NN being_VBG more_JJR prolonged_JJ ,_, the_DT features_NNS pale_VBP and_CC shrunken_VBP ,_, and_CC the_DT nails_JJ blue_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT hot_JJ stage_NN the_DT face_NN becomes_VBZ flushed_VBN and_CC the_DT pulse_JJ full_JJ and_CC bounding_NN ,_, but_CC is_VBZ not_RB so_RB rapid_JJ as_IN in_IN plague_NN ._.
In_IN malarial_JJ cases_NNS ,_, too_RB ,_, the_DT temperature_NN generally_RB shows_VBZ marked_JJ periodicity_NN ;_: there_EX is_VBZ no_DT prostration_NN ,_, patients_NNS possessing_VBG as_IN a_DT rule_NN their_PRP$ muscular_JJ strength_NN and_CC mental_JJ energy_NN ;_: and_CC buboes_NNS are_VBP very_RB rarely_RB met_VBN with_IN ._.
Relapsing_VBG fever_RB ,_, like_IN plague_NN ,_, occurs_VBZ in_IN times_NNS of_IN scarcity_NN ._.
In_IN both_DT the_DT onset_NN is_VBZ sudden_JJ ,_, and_CC rapidly_RB followed_VBN by_IN high_JJ fever_NN ,_, accompanied_VBN by_IN severe_JJ headache_NN ,_, frequent_JJ pulse_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT hot_JJ and_CC burning_JJ skin_NN ;_: the_DT tongue_NN is_VBZ furred_VBN white_JJ ,_, the_DT temperature_NN reaches_VBZ its_PRP$ maximum_NN on_IN the_DT first_JJ or_CC second_JJ day_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT remission_NN accompanied_VBN by_IN sweating_VBG often_RB occurs_VBZ on_IN the_DT second_JJ MEDICAL_NNP ASPECTS_NNP OF_NNP PLAGUE_NNP ._. ]_NN
79_CD day_NN or_CC third_JJ day_NN ,_, the_DT temperature_NN falling_VBG to_TO normal_JJ between_IN the_DT fifth_NN and_CC seventh_JJ days_NNS (_( vide_JJ Chart_NNP XXI_NNP )_) ._.
But_CC in_IN relapsing_VBG fever_NN there_EX is_VBZ giddiness_NN ;_: prostration_NN is_VBZ slight_JJ ;_: jaundice_NN not_RB infrequently_RB occurs_VBZ on_IN the_DT third_JJ or_CC fourth_JJ day_NN ;_: the_DT face_NN is_VBZ flushed_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT expression_NN is_VBZ not_RB stupid_JJ nor_CC confused_JJ ;_: buboes_NNS are_VBP not_RB met_VBN with_IN ;_: and_CC spirilla_NN are_VBP found_VBN in_IN the_DT blood_NN during_IN the_DT height_NN of_IN the_DT fever_NN ._.
Plague_NN in_IN its_PRP$ onset_NN and_CC early_JJ symptoms_NNS somewhat_RB resembles_VBZ typhus_RB fever_NN ._.
But_CC the_DT duskiness_NN and_CC flushing_NN of_IN the_DT face_NN present_NN at_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN typhus_JJ fever_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT occur-_JJ rence_NN of_IN an_DT eruption_NN on_IN the_DT body_NN and_CC limbs_NNS between_IN the_DT fifth_NN and_CC seventh_JJ days_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT different_JJ course_NN of_IN the_DT temperature_NN (_( vide_JJ Chart_NNP IX_NNP )_) ,_, and_CC the_DT absence_NN of_IN buboes_NNS would_MD serve_VB to_TO distinguish_VB between_IN them_PRP ._.
Owing_VBG to_TO the_DT feebleness_NN ,_, thick_JJ utterance_NN and_CC staggering_JJ gait_NN ,_, frequently_RB seen_VBN in_IN plague_NN cases_NNS ,_, the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB mistaken_VBN for_IN alcoholic_JJ poisoning_NN ._.
The_DT following_NN is_VBZ a_DT typical_JJ case_NN ._.
Govind_NNP Jeeva_NNP was_VBD taken_VBN by_IN his_PRP$ friends_NNS for_IN treatment_NN to_TO a_DT qualified_JJ medical_JJ practi-_NN tioner_NN ._.
They_PRP stated_VBD that_IN he_PRP had_VBD had_VBN a_DT fall_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT following_JJ note_NN of_IN his_PRP$ case_NN was_VBD made_VBN :_: ``_`` Pupils_VBZ slightly_RB dilated_VBN ,_, breath_NN smells_NNS very_RB faintly_RB of_IN alcohol_NN ,_, has_VBZ a_DT slight_NN contused_VBN wound_NN over_IN but_CC not_RB exposing_VBG malar_JJ bone_NN ,_, ''_'' and_CC an_DT emetic_NN was_VBD prescribed_VBN ._.
Fortunately_RB this_DT was_VBD not_RB given_VBN ._.
Next_JJ day_NN a_DT note_NN was_VBD made_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: ``_`` Bowels_IN not_RB opened_VBN for_IN two_CD days_NNS ;_: is_VBZ not_RB quite_RB recovered_VBN from_IN the_DT effects_NNS of_IN drink_NN ,_, ''_'' and_CC on_IN the_DT following_JJ day_NN :_: ``_`` Speech_NNP indistinct_NN ,_, temperature_NN 102_CD F._NNP ,_, bowels_VBZ not_RB opened_VBN ._. ''_''
On_IN the_DT fourth_JJ day_NN he_PRP died_VBD ._.
In_IN this_DT case_NN enquiry_NN showed_VBD that_IN the_DT patient_NN had_VBD been_VBN two_CD days_NNS ill_VBP with_IN fever_NN ,_, and_CC was_VBD given_VBN a_DT little_JJ alcohol_NN after_IN having_VBG fallen_VBN down_RP in_IN a_DT faint_NN ._.
He_PRP was_VBD seen_VBN by_IN another_DT medical_JJ man_NN shortly_RB after_IN the_DT emetic_NN was_VBD prescribed_VBN ,_, and_CC found_VBD to_TO have_VB a_DT very_RB frequent_JJ and_CC feeble_JJ pulse_NN ,_, fever_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT typically_RB coated_VBN tongue_NN ._.
The_DT diagnosis_NN of_IN plague_NN was_VBD made_VBN and_CC afterwards_NNS verified_VBN by_IN post-mortem_JJ examination_NN ._.
Had_VBD the_DT case_NN been_VBN one_CD of_IN alcoholic_JJ poisoning_NN ,_, there_EX would_MD have_VB been_VBN a_DT full_JJ and_CC bounding_VBG pulse_RB ,_, a_DT normal_JJ or_CC subnormal_JJ temperature_NN ,_, and_CC considerable_JJ mental_JJ excitement_NN ;_: or_CC in_IN a_DT later_JJ stage_NN drowsiness_NN ,_, or_CC coma_NN with_IN stertorous_JJ breathing_NN ,_, a_DT slow_JJ and_CC compressible_JJ pulse_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT subnormal_JJ temperature_NN ._.
In_IN plague_NN cases_NNS where_WRB abdominal_JJ symptoms_NNS are_VBP marked_VBN and_CC a_DT typhoid_JJ condition_NN has_VBZ supervened_VBN ,_, the_DT diagnostic_JJ features_NNS given_VBN by_IN Captain_NNP Hojel_NNP are_VBP :_: -The_JJ onset_NN is_VBZ sudden_JJ ,_, usually_RB ushered_VBN in_IN by_IN a_DT well-marked_JJ rigor_NN ;_: the_DT temperature_NN shows_VBZ a_DT high_JJ initial_JJ rise_NN in_IN most_JJS cases_NNS ,_, followed_VBN by_IN a_DT marked_JJ remission_NN to_TO normal_JJ (_( or_CC a_DT little_JJ above_IN or_CC below_IN it_PRP )_) on_IN the_DT second_JJ ,_, third_JJ or_CC fourth_JJ day_NN (_( vide_IN Chart_NNP XXIV_NNP )_) ;_: the_DT pulse_NN larger_JJR and_CC full_JJ at_IN first_JJ ,_, becomes_VBZ peculiarly_RB soft_JJ and_CC is_VBZ characterized_VBN by_IN a_DT great_JJ want_NN of_IN sharpness_NN in_IN stroke_NN ;_: it_PRP is_VBZ very_RB compressible_JJ at_IN an_DT early_JJ stage_NN and_CC dicrotic_JJ ,_, but_CC the_DT dicrotism_NN is_VBZ not_RB very_RB easily_RB recognized_VBN by_IN the_DT finger_NN ;_: the_DT aspect_NN is_VBZ dull_JJ ,_, heavy_JJ and_CC apathetic_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT patient_NN has_VBZ a_DT peculiar_JJ stricken_JJ look_NN ;_: the_DT eyes_NNS are_VBP dull_JJ and_CC muddy_JJ looking_VBG ,_, the_DT conjunctiv_NN are_VBP suffused_VBN ,_, but_CC the_DT pupils_NNS in_IN most_JJS cases_NNS are_VBP normal_JJ ;_: there_EX is_VBZ generally_RB flushing_VBG of_IN the_DT face_NN ;_: diarrha_NNS ,_, when_WRB present_NN ,_, is_VBZ simple_JJ ,_, but_CC very_RB offensive_JJ ;_: delirium_NN and_CC other_JJ cerebral_JJ disturbance_NN occur_VBD early_JJ ,_, and_CC there_EX is_VBZ great_JJ prostration_NN from_IN the_DT first_JJ ;_: abdominal_JJ distension_NN occurs_VBZ early_RB ,_, on_IN the_DT third_JJ ,_, fourth_JJ or_CC fifth_JJ day_NN ;_: the_DT eruption_NN is_VBZ not_RB readily_RB effaced_VBN and_CC is_VBZ of_IN a_DT ``_`` deep_JJ red_JJ colour_NN (_( petechial_JJ )_) ''_'' ;_: there_EX is_VBZ severe_JJ lumbar_NN pain_NN in_IN many_JJ cases_NNS ._.
During_IN the_DT present_JJ epidemic_JJ no_DT cases_NNS of_IN glandular_JJ fever_NN among_IN children_NNS or_CC young_JJ adults_NNS were_VBD met_VBN with_IN ;_: nor_CC did_VBD an_DT outbreak_NN ,_, characterized_VBN by_IN the_DT appearance_NN of_IN buboes_NNS ,_, and_CC accom-_JJ panied_VBN by_IN a_DT little_JJ or_CC no_DT constitutional_JJ disturbance_NN ,_, precede_NN or_CC accompany_VB the_DT outbreak_NN of_IN plague_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
Until_IN bacteriological_JJ diagnosis_NN has_VBZ settled_VBN that_IN the_DT microbe_NN in_IN these_DT cases_NNS is_VBZ the_DT plague_NN bacillus_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ premature_JJ to_TO speak_VB of_IN them_PRP as_IN cases_NNS of_IN benign_JJ plague_NN ._.
In_IN Calcutta_NNP a_DT number_NN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN this_DT sort_NN were_VBD seen_VBN ,_, but_CC no_DT outbreak_NN of_IN plague_NN occurred_VBD for_IN over_IN 17_CD months_NNS afterwards_NNS ._.
80_CD [_JJ CHAP_NNP ._.
II_NNP ._.
The_DT bacteriological_JJ diagnosis_NN of_IN plague_NN is_VBZ purposely_RB omitted_VBN from_IN the_DT main_JJ report_NN ,_, to_TO be_VB given_VBN in_IN full_JJ detail_NN in_IN Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP 's_POS report_NN ._.
It_PRP can_MD not_RB be_VB carried_VBN out_RP in_IN practice_NN by_IN medical_JJ men_NNS who_WP have_VBP no_DT special_JJ bacteriological_JJ training_NN nor_CC access_NN to_TO a_DT laboratory_NN ,_, and_CC as_IN they_PRP are_VBP the_DT first_JJ persons_NNS who_WP come_VBP in_IN contact_NN with_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ of_IN especial_JJ importance_NN that_IN they_PRP should_MD be_VB able_JJ to_TO recognise_VB plague_NN cases_NNS by_IN their_PRP$ ordinary_JJ clinical_JJ features_NNS ._.
The_DT prognosis_NN of_IN plague_NN is_VBZ always_RB exceedingly_RB grave_JJ ,_, as_IN it_PRP is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS fatal_JJ of_IN all_DT known_VBN epidemic_JJ diseases_NNS ._.
Dr._NNP Viegas_NNP ,_, who_WP practises_VBZ on_IN the_DT Port_NNP Trust_NNP Estate_NNP ,_, and_CC was_VBD the_DT first_JJ to_TO notice_VB the_DT presence_NN of_IN plague_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP about_IN the_DT third_JJ week_NN in_IN September_NNP 1896_CD ,_, states_VBZ that_IN the_DT mortality_NN during_IN the_DT first_JJ four_CD weeks_NNS after_IN the_DT outbreak_NN was_VBD discovered_VBN lay_NN between_IN 95_CD and_CC 99_CD %_NN ,_, and_CC between_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN October_NNP and_CC the_DT end_NN of_IN November_NNP between_IN 85_CD and_CC 90_CD %_NN ._.
The_DT mortality_NN in_IN 1,579_CD cases_NNS treated_VBN in_IN the_DT Arthur_NNP Road_NNP and_CC Parel_NNP Hospitals_NNP was_VBD 6954_CD %_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT Poona_NNP Plague_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, out_IN of_IN 1,130_CD patients_NNS admitted_VBN ,_, 757_CD died_VBD ,_, giving_VBG a_DT mortality_NN of_IN 67_CD %_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT House_NNP of_IN Correction_NNP ,_, Byculla_NNP ,_, however_RB ,_, where_WRB the_DT entire_JJ number_NN of_IN those_DT attack-_JJ ed_NNS were_VBD admitted_VBN into_IN hospital_NN at_IN once_RB ,_, only_RB 17_CD persons_NNS died_VBD out_IN of_IN 33_CD attacked_NNS ,_, or_CC 5152_CD %_NN ._.
These_DT prisoners_NNS were_VBD all_DT adults_NNS between_IN 20_CD and_CC 50_CD years_NNS of_IN age_NN ,_, in_IN good_JJ bodily_NN health_NN ,_, and_CC carefully_RB attended_VBD to_TO from_IN the_DT time_NN they_PRP fell_VBD ill_RB ._.
In_IN Damaun_NNP ,_, out_IN of_IN 110_CD persons_NNS living_VBG in_IN the_DT same_JJ families_NNS ,_, 54_CD were_VBD attacked_VBN by_IN plague_NN ,_, of_IN whom_WP 37_CD or_CC 6852_CD died_VBD ._.
Under_IN ordinary_JJ conditions_NNS therefore_VBP the_DT mortality_NN among_IN those_DT attacked_VBN during_IN the_DT present_JJ outbreak_NN was_VBD probably_RB between_IN 65_CD and_CC 70_CD %_NN ._.
Looking_VBG at_IN the_DT mortality_NN ,_, according_VBG to_TO race_NN and_CC caste_NN ,_, among_IN the_DT patients_NNS admitted_VBD into_IN Arthur_NNP Road_NNP and_CC Parel_NNP Hospitals_NNP (_( Table_NNP II_NNP )_) ,_, the_DT highest_JJS mortality_NN ,_, 7125_CD %_NN ,_, occurred_VBD amongst_JJ Hindoos_NNP ;_: then_RB follow_VB Jews_NNPS with_IN 6667_CD %_NN ,_, Native_JJ Christians_NNPS with_IN 6545_CD %_NN ,_, Brahmins_VBZ with_IN 6521_CD %_NN ,_, Parsees_NNP with_IN 6429_CD %_NN ,_, and_CC Muhammadans_NNPS with_IN 6424-the_JJ number_NN of_IN Jews_NNP (_( 9_CD )_) ,_, Brahmins_NNP (_( 23_CD )_) ,_, and_CC Parsees_NNP (_( 14_CD )_) ,_, however_RB ,_, were_VBD too_RB small_JJ to_TO give_VB reliable_JJ results_NNS ._.
Among_IN Europeans_NNPS and_CC Eurasians_NNPS a_DT much_RB lower_JJR death-rate_NN ,_, 3895_CD ,_, occurred_VBD ,_, owing_VBG most_JJS probably_RB to_TO their_PRP$ possessing_NN more_RBR stamina_JJ ,_, and_CC being_VBG treated_VBN earlier_JJR and_CC more_RBR carefully_RB nursed_VBN during_IN the_DT attack_NN ._.
Out_IN of_IN 34_CD Europeans_NNPS admitted_VBN into_IN St._NNP George_NNP 's_POS Hospital_NNP ,_, 23_CD recovered_VBD and_CC 11_CD died_VBD ,_, the_DT percentage_NN of_IN deaths_NNS to_TO attacks_NNS being_VBG 3235_CD ,_, -while_VBZ out_IN of_IN 61_CD Eurasians_NNS under_IN treatment_NN ,_, 58_CD recovered_VBD and_CC 37_CD died_VBD ,_, or_CC 4262_CD %_NN of_IN deaths_NNS to_TO attacks_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD noticed_VBN that_IN while_IN among_IN natives_NNS the_DT lowest_JJS percentage_NN of_IN deaths_NNS to_TO attacks_NNS occurred_VBD between_IN the_DT ages_NNS of_IN 1_CD and_CC 20_CD years_NNS ,_, in_IN Europeans_NNPS and_CC Eurasians_NNPS it_PRP lay_VBD between_IN the_DT ages_NNS of_IN 20_CD and_CC 40_CD years_NNS ;_: also_RB that_IN between_IN 20_CD and_CC 40_CD years_NNS the_DT percentage_NN of_IN deaths_NNS to_TO attacks_NNS was_VBD twice_RB as_RB high_JJ among_IN natives_NNS (_( 6975_CD )_) as_IN among_IN Europeans_NNPS and_CC Eurasians_NNPS (_( 3421_CD )_) ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ impossible_JJ to_TO give_VB any_DT definite_JJ prognosis_NN with_IN regard_NN to_TO individual_JJ plague_NN cases_NNS ,_, as_IN sometimes_RB those_DT that_IN appear_VBP to_TO be_VB quite_RB hopeless_JJ recover_NN ,_, while_IN others_NNS apparently_RB much_RB less_RBR severe_JJ die_NN ._.
The_DT conditions_NNS regarded_VBD as_IN most_JJS unfavourable_JJ are_VBP the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN its_PRP$ septicmic_JJ form_NN ,_, or_CC as_IN primary_JJ plague-pneumonia_NN ._.
Among_IN cases_NNS in_IN which_WDT buboes_NNS are_VBP found_VBN ,_, those_DT where_WRB the_DT buboes_NNS are_VBP situated_VBN in_IN the_DT cervical_JJ region_NN appear_VB to_TO be_VB more_RBR unfavourable_JJ than_IN those_DT with_IN buboes_NNS in_IN the_DT axilla_NN or_CC groin_NN ;_: and_CC cases_NNS with_IN multiple_JJ buboes_NNS are_VBP more_RBR unfavourable_JJ than_IN those_DT with_IN single_JJ buboes_NNS ._.
The_DT symptoms_NNS which_WDT are_VBP generally_RB looked_VBN upon_IN as_IN unfavourable_JJ are_VBP the_DT persistence_NN of_IN severe_JJ and_CC continuous_JJ vomiting_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT early_JJ appearance_NN of_IN diarrha_NN ,_, the_DT early_JJ onset_NN and_CC continuance_NN of_IN violent_JJ MEDICAL_NNP ASPECTS_NNP OF_NNP PLAGUE_NNP ._. ]_NN
81_CD delirium_NN ,_, or_CC the_DT setting_NN in_IN of_IN coma_NN ._.
The_DT appearance_NN of_IN petechi_NN is_VBZ generally_RB believed_VBN to_TO precede_VB death_NN ,_, and_CC hmorrhages_NNS from_IN the_DT kidneys_NNS and_CC bowels_NNS are_VBP considered_VBN very_RB unfavourable_JJ ._.
Attacks_NNS occurring_VBG late_RB in_IN the_DT epidemic_JJ ,_, although_IN often_RB no_DT less_RBR severe_RB in_IN their_PRP$ onset_NN (_( Chart_NNP XXVI_NNP )_) ,_, run_VB a_DT milder_NN course_NN than_IN those_DT occurring_VBG at_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN the_DT outbreak_NN ._.
Treatment.-No_NNP specific_JJ remedy_NN has_VBZ up_RP to_TO the_DT present_JJ been_VBN discovered_VBN for_IN the_DT treat-_JJ ment_NN of_IN plagure_NN cases_NNS ._.
During_IN the_DT present_JJ epidemic_JJ two_CD lines_NNS of_IN treatment_NN have_VBP been_VBN tried_VBN ,_, the_DT one_CD ,_, hygienic_NN and_CC symptomatic_JJ ,_, with_IN the_DT object_NN of_IN tiding_VBG the_DT patient_NN over_IN a_DT certain_JJ period_NN ,_, when_WRB ,_, as_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT other_JJ specific_JJ fevers_NNS ,_, experience_NN has_VBZ shown_VBN that_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT natural_JJ tendency_NN to_TO recovery_NN ;_: the_DT other_JJ ,_, the_DT antitoxic_NN treatment_NN ,_, with_IN the_DT object_NN of_IN neutralizing_VBG by_IN means_NNS of_IN antitoxic_NN serum_VBP the_DT virus_NN produced_VBN by_IN the_DT microbe_NN ,_, and_CC of_IN preventing_VBG the_DT growth_NN of_IN the_DT bacillus_NN itself_PRP ._.
The_DT hygienic_NN and_CC symptomatic_JJ treatment_NN consists_VBZ in_IN economising_VBG ,_, as_RB far_RB as_IN possible_JJ ,_, the_DT nervous_JJ and_CC muscular_JJ energy_NN of_IN the_DT patient_NN by_IN placing_VBG him_PRP under_IN the_DT most_RBS favourable_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC treating_VBG symptoms_NNS ._.
With_IN this_DT object_NN a_DT plague_NN patient_NN is_VBZ put_VBN to_TO bed_NN at_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, kept_VBD in_IN the_DT recumbent_NN posture_NN (_( on_IN account_NN of_IN the_DT tendency_NN which_WDT there_EX is_VBZ to_TO fatal_JJ syncope_NN )_) until_IN convalesence_NN is_VBZ established_VBN ,_, and_CC supplied_VBD with_IN suitable_JJ nourish-_JJ ment_NN at_IN short_JJ intervals_NNS ._.
The_DT symptoms_NNS which_WDT require_VBP special_JJ attention_NN are_VBP those_DT connected_VBN with_IN the_DT nervous_JJ system_NN and_CC with_IN the_DT circulation_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT nervous_JJ system_NN they_PRP are_VBP mainly_RB due_JJ to_TO congestion_NN of_IN the_DT nervous_JJ centres_NNS at_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT attack_NN ,_, followed_VBN by_IN dema_NN towards_NNS its_PRP$ close_NN ,_, the_DT former_JJ giving_VBG rise_NN to_TO fever_VB ,_, headache_NN ,_, vomiting_VBG ,_, insomnia_NN ,_, and_CC delirium_NN ,_, the_DT latter_NN to_TO stupor_VB and_CC coma_VB ._.
These_DT symptoms_NNS are_VBP treated_VBN on_IN general_JJ lines_NNS ,_, i._NN e._NN ,_, the_DT avoidance_NN of_IN light_NN ,_, the_DT application_NN of_IN ice_NN or_CC cold_JJ water_NN to_TO the_DT head_NN and_CC surface_NN of_IN the_DT body_NN if_IN the_DT temperature_NN continues_VBZ high_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT use_NN of_IN hypnotics_NNS and_CC sedatives_NNS for_IN sleeplessness_NN and_CC delirium_NN ._.
In_IN connection_NN with_IN the_DT circulation_NN the_DT symptoms_NNS to_TO be_VB combated_VBN are_VBP vasomotor_JJ paralysis_NN and_CC heart_NN failure_NN ,_, the_DT latter_NN probably_RB due_RB partly_RB to_TO the_DT direct_JJ action_NN of_IN the_DT toxic_JJ poison_NN on_IN the_DT cardiac_JJ ganglia_NN and_CC partly_RB to_TO softening_VBG and_CC degeneration_NN of_IN the_DT muscular_JJ wall_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN ._.
For_IN these_DT symptoms_NNS the_DT use_NN of_IN alcohol_NN in_IN some_DT form_NN is_VBZ generally_RB required_VBN after_IN the_DT first_JJ day_NN ;_: in_IN most_JJS cases_NNS also_RB the_DT administration_NN of_IN drugs_NNS which_WDT act_VBP as_IN cardiac_JJ tonics_NNS and_CC vascular_JJ stimulants_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN ammonia_NN ,_, digitalis_NN ,_, strychnine_NN ,_, quinine_NN is_VBZ found_VBN necessary_JJ ._.
All_DT drugs_NNS which_WDT depress_VBP the_DT heart_NN and_CC circulation_NN should_MD ,_, as_RB far_RB as_IN possible_JJ ,_, be_VB avoided_VBN ._.
The_DT treatment_NN of_IN pneumonia_NN ,_, primary_JJ or_CC secondary_JJ ,_, calls_VBZ for_IN the_DT free_JJ administration_NN of_IN stimulants_NNS and_CC of_IN stimulating_JJ expectorants_NNS for_IN the_DT relief_NN of_IN cough_NN and_CC dyspna_NN ,_, due_JJ to_TO the_DT accumulation_NN of_IN fluid_NN in_IN the_DT bronchial_JJ tubes_NN ._.
Gastro-intestinal_JJ symptoms_NNS ,_, buboes_NNS ,_, and_CC such_JJ other_JJ complications_NNS as_IN arise_NN are_VBP managed_VBN on_IN general_JJ principles_NNS ._.
In_IN treatment_NN by_IN antitoxine_VBG the_DT correct_JJ principle_NN of_IN removing_VBG the_DT cause_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ aimed_VBN at_IN ,_, but_CC up_RB to_TO the_DT present_JJ time_NN ,_, so_RB far_RB as_IN information_NN is_VBZ obtainable_JJ of_IN M._NNP Yersin_NNP 's_POS results_NNS ,_, and_CC those_DT of_IN other_JJ doctors_NNS ,_, French_JJ and_CC Russian_JJ ,_, who_WP have_VBP tried_VBN it_PRP ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ failed_VBN to_TO influence_VB favourably_RB the_DT mortality_NN among_IN those_DT attacked_VBN ._.
Surgeon-Captain_NNP Thomson_NNP ,_, the_DT Medical_NNP Officer_NNP in_IN charge_NN of_IN Parel_NNP Plague_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, supplies_VBZ a_DT tabular_JJ statement_NN (_( vide_IN Table_NNP VIII_NNP )_) ,_, showing_VBG the_DT details_NNS of_IN 27_CD cases_NNS under_IN his_PRP$ 21_CD 82_CD [_JJ CHAP_NNP ._.
II_NNP ._.
care_NN treated_VBN by_IN M._NNP Yersin_NNP 's_POS antitoxic_JJ serum_NN ._.
From_IN these_DT 27_CD cases_NNS he_PRP excluded_VBD 4_CD (_( 2_CD of_IN which_WDT died_VBD and_CC 2_CD recovered_VBN )_) ,_, viz._FW ,_, one_CD suffering_NN from_IN meningitis_NN and_CC an_DT osseous_JJ tumour_NN pressing_VBG on_IN the_DT medulla_NN (_( case_NN 4_CD )_) ,_, one_CD treated_VBN prophylactically_RB (_( case_NN 11_CD )_) and_CC two_CD which_WDT were_VBD not_RB plague_JJ cases_NNS (_( cases_NNS 24_CD and_CC 27_CD )_) ._.
Of_IN the_DT remaining_VBG 23_CD plague_NN cases_NNS ,_, 14_CD or_CC 60.83_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
died_VBN ._.
[_VB A_DT reference_NN to_TO an_DT antitoxic_JJ serum_NN prepared_VBN by_IN Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP ,_, but_CC distinct_VBZ from_IN his_PRP$ well-_JJ known_VBN prophylatic_JJ ,_, occurs_VBZ in_IN Dr._NNP Lyons_NNP '_POS report_NN at_IN this_DT point_NN ,_, but_CC as_IN the_DT results_NNS are_VBP not_RB given_VBN it_PRP is_VBZ omitted.-J_JJ ._.
K._NNP C._NNP ]_VBD The_DT prophylactic_JJ measures_NNS which_WDT demand_VBP attention_NN on_IN the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN a_DT case_NN of_IN plague_NN in_IN a_DT family_NN are_VBP the_DT removal_NN ,_, when_WRB practicable_JJ ,_, of_IN the_DT unaffected_JJ members_NNS from_IN the_DT house_NN ,_, to_TO allow_VB of_IN its_PRP$ being_VBG thoroughly_RB cleaned_VBN ,_, and_CC of_IN the_DT patient_NN to_TO a_DT hospital_NN where_WRB he_PRP can_MD receive_VB proper_JJ care_NN and_CC attention_NN ,_, unless_IN suitable_JJ provision_NN can_MD be_VB made_VBN for_IN his_PRP$ treatment_NN at_IN home_NN ._.
All_PDT those_DT who_WP have_VBP been_VBN living_VBG with_IN him_PRP should_MD undergo_VB inoculation_NN against_IN plague_NN ,_, as_IN this_DT is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO diminish_VB the_DT risk_NN of_IN infection_NN by_IN 70_CD to_TO 80_CD per_IN cent._NN ,_, and_CC to_TO increase_VB the_DT prospect_NN of_IN recovery_NN in_IN those_DT attacked_VBN after_IN inoculation_NN by_IN 60_CD to_TO 70_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
(_( vide_JJ report_NN on_IN inocula-_JJ tion_NN )_) ._.
The_DT patient_NN 's_POS sputa_NN and_CC excreta_NN and_CC all_DT discharges_NNS from_IN buboes_NNS and_CC sores_NNS should_MD be_VB received_VBN in_IN vessels_NNS containing_VBG suitable_JJ disinfectants_NNS ,_, and_CC on_IN the_DT termination_NN of_IN the_DT illness_NN everything_NN which_WDT was_VBD used_VBN by_IN him_PRP ,_, or_CC had_VBD been_VBN rendered_VBN liable_JJ to_TO contamination_NN ,_, should_MD be_VB thoroughly_RB cleansed_VBN and_CC disinfected_VBN ,_, or_CC ,_, if_IN practicable_JJ ,_, burnt_JJ (_( vide_IN Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP 's_POS Report_NNP )_) ._.
Nurses_NNS and_CC attendants_NNS who_WP are_VBP in_IN close_JJ and_CC constant_JJ attendance_NN on_IN plague_NN patients_NNS ,_, should_MD undergo_VB inoculation_NN ._.
All_DT wounds_NNS and_CC abrasions_NNS on_IN the_DT hands_NNS ,_, etc._FW ,_, should_MD be_VB pro-_JJ tected_VBN from_IN the_DT risk_NN of_IN infection_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT hands_NNS should_MD be_VB thoroughly_RB washed_VBN and_CC disinfected_VBN after_IN dressing_VBG sores_NNS or_CC otherwise_RB becoming_VBG soiled_VBN ._.
Their_PRP$ natural_JJ immunity_NN should_MD be_VB increased_VBN as_RB much_JJ as_IN possible_JJ by_IN regular_JJ meals_NNS ,_, sufficient_JJ exercise_NN and_CC rest_NN ,_, to_TO ensure_VB their_PRP$ keeping_VBG in_IN good_JJ health_NN ._.

22_CD 86_CD [_JJ CHAP_NNP ._.
II_NNP ._.
II.-REPORT_JJ BY_NNP SURGEON-CAPTAIN_NNP L._NNP F._NNP CHILDE_NNP ,_, I._NNP M._NNP S._NNP I.-ON_NNP THE_NNP POST-MORTEM_NNP APPEARANCES_NNP OF_NNP PLAGUE_NNP ._.
THE_DT bodies_NNS examined_VBN were_VBD for_IN the_DT most_JJS part_NN those_DT of_IN well-nourished_JJ adults_NNS of_IN the_DT servant_NN and_CC labouring_NN classes_NNS ._.
Usually_RB the_DT skin_NN was_VBD found_VBN intact_JJ ,_, except_IN that_IN there_EX were_VBD cracks_NNS and_CC abrasions_NNS about_IN the_DT hands_NNS and_CC feet_NNS ,_, resulting_VBG from_IN occupation_NN ,_, and_CC also_RB in_IN many_JJ cases_NNS marks_NNS of_IN the_DT common_JJ parasitic_JJ skin_NN diseases_NNS ,_, especially_RB ringworm_JJ and_CC itch_NN ;_: and_CC although_IN clinically_RB various_JJ skin-lesions_NNS were_VBD met_VBN with_IN ,_, such_JJ as_IN sloughing_VBG at_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN the_DT bubo_NN ,_, boils_NNS and_CC ulcers_NNS ,_, yet_RB in_IN these_DT cases_NNS recovery_NN generally_RB took_VBD place_NN ,_, and_CC I_PRP had_VBD no_DT opportunity_NN of_IN observing_VBG such_JJ conditions_NNS in_IN the_DT post-mortem_JJ room_NN ._.
The_DT following_JJ varieties_NNS of_IN plague_NN were_VBD met_VBN with_IN :_: -_: The_DT Bubonic_NNP Form_NNP ._.
The_DT Septicmic_NNP Form_NNP or_CC Plague-Septiomia_NNP ._.
The_DT Pneumonic_NNP Form_NNP or_CC Plague-Pneumonia_NNP ._.
A.-THE_NNP BUBONIC_NNP FORM_NNP ._.
Bubonic_NNP Plague_NNP ._.
The_DT bubo_NN was_VBD usually_RB situated_VBN in_IN the_DT groin_NN of_IN either_DT side_NN ,_, less_JJR commonly_RB in_IN the_DT axilla_NN ,_, rarely_RB in_IN the_DT neck_NN ,_, and_CC most_JJS rarely_RB in_IN the_DT supra-trochlear_JJ or_CC popliteal_JJ region_NN ;_: the_DT limb_NN corresponding_VBG to_TO the_DT bubo_NN was_VBD swollen_VBN and_CC dematous_JJ and_CC petechi_NNS were_VBD usually_RB seen_VBN upon_IN it_PRP ,_, but_CC they_PRP were_VBD always_RB in_IN greatest_JJS number_NN over_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN the_DT bubo_NN itself_PRP ;_: and_CC though_IN there_EX might_MD be_VB some_DT over_IN the_DT body_NN generally_RB ,_, still_RB these_DT were_VBD but_CC few_JJ ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN an_DT axillary_JJ bubo_NN ,_, the_DT whole_JJ axilla_NN looked_VBD full_JJ and_CC smooth_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT swelling_NN extended_VBD down_RP the_DT side_NN nearly_RB to_TO the_DT margin_NN of_IN the_DT ribs_NN ,_, down_IN the_DT inner_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT arm_NN to_TO the_DT elbow_NN ,_, and_CC over_IN the_DT anterior_JJ and_CC posterior_JJ axillary_JJ folds_NNS ._.
On_IN dissection_NN there_EX was_VBD an_DT enormous_JJ mass_NN of_IN dark_NN coagulated_VBN blood_NN and_CC serum_NN which_WDT occupied_VBD the_DT whole_JJ axilla_NN and_CC included_VBD the_DT glands_NNS ,_, so_IN that_IN the_DT whole_JJ mass_NN had_VBD to_TO be_VB removed_VBN together_RB ;_: and_CC on_IN incision_NN this_DT was_VBD found_VBN to_TO consist_VB of_IN the_DT connective_JJ tissue_NN of_IN the_DT part_NN gorged_VBD with_IN blood_NN and_CC of_IN coagula_NN due_JJ to_TO hmorrhages_NNS ,_, whilst_NN within_IN were_VBD seen_VBN the_DT glands_NNS ._.
In_IN recent_JJ cases_NNS ,_, of_IN four_CD or_CC five_CD days_NNS '_POS duration_NN ,_, there_EX were_VBD some_DT of_IN a_DT deep_JJ red_NN and_CC some_DT of_IN a_DT lighter_NN red_JJ colour_NN ,_, but_CC all_DT intensely_RB engorged_VBN and_CC solid_JJ ,_, not_RB breaking_VBG down_RP ,_, but_CC a_DT little_JJ soft_JJ from_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN blood_NN in_IN them_PRP ;_: whilst_NN in_IN older_JJR cases_NNS ,_, of_IN seven_CD or_CC eight_CD days_NNS ,_, the_DT glands_NNS were_VBD softer_JJR ,_, more_RBR pink_NN in_IN colour_NN and_CC almost_RB diffluent_NN ,_, suggesting_VBG in_IN fact_NN the_DT appearance_NN of_IN a_DT rather_RB soft_JJ spleen_NN ._.
The_DT glands_NNS were_VBD rounded_VBN or_CC oval_VBN in_IN shape_NN ,_, and_CC varied_VBD in_IN size_NN from_IN a_DT walnut_NN to_TO a_DT pea_NN ._.
As_IN a_DT rule_NN ,_, too_RB ,_, the_DT smallest_JJS glands_NNS were_VBD the_DT deepest_JJS in_IN colour_NN and_CC most_JJS solid_JJ ,_, whilst_WP the_DT largest_JJS were_VBD of_IN a_DT lighter_NN red_JJ colour_NN and_CC softer_JJR consistence_NN ._.
The_DT axillary_JJ vessels_NNS were_VBD pressed_VBN upon_IN and_CC surrounded_VBN by_IN the_DT enlarged_JJ glands_NNS and_CC extravasated_VBD blood_NN ,_, so_IN that_DT in_IN fact_NN they_PRP became_VBD incorporated_VBN in_IN the_DT bubo_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP was_VBD mainly_RB by_IN this_DT pressure_NN on_IN the_DT axillary_JJ vein_NN that_IN the_DT dematous_JJ condition_NN of_IN the_DT arm_NN ,_, as_IN referred_VBN to_TO above_VB ,_, was_VBD produced_VBN ._.
The_DT hmorrhage_NN and_CC coagula_NN extended_VBN beyond_IN the_DT axilla_NN and_CC were_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT areolar_JJ tissue_NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN amongst_NN the_DT muscles_NNS ,_, but_CC more_JJR between_IN them_PRP than_IN in_IN their_PRP$ substance_NN ;_: this_DT condition_NN also_RB extended_VBD down_RP the_DT arm_NN and_CC could_MD be_VB seen_VBN in_IN the_DT areolar_JJ tissue_NN as_RB far_RB as_IN the_DT elbow_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD also_RB much_JJ clear_JJ dema_NN fluid_NN which_WDT assisted_VBD in_IN forming_VBG the_DT swelling_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT axilla_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN beyond_IN its_PRP$ borders_NNS ._.
The_DT bubo_NN thus_RB was_VBD found_VBN to_TO consist_VB ,_, not_RB of_IN a_DT single_JJ enlarged_JJ gland_NN but_CC of_IN a_DT chain_NN of_IN glands_NNS of_IN various_JJ sizes_NNS ,_, surrounded_VBN by_IN a_DT mass_NN of_IN engorged_JJ areolar_JJ tissue_NN ,_, coagulated_VBN blood_NN and_CC dema_NN fluid_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN a_DT bubo_NN in_IN the_DT groin_NN there_EX was_VBD a_DT similar_JJ diffuse_NN swelling_NN in_IN Scarpa_NNP 's_POS Triangle_NNP extending_NN to_TO the_DT neighbouring_NN parts_NNS ;_: whilst_NN when_WRB the_DT bubo_NN was_VBD in_IN the_DT cervical_JJ A_NNP (_( Charts_NNP I_PRP to_TO X_VB referred_VBN to_TO in_IN Major_JJ Lyons_NNP '_POS Report_NNP )_) I_PRP L_NNP (_( E_NNP )_) L._NNP Femoral_NNP Bubo_NNP Suppurated_NNP Rec_NNP ._.
