The_DT small_JJ ones_NNS were_VBD MEDICAL_NNP ASPECTS_NNP OF_NNP PLAGUE_NNP ._. ]_NN
101_CD granular_JJ and_CC stained_VBN well_RB throughout_IN ,_, but_CC the_DT large_JJ were_VBD breaking_VBG down_RP in_IN parts_NNS and_CC irregularly_RB stained_VBN ._.
The_DT small_JJ ones_NNS were_VBD distinctly_RB rounded_VBN and_CC no_DT liver-tissue_NN was_VBD seen_VBN in_IN them_PRP ,_, but_CC some_DT of_IN the_DT large_JJ were_VBD less_JJR regular_JJ in_IN shape_NN and_CC contained_VBD some_DT distinct_JJ remains_NNS of_IN liver-cells_NNS :_: these_DT were_VBD probably_RB two_CD or_CC three_CD adjoining_NN masses_NNS which_WDT had_VBD coalesced_VBN ._.
Speaking_VBG generally_RB ,_, the_DT small_JJ masses_NNS were_VBD mostly_RB situated_VBN near_IN the_DT portal_JJ spaces_NNS ,_, but_CC this_DT could_MD not_RB be_VB said_VBD of_IN the_DT larger_JJR ,_, as_IN some_DT were_VBD as_RB big_JJ as_IN two_CD or_CC three_CD lobules_NNS ._.
Under_IN higher_JJR power_NN the_DT masses_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN to_TO consist_VB of_IN leucocytes_NNS ,_, pus-cells_NNS ,_, granular_JJ dbris_NN and_CC remains_NNS of_IN liver-cells_NNS ,_, and_CC there_RB appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB an_DT excess_NN of_IN leucocytes_NNS in_IN the_DT surrounding_NN capillaries_NNS ;_: in_IN fact_NN ,_, the_DT structure_NN of_IN the_DT masses_NNS resembled_VBD that_IN of_IN small_JJ early_JJ abscesses_NNS ._.
Specimens_NNS of_IN the_DT liver_NN were_VBD also_RB prepared_VBN to_TO show_VB the_DT plague-bacilli_NN in_IN situ_NN in_IN the_DT sections_NNS ;_: enormous_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN them_PRP could_MD be_VB seen_VBN in_IN the_DT masses_NNS and_CC only_RB a_DT few_JJ in_IN the_DT general_JJ liver-tissue_NN ._.
Cultures_NNS also_RB were_VBD made_VBN from_IN the_DT masses_NNS ,_, and_CC typical_JJ colonies_NNS of_IN the_DT plague-bacillus_JJ grew_VBD in_IN abundance_NN ._.
Thus_RB these_DT small_JJ necrotic_JJ masses_NNS resulted_VBD from_IN the_DT growth_NN of_IN the_DT plague-bacillus_NN in_IN innumerable_JJ definite_NN areas_NNS throughout_IN the_DT whole_JJ liver_NN ,_, and_CC are_VBP compar-_JJ able_JJ with_IN the_DT pneumonic_JJ patches_NNS found_VBN in_IN cases_NNS of_IN plague-pneumonia_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT same_JJ cause_NN ._.
This_DT condition_NN of_IN the_DT liver_NN was_VBD extremely_RB rare_JJ ,_, and_CC was_VBD only_RB observed_VBN in_IN two_CD other_JJ cases_NNS during_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP epidemic_NN ,_, once_RB by_IN the_DT Austrian_JJ and_CC once_RB by_IN the_DT Russian_JJ Plague_NNP Com-_NNP mission_NN ._.
No_DT similar_JJ condition_NN was_VBD ever_RB found_VBN in_IN the_DT spleen_NN or_CC kidneys_NNS to_TO the_DT best_JJS of_IN my_PRP$ belief_NN ._.
Lung.-Cultures_NNS made_VBN from_IN the_DT pueumonic_JJ patch_NN showed_VBD the_DT appearance_NN not_RB of_IN plague_NN but_CC of_IN Fraenkel_NNP 's_POS Pneumococcus_NNP ;_: and_CC specimens_VBZ taken_VBN from_IN the_DT patch_NN showed_VBD the_DT same_JJ pneumococcus_NN under_IN the_DT microscope_NN ._.
Cultures_NNS made_VBN from_IN the_DT inguinal_JJ and_CC axillary_JJ glands_NNS ,_, from_IN the_DT spleen_NN and_CC from_IN the_DT heart_NN 's_POS blood_NN ,_, all_DT showed_VBD the_DT typical_JJ growth_NN of_IN plague_NN ._.
These_DT cultvies_NNS were_VBD made_VBN by_IN Professor_NNP Bitter_NNP ,_, who_WP has_VBZ kindly_RB permitted_VBN me_PRP to_TO make_VB use_NN of_IN his_PRP$ results_NNS ._.
Note.-This_NNP was_VBD the_DT only_JJ case_NN amongst_VBD the_DT autopsies_NNS on_IN plague_NN made_VBN by_IN myself_PRP in_IN which_WDT secondary_JJ pneumonia_NN was_VBD found_VBN ,_, not_RB due_JJ to_TO plague_VB ._.
G.-CASE_NNP OF_NNP PLAGUE_NNP IN_NNP A_NNP PREGNANT_NNP WOMAN_NNP ._.
SURVIVAL_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP FTUS_NNP :_: DEATH_NN OF_IN THE_NNP MOTHER_NNP ._.
D._NNP R._NNP ,_, Hindu_NNP woman_NN ,_, 25_CD years_NNS old_JJ ,_, was_VBD admitted_VBN to_TO hospital_VB for_IN child-birth_NN on_IN 15th_CD April_NNP 1897_CD at_IN 11_CD P.M._NNP She_PRP stated_VBD that_IN she_PRP was_VBD five_CD days_NNS short_RB of_IN her_PRP$ full_JJ term_NN of_IN gestation_NN ,_, that_WDT for_IN the_DT past_JJ several_JJ days_NNS she_PRP had_VBD had_VBN fever_VBN preceded_VBN by_IN rigors_NNS ,_, and_CC that_IN a_DT few_JJ hours_NNS before_IN admission_NN she_PRP felt_VBD some_DT pains_NNS in_IN the_DT abdomen_NNS of_IN a_DT bearing-down_JJ character_NN and_CC thought_VBD she_PRP was_VBD about_IN to_TO be_VB confined_VBN ._.
On_IN admission_NN she_PRP was_VBD examined_VBN and_CC found_VBN not_RB to_TO be_VB in_IN labour_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT pains_NNS were_VBD thought_VBN to_TO be_VB false_JJ ._.
She_PRP was_VBD quite_RB conscious_JJ and_CC able_JJ to_TO walk_VB ;_: temperature_NN 102_CD ._.
She_PRP stated_VBD that_IN she_PRP had_VBD two_CD children_NNS ,_, and_CC that_IN her_PRP$ previous_JJ confinements_NNS were_VBD normal_JJ ._.
On_IN 16th_CD morning_NN ,_, temperature_NN 102_CD ,_, no_DT pain_NN in_IN abdomen_NNS ,_, slight_JJ pain_NN and_CC tenderness_NN over_IN right_JJ inguinal_JJ region_NN ,_, and_CC some_DT glands_NNS could_MD be_VB felt_VBN a_DT little_JJ enlarged_NN ._.
Patient_NNP had_VBD a_DT peculiar_JJ drowsy_JJ expression_NN of_IN features_NNS ,_, with_IN injection_NN of_IN conjunctiv_NN ,_, and_CC looked_VBD very_RB ill_RB ._.
The_DT temperature_NN remained_VBD high_JJ and_CC at_IN 4_CD P.M._NNP was_VBD 104_CD ._.
At_IN this_DT hour_NN labour_NN pains_NNS commenced_VBD ._.
She_PRP now_RB complained_VBD of_IN some_DT pain_NN in_IN both_DT sides_NNS of_IN the_DT neck_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT cervical_JJ glands_NNS were_VBD tender_NN and_CC slightly_RB enlarged_VBD ;_: also_RB the_DT pain_NN in_IN the_DT right_JJ inguinal_JJ glands_NNS persisted_VBN ._.
At_IN 10_CD P.M._NNP the_DT patient_NN was_VBD very_RB restless_JJ ;_: temperature_NN 105_CD ;_: labour_NN was_VBD progress-_JJ ing_NN normally_RB ._.
At_IN 10-50_CD P.M._NNP labour_NN was_VBD completed_VBN normally_RB ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT unusual_JJ 26_CD 102_CD [_JJ CHAP_NNP ._.
II_NNP ._.
hmorrhage_NN ,_, merely_RB the_DT average_JJ loss_NN of_IN blood_NN ._.
Patient_NN was_VBD much_RB exhausted_VBN ,_, temperature_NN 102_CD ,_, pulse_RB 140_CD ,_, respiration_NN 72_CD per_IN minute_NN ,_, with_IN considerable_JJ dyspna_NN ._.
The_DT temperature_NN gradually_RB rose_VBD to_TO 104_CD ,_, and_CC there_RB was_VBD much_JJ prostration_NN ,_, dyspna_NN ,_, and_CC cardiac_JJ failure_NN ._.
17th_CD ,_, patient_NN died_VBD at_IN 7-55_NNP A.M_NNP ._.
The_DT child_NN was_VBD 18_CD inches_NNS in_IN length_NN and_CC weighed_VBD 4_CD lbs._NN ,_, and_CC although_IN small_JJ ,_, it_PRP was_VBD fully_RB developed_VBN ._.
It_PRP remained_VBD perfectly_RB well_RB ,_, throve_VB ,_, and_CC after_IN 20_CD days_NNS was_VBD sent_VBN to_TO a_DT foundling_NN home_NN ._.
When_WRB last_JJ heard_NN of_IN on_IN June_NNP 1st_CD ,_, it_PRP was_VBD still_RB in_IN good_JJ health_NN ._.
It_PRP never_RB showed_VBD the_DT slightest_JJS sign_NN of_IN plague_NN or_CC of_IN any_DT illness_JJ whatever_NN ._.
Post-mortem_JJ examination_NN of_IN the_DT mother_NN was_VBD made_VBN three_CD hours_NNS after_IN death_NN ._.
Body_NNP well_RB nourished_RB ,_, no_DT petechi_NN on_IN skin_NN ,_, hmorrhages_NNS under_IN conjunctiv_NN ,_, rigor_NN mortis_NN present_NN ._.
Heart.-Petechi_NNP under_IN visceral_JJ and_CC parietal_JJ pericardium_NN ;_: heart-muscle_NN looked_VBD firm_NN ;_: there_EX were_VBD post-mortem_JJ clots_NNS in_IN the_DT cavities_NNS and_CC in_IN the_DT aorta_NN ._.
Vena_NNP Cava.-Great_NNP engorgement_NN of_IN its_PRP$ coats_NNS and_CC many_JJ hmorrhages_NNS under_IN the_DT inner_JJ coat_NN ,_, giving_VBG it_PRP a_DT mottled_JJ appearance_NN ;_: these_DT were_VBD seen_VBN in_IN the_DT abdominal_JJ vena_NN cava_NN as_RB well_RB ._.
Lungs.-Intense_JJ engorgement_NN and_CC derna_NN ;_: there_EX was_VBD one_CD small_JJ round_NN patch_NN of_IN early_JJ pneumonia_NN at_IN the_DT back_NN of_IN the_DT left_NN lung_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD light_JJ red_JJ and_CC fairly_RB solid_JJ ,_, with_IN recent_JJ pleu-_JJ risy_NN over_IN it_PRP ._.
There_EX were_VBD small_JJ hmorrhages_NNS under_IN both_DT pleur_NN ._.
Bronchial_NNP mucous_JJ mem-_JJ brane_NN much_RB engorged_VBD ,_, purple_NN and_CC swollen_NN ;_: the_DT tubes_NNS contained_VBD frothy_JJ watery_NN fluid_NN ,_, but_CC no_DT pus_NN ._.
Liver.-A_JJ little_JJ large_JJ ,_, its_PRP$ substance_NN rather_RB pale_JJ and_CC soft_JJ and_CC much_JJ engorgement_NN of_IN vessels_NNS ._.
Spleen.-Rather_NNP large_JJ and_CC soft_JJ ,_, of_IN purple_JJ colour_NN and_CC engorged_VBD ;_: the_DT Malpighian_JJ bodies_NNS were_VBD prominent_JJ and_CC appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB engorged_VBN ._.
Kidney.-Hmorrhages_NNS under_IN capsule_NN ,_, engorgement_NN of_IN vessels_NNS ;_: the_DT kidney_NN substance_NN pale_NN and_CC soft_JJ ._.
There_EX were_VBD hmorrhages_NNS in_IN the_DT pelvis_NN and_CC calices_NNS and_CC the_DT whole_JJ ureter_NN was_VBD purple_JJ red_JJ with_IN distinct_JJ hmorrhages_NNS under_IN its_PRP$ inner_JJ coat_NN ._.
The_DT bladder_NN contained_VBD urine_JJ ,_, and_CC there_EX were_VBD hmorrhages_NNS into_IN its_PRP$ mucous_JJ coat_NN ._.
Uterus.-Large_NN ,_, as_IN of_IN a_DT woman_NN recently_RB delivered_VBD ._.
There_EX was_VBD much_JJ recent_JJ clot_NN in_IN its_PRP$ cavity_NN of_IN the_DT normal_JJ appearance_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT well-marked_JJ corpus_NN luteum_NN in_IN the_DT left_JJ ovary_NN ._.
All_PDT the_DT generative_JJ organs_NNS looked_VBD normal_JJ ._.
Peritoneum.-Considerable_JJ engorgement_NN and_CC large_JJ hmorrhages_NNS in_IN the_DT retro-peritoneal_JJ tissue_NN ,_, mostly_RB in_IN the_DT lumbar_NN regions_NNS ,_, Brain.-Hmorrhages_NNP under_IN scalp_NN and_CC beneath_NN periosteum_NN on_IN surface_NN of_IN cranium_NN ;_: cerebral_JJ membranes_NNS engorged_VBD ,_, with_IN puncta_JJ cruenta_NN in_IN brain_NN distinct_NN ;_: no_DT excess_NN of_IN fluid_NN in_IN ventricles_NNS ;_: brain-substance_NN looked_VBD normal_JJ ._.
Lymphatic_JJ Glands.-Inguinal_NNP ,_, on_IN both_DT sides_NNS ,_, some_DT as_RB large_JJ as_IN beans_NNS ,_, and_CC some_DT smaller_JJR ,_, engorged_VBD ,_, light_JJ red_JJ in_IN colour_NN and_CC dematous_JJ ,_, but_CC some_DT of_IN the_DT upper_JJ ones_NNS were_VBD flatter_JJR and_CC more_JJR normal-looking_NN ._.
Iliac_NNP right_JJ side_NN ,_, the_DT lowest_JJS was_VBD like_IN an_DT almond_NN ,_, deeply_RB engorged_VBN and_CC rather_RB soft_JJ ,_, the_DT upper_JJ ones_NNS were_VBD smaller_JJR and_CC paler_NN ._.
Left_NNP side_NN ,_, lowest_VBP like_IN a_DT large_JJ bean_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT others_NNS smaller_JJR ,_, Lumbar_NNP ,_, rather_RB large_JJ and_CC a_DT little_JJ engorged_NN ._.
Mesenteric_NNP ,_, slightly_RB swollen_VBN and_CC engorged_VBN ._.
Bronhial_NNP ,_, of_IN normal_JJ size_NN ,_, slightly_RB engorged_VBN ._.
MEDICAL_JJ ASPECTS_NNP OF_NNP PLAGUE_NNP ._. ]_NN
103_CD Cervical_JJ ,_, as_RB large_JJ as_IN hazelnuts_NNS ,_, deeply_RB engorged_VBN and_CC dematous_JJ ,_, and_CC some_DT with_IN a_DT little_JJ hmorrhage_NN into_IN the_DT surrounding_VBG connective_JJ tissue_NN ._.
Supra-trochlear_JJ ,_, as_RB large_JJ as_IN peas_NNS and_CC engorged_VBD ._.
Alimentary_JJ System.-Tonsils_NNP small_JJ ,_, slightly_RB engorged_VBN ,_, sophagus_VBP rather_RB engorged_VBN ,_, but_CC no_DT hmorrhages_NNS in_IN its_PRP$ walls_NNS ;_: there_EX were_VBD distinct_JJ petechi_NN in_IN the_DT stomach_NN ,_, a_DT few_JJ in_IN the_DT small_JJ intestine_NN ,_, and_CC more_RBR in_IN the_DT colon_NN and_CC rectum_NN ;_: all_PDT these_DT parts_NNS being_VBG likewise_RB engorged_VBN ._.
The_DT sub-maxillary_JJ and_CC parotid_JJ salivary_JJ glands_NNS and_CC the_DT pancreas_NNS were_VBD slightly_RB engorged_VBN ._.
The_DT Breast_NNP looked_VBD normal_JJ and_CC contained_VBD good_JJ secretion_NN of_IN normal-looking_JJ milk_NN ,_, and_CC its_PRP$ vessels_NNS were_VBD rather_RB full_JJ of_IN blood_NN ._.
Under_IN the_DT microscope_NN plague-bacilli_NN in_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN in_IN the_DT inguinal_JJ cervical_JJ and_CC axillary_JJ glands_NNS :_: they_PRP were_VBD also_RB present_JJ in_IN the_DT blood_NN to_TO a_DT considerable_JJ extent_NN ._.
This_DT account_NN of_IN the_DT pathology_NN of_IN plague_NN is_VBZ based_VBN upon_IN fifty_JJ complete_JJ autopsies_NNS ,_, of_IN which_WDT twelve_EX were_VBD examples_NNS of_IN the_DT pneumonic_JJ type_NN ._.
Sections_NNS for_IN the_DT microscope_NN of_IN the_DT various_JJ lymphatic_JJ glands_NNS and_CC organs_NNS were_VBD made_VBN in_IN twenty-three_NN of_IN the_DT cases_NNS ,_, and_CC from_IN these_DT the_DT minute_NN anatomy_NN has_VBZ been_VBN described_VBN ._.
Further_RB ,_, in_IN all_PDT the_DT cases_NNS ,_, many_JJ specimens_NNS were_VBD prepared_VBN to_TO show_VB the_DT distribution_NN of_IN the_DT plague-bacillus_NN in_IN the_DT various_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT body_NN ,_, and_CC cultures_NNS were_VBD made_VBN as_RB well_RB in_IN nearly_RB every_DT instance_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD from_IN cultures_NNS have_VBP not_RB been_VBN stated_VBN above_IN in_IN the_DT post-mortem_JJ descriptions_NNS ,_, it_PRP will_MD be_VB con-_JJ venient_NN to_TO group_NN them_PRP together_RB here_RB ._.
By_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN cultivation_NN the_DT plague-bacillus_NN has_VBZ been_VBN isolated_VBN from_IN the_DT following_JJ organs_NNS and_CC secretions_NNS ;_: -from_IN the_DT bubo_NN ,_, and_CC ,_, in_IN septicmic_JJ cases_NNS ,_, from_IN plague_JJ glands_NNS in_IN the_DT various_JJ regions_NNS (_( e.g._NN ,_, in_IN one_CD case_NN from_IN the_DT in-_JJ guinal_NN ,_, iliac_NN ,_, axillary_JJ and_CC cervical_JJ glands_NNS )_) ;_: from_IN the_DT lung_NN ,_, liver_NN ,_, spleen_JJ and_CC kidney_NN ;_: from_IN the_DT blood_NN and_CC urine_NN ._.
In_IN one_CD instance_NN the_DT plague-bacillus_NN was_VBD proved_VBN by_IN Dr_NNP ._.
Bitter_NNP to_TO be_VB present_JJ in_IN the_DT mucus_NN obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT large_JJ intestine_NN ._.
In_IN cases_NNS of_IN plague-pneumonia_NN the_DT bacillus_NN could_MD be_VB isolated_VBN from_IN the_DT sputum_NN during_IN life_NN ,_, from_IN the_DT fluid_NN contained_VBN in_IN the_DT trachea_NN and_CC bronchi_NN after_IN death_NN ,_, from_IN the_DT pneumonic_JJ patches_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN several_JJ instances_NNS from_IN the_DT bronchial_JJ glands_NNS ._.
IV.-MODE_NNP OF_NNP EXIT_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP PLAGUE-BACILLUS_NNP FROM_NNP THE_NNP BODY_NNP ._.
From_IN consideration_NN of_IN the_DT post-mortem_NN appearances_NNS it_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN that_IN engorgement_NN and_CC hmorrhage_NN are_VBP marked_VBN features_NNS of_IN plague_NN ,_, and_CC further_RB that_DT hmorrhage_NN is_VBZ constantly_RB found_VBN on_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN mucous_JJ membranes_NNS ;_: consequently_RB ,_, as_RB soon_RB as_IN the_DT bacillus_NN has_VBZ entered_VBN the_DT blood_NN of_IN the_DT general_JJ circulation_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ for_IN it_PRP to_TO escape_VB from_IN the_DT body_NN in_IN the_DT hmor-_JJ rhages_NNS on_IN mucous_JJ surfaces_NNS ._.
Thus_RB in_IN the_DT urinary_JJ system_NN blood_NN may_MD be_VB found_VBN in_IN the_DT urine_JJ dur-_NN ing_VBG life_NN ,_, and_CC after_IN death_NN in_IN the_DT tubules_NNS and_CC pelvis_NN of_IN the_DT kidney_NN ;_: and_CC ,_, besides_NNS ,_, there_EX may_MD be_VB extravasations_NNS on_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT ureter_NN and_CC bladder_NN ;_: hence_NN by_IN the_DT urine_NN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT direct_JJ route_NN for_IN the_DT bacillus_NN to_TO leave_VB the_DT body_NN ._.
Again_RB in_IN the_DT alimentary_JJ system_NN ,_, petechi_NNS are_VBP nearly_RB always_RB present_JJ in_IN the_DT stomach_NN ,_, and_CC as_IN vomiting_NN is_VBZ a_DT very_RB constant_JJ symptom_NN of_IN plague_NN ,_, the_DT bacillus_NN may_MD escape_VB in_IN the_DT vomit_NN ;_: similarly_RB ,_, petechi_NNS are_VBP generally_RB found_VBN in_IN the_DT colon_NN and_CC rectum_NN ,_, and_CC hence_RB the_DT bacillus_NN may_MD escape_VB in_IN the_DT fces_NNS ._.
As_IN for_IN the_DT respiratory_NN system_NN ,_, blood_NN may_MD be_VB found_VBN in_IN the_DT alveoli_NN of_IN the_DT lungs_NNS in_IN ordinary_JJ cases_NNS of_IN plague_NN ,_, whilst_NN in_IN cases_NNS of_IN the_DT pneumonic_JJ type_NN it_PRP is_VBZ invariably_RB present_JJ ;_: besides_NNS ,_, in_IN these_DT latter_JJ cases_NNS ,_, the_DT bacillus_NN is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN enormous_JJ numbers_NNS in_IN the_DT pneumonic_JJ patches_NNS and_CC in_IN the_DT sputum_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ extremely_RB probable_JJ that_IN plague-pneumonia_NN for_IN this_DT reason_NN plays_VBZ an_DT important_JJ part_NN in_IN spreading_VBG the_DT disease_NN ._.
(_( In_IN the_DT preceding_NN section_NN the_DT secretions_NNS have_VBP been_VBN named_VBN from_IN which_WDT the_DT plague-bacillus_NN was_VBD 104_CD [_JJ CHAP_NNP ._.
II_NNP ._.
isolated_VBN by_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN cultures_NNS ._. )_)
With_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT bubo_NN itself_PRP ,_, in_IN certain_JJ cases_NNS it_PRP suppurates_VBZ ,_, and_CC it_PRP would_MD seem_VB possible_JJ for_IN the_DT bacillus_NN to_TO escape_VB in_IN the_DT pus_NN ;_: but_CC this_DT was_VBD not_RB found_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT case_NN ,_, for_IN in_IN several_JJ instances_NNS where_WRB cultures_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN the_DT pus_NN no_DT growth_NN of_IN the_DT plague-bacillus_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN ._.
It_PRP remains_VBZ to_TO make_VB a_DT remark_NN about_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN the_DT bacillus_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN early_JJ plague_NN cases_NNS which_WDT will_MD be_VB detailed_JJ hereafter_NN ,_, cultures_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN the_DT finger-blood_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT bacillus_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB isolated_VBN from_IN them_PRP ,_, in_IN fact_NN they_PRP all_DT remained_VBD sterile_JJ ;_: whereas_NNS in_IN fatal_JJ cases_NNS the_DT bacillus_NN could_MD always_RB be_VB grown_VBN from_IN the_DT blood_NN after_IN death_NN ,_, even_RB when_WRB the_DT post-mortem_NN was_VBD made_VBN one_CD hour_NN after_IN death_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN one_CD instance_NN it_PRP was_VBD grown_VBN from_IN the_DT ._.
finger-blood_JJ twenty-four_JJ hours_NNS before_IN death_NN ._.
Hence_NNP one_CD may_MD say_VB that_IN at_IN least_JJS in_IN fatal_JJ cases_NNS ,_, which_WDT form_VBP the_DT large_JJ majority_NN in_IN this_DT disease_NN ,_, the_DT bacillus_NN is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN the_DT blood_NN for_IN a_DT certain_JJ time_NN before_IN death_NN ,_, and_CC is_VBZ able_JJ to_TO leave_VB the_DT body_NN in_IN the_DT various_JJ secretions_NNS which_WDT contain_VBP blood_NN ._.
V.-MODE_NNP OF_NNP ENTRANCE_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP PLAGUE-BACILLUS_NNP INTO_NNP THE_NNP BODY_NNP ._.
Having_VBG regard_NN to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT initial_JJ bubo_NN in_IN plague_NN is_VBZ usually_RB situated_VBN in_IN the_DT glands_NNS of_IN the_DT extremities_NNS ,_, especially_RB the_DT inguinal_JJ and_CC axillary_JJ chains_NNS ,_, it_PRP appears_VBZ probable_JJ that_IN the_DT bacillus_NN may_MD enter_VB the_DT body_NN through_IN a_DT lesion_NN of_IN the_DT skin-preferably_NN of_IN the_DT extremities_NNS -_: and_CC thence_VB travel_NN upwards_NNS to_TO the_DT nearest_JJS group_NN of_IN lymphatic_JJ glands_NNS and_CC thus_RB form_VB the_DT bubo_NN ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO test_VB this_DT theory_NN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN plague_JJ cases_NNS were_VBD examined_VBN to_TO see_VB if_IN any_DT primary_JJ lesion_NN in_IN the_DT skin_NN could_MD be_VB discovered_VBN through_IN which_WDT the_DT bacillus_NN had_VBD entered_VBN ;_: and_CC as_IN the_DT patients_NNS mostly_RB belonged_VBD to_TO the_DT lower_JJR classes_NNS ,_, who_WP commonly_RB go_VBP bare-footed_JJ and_CC bare-legged_JJ ,_, it_PRP was_VBD usual_JJ to_TO find_VB cracks_NNS and_CC abrasions_NNS about_IN the_DT feet_NNS ,_, and_CC also_RB about_IN the_DT hands_NNS ,_, the_DT latter_JJ resulting_VBG from_IN occupation_NN ._.
Further_RB ,_, as_IN various_JJ parasitic_JJ skin_NN diseases_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN ringworm_NN and_CC itch_NN ,_, are_VBP very_RB common_JJ among_IN these_DT people_NNS ,_, it_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_IN there_EX are_VBP many_JJ opportunities_NNS for_IN the_DT bacillus_NN to_TO enter_VB the_DT body_NN through_IN the_DT skin_NN ._.
Bearing_VBG in_IN mind_NN the_DT analogy_NN of_IN anthrax_NN and_CC syphilis_NN ,_, the_DT skin_NN was_VBD examined_VBN to_TO see_VB if_IN any_DT characteristic_JJ lesion_NN was_VBD similarly_RB present_JJ in_IN plague_NN ._.
No_DT such_JJ definite_JJ lesion_NN was_VBD found_VBN ,_, but_CC in_IN certain_JJ cases_NNS the_DT bacillus_NN was_VBD proved_VBN to_TO be_VB present_JJ in_IN a_DT particular_JJ lesion_NN on_IN the_DT skin_NN ,_, and_CC as_IN in_IN each_DT instance_NN the_DT bubo_NN was_VBD situated_VBN in_IN the_DT glands_NNS corresponding_VBG to_TO the_DT lesion_NN ,_, this_DT place_NN was_VBD believed_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT point_NN of_IN entrance_NN of_IN the_DT bacillus_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD nothing_NN characteristic_JJ about_IN the_DT lesion_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD usually_RB a_DT small_JJ ordinary-looking_JJ papule_NN on_IN a_DT slightly_RB inflamed_JJ base_NN ,_, with_IN a_DT little_JJ serum_NN at_IN its_PRP$ apex_NN and_CC partly_RB covered_VBN by_IN a_DT scab_NN ._.
In_IN some_DT cases_NNS a_DT hair_NN was_VBD found_VBN growing_VBG through_IN its_PRP$ centre_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP seemed_VBD to_TO be_VB merely_RB an_DT infiamed_JJ hair-follicle_NN which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN scratched_VBN ._.
These_DT cases_NNS will_MD now_RB be_VB given_VBN in_IN detail_NN ._.
B._NNP ,_, Hindu_NNP man_NN ,_, aged_VBD 40_CD ,_, came_VBD to_TO hospital_VB on_IN 5th_CD October_NNP ,_, 1896_CD ._.
Three_CD days_NNS ago_IN he_PRP was_VBD seized_VBN with_IN fever_NN ,_, and_CC shortly_RB afterwards_NNS found_VBD pain_NN and_CC swelling_NN in_IN the_DT left_JJ axilla_NN ._.
On_IN admission_NN he_PRP looked_VBD very_RB ill_JJ ,_, temperature_NN 103_CD ,_, and_CC there_RB was_VBD a_DT large_JJ bubo_NN in_IN the_DT left_JJ axilla_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT outer_JJ side_NN of_IN the_DT left_JJ forearm_NN near_IN the_DT wrist_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT small_JJ papule_NN the_DT size_NN of_IN a_DT pea_NN ,_, with_IN a_DT hair_NN growing_VBG through_IN it_PRP ;_: it_PRP was_VBD slightly_RB red_VBN at_IN the_DT base_NN ,_, contained_VBD a_DT little_JJ serum_NN at_IN the_DT apex_NN and_CC was_VBD partly_RB covered_VBN by_IN a_DT scab_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD not_RB painful_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT patient_NN knew_VBD nothing_NN about_IN it_PRP ;_: there_EX were_VBD no_DT inflamed_JJ lymphatics_NNS leading_VBG from_IN it_PRP ._.
Cultivations_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN the_DT serum_NN squeezed_VBN from_IN the_DT papule_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT typical_JJ growth_NN of_IN plague_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN ._.
Part_NN of_IN the_DT culture_NN was_VBD injected_VBN into_IN a_DT rat_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT rat_NN died_VBD of_IN plague_NN after_IN 60_CD hours_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT same_JJ date_NN ,_, 5th_CD October_NNP ,_, cultures_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN the_DT finger-blood_NN ,_, but_CC all_DT remained_VBD sterile_JJ ._.
This_DT man_NN died_VBD on_IN 8th_CD October_NNP ._.
MEDICAL_JJ ASPECTS_NNP OF_NNP PLAGUE_NNP ._. ]_NN
105_CD N._NNP S._NNP ,_, Hindu_NNP man_NN ,_, aged_VBD 28_CD ,_, came_VBD to_TO hospital_VB December_NNP 1st_CD ,_, 1896_CD ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT large_JJ bubo_NN in_IN the_DT vertical_JJ set_NN of_IN the_DT right_JJ inguinal_JJ glands_NNS ._.
He_PRP said_VBD he_PRP had_VBD been_VBN ill_JJ three_CD days_NNS ._.
There_EX were_VBD many_JJ old_JJ cracks_NNS and_CC fissures_NNS about_IN the_DT feet_NNS and_CC toes_NNS ,_, the_DT skin_NN being_VBG thick_JJ and_CC horny_NN ,_, and_CC some_DT scratch_NN marks_NNS on_IN both_DT legs_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT outer_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT right_JJ calf_NN there_EX was_VBD a_DT slightly_RB raised_VBN dematons_NNS portion_NN of_IN skin_NN about_IN one_CD inch_NN long_RB ,_, and_CC on_IN it_PRP there_EX was_VBD a_DT small_JJ bleb_NN ,_, the_DT size_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ pin_NN 's_POS head_NN ._.
From_IN the_DT bleb_NN some_DT thin_JJ serum_NN was_VBD squeezed_VBN out_RP ._.
Cultures_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN the_DT fluid_NN in_IN the_DT bleb_NN and_CC from_IN the_DT finger-blood_NN ._.
A_DT pure_JJ growth_NN of_IN the_DT plague-bacillus_NN was_VBD ultimately_RB obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT bleb_NN ,_, whereas_IN the_DT cultures_NNS of_IN the_DT blood_NN remained_VBD sterile_JJ ._.
In_IN this_DT case_NN ,_, too_RB ,_, the_DT patient_NN could_MD give_VB no_DT history_NN of_IN the_DT dematous_JJ patch_NN on_IN the_DT leg_NN ,_, and_CC there_EX was_VBD no_DT pain_NN in_IN it_PRP ._.
N._NNP ,_, Hindu_NNP man_NN ,_, aged_VBD 30_CD years_NNS ,_, was_VBD admitted_VBN on_IN March_NNP 3rd_CD ,_, 1897_CD ,_, with_IN a_DT bubo_NN at_IN the_DT back_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT right_JJ axilla_NN ._.
He_PRP had_VBD been_VBN ill_RB two_CD days_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT back_NN ,_, near_IN the_DT angle_NN of_IN the_DT right_JJ scapula_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT papule_NN ,_, the_DT size_NN of_IN a_DT pea_NN ,_, on_IN a_DT slightly-reddened_JJ base_NN ,_, and_CC partly_RB scabbed_VBD over_IN ;_: it_PRP looked_VBD like_IN a_DT pimple_NN which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN scratched_VBN ._.
Cultures_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN the_DT serum_NN squeezed_VBN from_IN this_DT papule_NN and_CC from_IN the_DT finger-blood_NN ;_: a_DT pure_JJ growth_NN of_IN the_DT plague-_JJ bacillus_NN was_VBD ultimately_RB obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT papule_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT cultures_NNS of_IN the_DT finger-blood_JJ remain-_JJ ed_NN sterile_NN ._.
P._NNP ,_, Hindu_NNP boy_NN ,_, aged_VBD 16_CD ,_, admitted_VBN on_IN October_NNP 26th_CD ,_, 1896_CD ._.
On_IN either_DT side_JJ several_JJ of_IN the_DT oblique_JJ inguinal_JJ glands_NNS were_VBD enlarged_VBN to_TO the_DT size_NN of_IN walnuts_NNS ,_, and_CC painful_JJ ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT small_JJ unopened_JJ papule_NN on_IN the_DT glans_NNS penis_VBP exactly_RB in_IN the_DT dorsal_NN middle_JJ line_NN ;_: its_PRP$ apex_JJ con-_NN tained_VBD a_DT little_JJ pus_NN and_CC serum_NN ._.
It_PRP did_VBD not_RB look_VB at_IN all_DT like_IN a_DT chancre_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT boy_NN said_VBD he_PRP knew_VBD nothing_NN about_IN it_PRP ._.
Cultures_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN the_DT papule_NN and_CC from_IN the_DT finger-blood_NN ._.
From_IN the_DT former_JJ a_DT pure_JJ growth_NN of_IN plague_NN was_VBD ultimately_RB obtained_VBN ._.
This_DT was_VBD injected_VBN into_IN a_DT rat_NN and_CC the_DT rat_NN died_VBD of_IN plague_NN ._.
Cultures_NNS of_IN the_DT finger-blood_NN remained_VBD sterile_JJ ._.
This_DT patient_NN recovered_VBD ._.
As_IN confirmatory_NN of_IN the_DT above_JJ observations_NNS ,_, I_PRP may_MD quote_VB as_IN follows_VBZ from_IN ``_`` A_NNP Report_NNP on_IN the_DT Epidemic_NNP of_IN Bubonic_NNP Plague_NNP at_IN Hong-Kong_NNP in_IN the_DT year_NN 1896_CD ,_, ''_'' by_IN Staff_NNP Surgeon_NNP Wilm_NNP ,_, of_IN the_DT Imperial_JJ German_JJ Navy_NNP :_: -_: ``_`` As_IN regards_NNS infection_NN through_IN the_DT skin_NN ,_, two_CD incontestible_JJ cases_NNS were_VBD observed_VBN in_IN the_DT epidemic_NN of_IN 1894_CD ._.
Two_CD Japanese_JJ physicians_NNS were_VBD infected_VBN ,_, while_IN making_VBG post-mortem_JJ examinations_NNS ,_, and_CC were_VBD attacked_VBN a_DT few_JJ days_NNS later_RB by_IN plague_NN ._.
They_PRP had_VBD axillary_JJ buboes_NNS and_CC lymphangitis_NN of_IN the_DT arm_NN ,_, which_WDT spread_VBP upwards_NNS from_IN the_DT small_JJ inflamed_JJ wounds_NNS of_IN the_DT fingers_NNS ._.
The_DT above_NN are_VBP the_DT four_CD cases_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT plague-bacillus_NN was_VBD found_VBN in_IN a_DT certain_JJ definite_JJ situation_NN on_IN the_DT skin_NN ,_, and_CC this_DT place_NN was_VBD believed_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT seat_NN of_IN inoculation_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ;_: moreover_RB ,_, in_IN each_DT instance_NN ,_, the_DT corresponding_VBG proximal_JJ glands_NNS formed_VBD the_DT bubo_NN ,_, and_CC there_EX was_VBD nothing_NN characteristic_JJ about_IN the_DT skin_JJ lesion_NN ._.
It_PRP looked_VBD like_IN an_DT ordinary_JJ pimple_NN which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN rubbed_VBN or_CC scratched_VBN ,_, and_CC no_DT local_JJ reaction_NN had_VBD occurred_VBN in_IN it_PRP ,_, due_JJ to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN the_DT bacillus_NN ;_: also_RB ,_, it_PRP was_VBD not_RB painful_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT patient_NN was_VBD unaware_JJ of_IN its_PRP$ existence_NN ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB stated_VBN here_RB ,_, that_IN in_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN other_JJ patients_NNS ,_, small_JJ papules_NNS or_CC abrasions_NNS were_VBD similarly_RB examined_VBN ,_, but_CC the_DT plague-bacillus_NN was_VBD not_RB proved_VBN to_TO be_VB present_JJ ._.
Thus_RB ,_, in_IN one_CD instance_NN a_DT man_NN had_VBD acne_VBN extensively_RB on_IN the_DT face_NN and_CC a_DT bubo_NN in_IN the_DT left_JJ cervical_JJ region_NN ;_: in_IN another_DT ,_, three_CD small_JJ scabbed_VBD wounds_NNS on_IN the_DT right_JJ foot_NN with_IN a_DT bubo_NN in_IN the_DT vertical_JJ right_JJ inguinal_JJ glands_NNS ;_: in_IN a_DT third_JJ ,_, a_DT number_NN of_IN papules_NNS on_IN the_DT left_JJ arm_NN with_IN a_DT left_JJ axillary_JJ bubo_NN ,_, and_CC other_JJ cases_NNS could_MD be_VB quoted_VBN ._.
Some_DT of_IN the_DT papules_NNS were_VBD examined_VBN in_IN these_DT cases_NNS ,_, but_CC with_IN a_DT negative_JJ result_NN ._.
A_DT point_NN remains_VBZ to_TO be_VB noticed_VBN ;_: it_PRP may_MD be_VB objected_VBN ,_, that_IN if_IN the_DT bacillus_NN were_VBD already_RB in_IN the_DT blood_NN ,_, it_PRP could_MD pass_VB with_IN the_DT serum_NN into_IN a_DT papule_NN wherever_RB situated_VBN ,_, and_CC 27_CD 106_CD [_JJ CHAP_NNP ._.
II_NNP ._.
its_PRP$ presence_NN there_EX would_MD be_VB the_DT result_NN ,_, and_CC not_RB the_DT cause_NN ,_, of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
But_CC against_IN this_DT view_NN there_EX are_VBP the_DT facts_NNS ,_, 1st_CD ,_, that_WDT in_IN the_DT above_IN four_CD cases_NNS ,_, which_WDT were_VBD all_DT early_JJ ,_, the_DT bacillus_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB isolated_VBN from_IN the_DT blood_NN on_IN the_DT same_JJ day_NN that_IN it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT papule_NN ;_: and_CC ,_, 2nd_CD ,_, that_DT in_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN other_JJ early_JJ cases_NNS ,_, pimples_NNS situated_VBN in_IN various_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT body_NN were_VBD examined_VBN ,_, not_RB only_RB on_IN the_DT limb_NN corresponding_VBG to_TO the_DT bubo_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT baeillus_NN was_VBD not_RB found_VBN in_IN them_PRP ._.
Also_RB in_IN three_CD early_JJ cases_NNS of_IN inguinal_JJ bubo_NN ,_, a_DT small_JJ blister_NN was_VBD raised_VBN upon_IN the_DT chest_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT plague-bacillus_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB isolated_VBN from_IN the_DT contained_VBN serum_NN ._.
The_DT conclusion_NN drawn_NN is_VBZ ,_, that_IN the_DT bacillus_NN of_IN plague_NN can_MD enter_VB the_DT body_NN through_IN a_DT trifling_JJ lesion_NN in_IN the_DT skin_NN ,_, that_IN it_PRP produces_VBZ no_DT local_JJ reaction_NN at_IN the_DT seat_NN of_IN inoculation_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT bubo_NN is_VBZ formed_VBN at_IN the_DT nearest_JJS proximal_JJ glands_NNS ._.
With_IN regard_NN to_TO infection_NN by_IN food_NN ,_, no_DT evidence_NN was_VBD found_VBN post-mortem_NN that_IN the_DT bacillus_NN had_VBD entered_VBN through_IN the_DT stomach_NN or_CC intestines_NNS ;_: but_CC cases_NNS of_IN cervical_JJ bubo_NN might_MD have_VB resulted_VBN from_IN infection_NN through_IN abrasions_NNS on_IN the_DT lips_NNS ,_, tongue_NN or_CC tonsils_NNS ._.
As_IN for_IN the_DT cases_NNS of_IN primary_JJ plague-pneumonia_NN ,_, no_DT evidence_NN of_IN the_DT path_NN of_IN infection_NN was_VBD found_VBN ,_, but_CC the_DT bacillus_NN was_VBD thought_VBN to_TO have_VB entered_VBN by_IN the_DT respiratory_NN tract_NN ,_, as_IN its_PRP$ growth_NN had_VBD mainly_RB occurred_VBN in_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ._.
MEDICAL_JJ ASPECTS_NNP OF_NNP PLAGUE_NNP ._. ]_NN
107_CD APPENDIX_NNP A_NNP (_( to_TO Capt_NNP ._.
Childe_NNP 's_POS Report_NNP )_) ._.
On_IN the_DT Clinical_NNP Aspect_NNP of_IN Plague-Pneumonia_NNP ._.
When_WRB plague_NN appeared_VBD in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, and_CC as_IN the_DT disease_NN developed_VBD ,_, one_CD was_VBD struck_VBN by_IN the_DT following_JJ facts_NNS :_: -First_RB ,_, in_IN all_DT published_JJ accounts_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, although_IN the_DT ordinary_JJ phase_NN of_IN the_DT malady_NN ,_, viz._NN ,_, plague_NN with_IN buboes_NNS ,_, is_VBZ principally_RB described_VBN ,_, still_RB mention_NN is_VBZ always_RB made_VBN of_IN another_DT and_CC more_JJR fatal_JJ form_NN without_IN buboes_NNS ;_: whereas_NNS ,_, here_RB in_IN Bombay_NNP it_PRP seemed_VBD as_IN if_IN the_DT bubonic_JJ form_NN were_VBD alone_RB appearing_VBG ,_, for_IN ,_, at_IN the_DT beginning_NN ,_, one_CD saw_VBD no_DT examples_NNS of_IN the_DT other_JJ form_NN ._.
Then_RB one_CD observed_VBD that_DT coiucidently_RB with_IN the_DT increased_VBN death-rate_NN due_JJ to_TO plague_VB ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT large_JJ and_CC unexplained_JJ increase_NN assigned_VBD to_TO remittent_VB fever_NN and_CC respiratory_NN diseases_NNS ._.
Week_VBN by_IN week_NN ,_, as_IN the_DT plague_NN mortality_NN increased_VBD ,_, so_RB did_VBD that_IN under_IN these_DT two_CD headings_NNS ,_, and_CC though_IN it_PRP was_VBD possible_JJ that_IN all_PDT these_DT were_VBD cases_NNS of_IN known_VBN but_CC concealed_VBN plague_NN ,_, still_RB one_CD could_MD not_RB help_VB suspecting_VBG that_IN some_DT of_IN them_PRP might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO plague_VB which_WDT was_VBD not_RB diagnos-_JJ ed_NN because_IN of_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN buboes_NNS ._.
So_RB I_PRP resolved_VBD to_TO examine_VB the_DT bodies_NNS of_IN all_DT hospital_NN patients_NNS who_WP had_VBD died_VBN of_IN fever_NN ,_, pneumonia_NN or_CC any_DT acute_JJ illness_NN ,_, to_TO see_VB if_IN there_EX were_VBD evidence_NN that_IN any_DT of_IN them_PRP had_VBD really_RB died_VBN of_IN plague_NN ._.
And_CC at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN December_NNP I_PRP met_VBD with_IN a_DT case_NN which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN diagnosed_VBN as_IN broncho-pneumonia_NN ,_, but_CC which_WDT turned_VBD out_RP to_TO be_VB one_CD of_IN plague_NN affecting_VBG the_DT lungs_NNS ,_, without_IN causing_VBG any_DT marked_JJ enlargement_NN of_IN the_DT lymphatic_JJ glands-_NN a_DT case_NN ,_, in_IN fact_NN ,_, of_IN plague-pneumonia_NN ;_: and_CC its_PRP$ post-mortem_NN was_VBD exactly_RB like_IN many_JJ others_NNS that_IN I_PRP have_VBP since_IN made_VBN ,_, typical_JJ of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, and_CC I_PRP will_MD give_VB a_DT few_JJ notes_NNS of_IN it_PRP ._.
B._NNP L._NNP ,_, Hindu_NNP ,_, male_NN ,_, 25_CD years_NNS old_JJ ,_, admitted_VBN for_IN fever_NN and_CC cough_NN ,_, December_NNP 26th_CD ,_, 1896_CD ,_, under_IN Dr._NNP S._NNP He_PRP said_VBD he_PRP had_VBD been_VBN ill_VBN for_IN about_RB seven_CD days_NNS ._.
He_PRP had_VBD symptoms_NNS in_IN the_DT chest_NN which_WDT led_VBD to_TO the_DT diagnosis_NN of_IN broncho-pneumonia_NN being_VBG made_VBN ._.
No_DT lymphatic_JJ glands_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB enlarged_VBN or_CC painful_JJ ,_, and_CC a_DT specimen_NNS of_IN blood_NN taken_VBN by_IN Dr._NNP S._NNP shewed_VBD no_DT plague-bacilli_JJ under_IN the_DT microscope_NN ._.
He_PRP coughed_VBD up_RP about_IN two_CD ounces_NNS of_IN blood-stained_JJ fluid_NN on_IN the_DT night_NN of_IN the_DT 27th_CD ,_, and_CC died_VBD at_IN 3_CD A.M._NNP on_IN December_NNP 28th_CD ._.
Post-mortem_NN on_IN December_NNP 28th_CD ,_, seven_CD hours_NNS after_IN death_NN ._.
Lungs.-Much_JJ general_JJ engorgement_NN and_CC dema_NN ,_, with_IN sero-sanguineous_JJ frothy_JJ fluid_NN in_IN the_DT bronchi_NN ,_, but_CC no_DT pus_NN ;_: and_CC the_DT usual_JJ appearances_NNS of_IN acute_JJ bronchitis_NN were_VBD absent_JJ There_EX was_VBD one_CD small_JJ pneumonic_JJ patch_NN ,_, the_DT size_NN of_IN a_DT walnut_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT early_JJ second_JJ stage_NN ,_, situated_VBD a_DT little_JJ below_IN the_DT apex_NN on_IN the_DT front_NN of_IN the_DT right_NN lung_NN ,_, and_CC two_CD similar_JJ but_CC smaller_JJR patches_NNS at_IN about_IN the_DT same_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT left_NN lung_NN ._.
These_DT patches_NNS stood_VBD out_RP a_DT little_RB from_IN the_DT surface_NN and_CC were_VBD light_JJ grey_NNS in_IN colour_NN ,_, airless_NN ,_, friable_JJ and_CC sank_NN in_IN water_NN ;_: and_CC each_DT was_VBD surrounded_VBN by_IN a_DT dark_JJ ring_NN of_IN engorged_JJ lung_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ stage_NN of_IN pneumonia_NN ,_, which_WDT merged_VBD into_IN healthy_JJ lung_NN ;_: there_EX was_VBD some_DT recent_JJ pleurisy_NN over_IN the_DT pneumonic_JJ areas_NNS ._.
All_PDT the_DT other_JJ organs_NNS were_VBD examined_VBN and_CC showed_VBD considerable_JJ engorgement_NN ,_, but_CC no_DT special_JJ lesion_NN was_VBD observed_VBN ._.
Condition_NN of_IN the_DT Lymphatic_NNP Glands.-The_NNP bronchial_NN were_VBD quite_RB small_JJ and_CC of_IN normal_JJ appearance_NN ;_: the_DT cervical_JJ were_VBD slightly_RB enlarged_VBN ,_, but_CC pale_NN and_CC not_RB engorged_VBN ;_: the_DT axillary_JJ were_VBD pink_JJ and_CC slightly_RB enlarged_VBD ;_: the_DT left_JJ iliac_NN were_VBD somewhat_RB large_JJ ,_, red_JJ and_CC soft_JJ ;_: the_DT lumbar_NN were_VBD swollen_VBN but_CC pale_JJ ;_: and_CC all_PDT the_DT other_JJ glands_NNS looked_VBD absolutely_RB normal_JJ ._.
Cultures_NNS were_VBD made_VBN on_IN agar-agar_NN from_IN the_DT pueumonic_JJ lung_NN and_CC spleen_NN ,_, and_CC ultimately_RB a_DT pure_JJ growth_NN of_IN the_DT plague-bacillus_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN each_DT ._.
Microscope.-The_NNP pneumonic_JJ patches_NNS in_IN both_DT stages_NNS showed_VBD an_DT immense_JJ number_NN of_IN plague-bacilli_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT lung_NN showed_VBD a_DT large_JJ number_NN ;_: the_DT left_JJ supra-trochlear_JJ and_CC the_DT left_JJ femoral_JJ glands_NNS shewed_VBD a_DT fair_JJ number_NN ,_, and_CC all_PDT the_DT other_JJ glands_NNS extremely_RB few_JJ ;_: the_DT spleen_NN and_CC blood_NN also_RB showed_VBD a_DT few_JJ ._.
108_CD [_JJ CHAP_NNP ._.
II_NNP ._.
So_RB this_DT was_VBD a_DT case_NN of_IN plague_NN ,_, in_IN which_WDT during_IN life_NN all_PDT the_DT symptoms_NNS pointed_VBD to_TO disease_VB of_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN which_WDT there_EX were_VBD no_DT evidences_NNS of_IN glandular_JJ enlargement_NN ,_, whilst_NN after_IN death_NN there_EX was_VBD clear_JJ proof_NN of_IN enormous_JJ growth_NN of_IN plague-bacilli_NN in_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ,_, and_CC of_IN only_RB very_RB slight_JJ growth_NN in_IN the_DT lymphatic_JJ glands_NNS ._.
I_PRP have_VBP made_VBN up_RP to_TO the_DT present_JJ twelve_NN post-mortems_NNS on_IN such_JJ cases_NNS ,_, all_DT presenting_VBG appearances_NNS similar_JJ to_TO the_DT above_NN ,_, and_CC I_PRP may_MD add_VB ,_, that_IN all_PDT the_DT patients_NNS were_VBD brought_VBN to_TO hospital_NN by_IN their_PRP$ friends_NNS ,_, supposed_VBN to_TO be_VB suffering_VBG from_IN cough_NN and_CC fever_NN ,_, and_CC ,_, as_RB far_RB as_IN I_PRP know_VBP ,_, they_PRP were_VBD quite_RB unaware_JJ of_IN the_DT nature_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
I_PRP have_VBP also_RB to_TO say_VB that_IN in_IN nearly_RB all_PDT the_DT other_JJ cases_NNS the_DT fluid_NN from_IN the_DT trachea_NN or_CC bronchial_JJ tubes_NN has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN examined_VBN ;_: it_PRP shows_VBZ an_DT immense_JJ number_NN of_IN plague-bacilli_JJ ,_, and_CC cultures_NNS of_IN plague_NN can_MD always_RB be_VB obtained_VBN from_IN it_PRP ._.
With_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT clinical_JJ symptoms_NNS of_IN these_DT cases_NNS ,_, it_PRP fell_VBD to_TO me_PRP to_TO attend_VB on_IN the_DT late_JJ Dr._NNP Manser_NNP ,_, and_CC as_IN he_PRP died_VBD of_IN this_DT form_NN of_IN plague_NN ,_, I_PRP will_MD Dr._NNP Manser_NNP 's_POS case_NN ._.
mention_NN a_DT few_JJ facts_NNS about_IN his_PRP$ case_NN ._.
He_PRP was_VBD in_IN his_PRP$ usual_JJ health_NN on_IN January_NNP 2nd_CD ,_, and_CC had_VBD a_DT sudden_JJ rigor_NN in_IN the_DT morn-_JJ ing_NN and_CC felt_VBD fever_RB coming_VBG on_IN ._.
During_IN the_DT day_NN a_DT bad_JJ headache_NN developed_VBD ,_, he_PRP felt_VBD nausea_NN and_CC vomited_VBD several_JJ times_NNS ,_, and_CC he_PRP had_VBD pains_NNS and_CC a_DT tired_JJ feeling_NN in_IN his_PRP$ limbs_NN ;_: his_PRP$ tongue_NN remained_VBD clean_JJ and_CC moist_NN ,_, and_CC his_PRP$ skin_NN was_VBD slightly_RB moist_JJ ._.
At_IN 2_CD P.M._NNP ,_, temperature_NN 103.4_CD ,_, pulse_RB 116_CD ,_, respiration_NN 25_CD ,_, and_CC there_EX were_VBD but_CC slight_JJ variations_NNS during_IN the_DT day_NN ._.
On_IN January_NNP 3rd_CD ,_, had_VBD passed_VBN a_DT bad_JJ night_NN and_CC felt_VBD worse_JJR ,_, and_CC all_PDT the_DT symptoms_NNS persisted_VBD ,_, except_IN the_DT aching_NN in_IN the_DT limbs_NN ,_, and_CC he_PRP felt_VBD very_RB ill_RB ._.
The_DT temperature_NN remained_VBD between_IN 103.5_CD and_CC 104.5_CD ,_, pulse_NN about_IN 110_CD ,_, and_CC respirations_NNS about_IN 23_CD throughout_IN the_DT day_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT afternoon_NN he_PRP felt_VBD some_DT pain_NN at_IN the_DT lower_JJR part_NN of_IN the_DT left_NN axilla_NN ,_, just_RB under_IN the_DT anterior_JJ fold_NN ,_, but_CC there_EX was_VBD no_DT glandular_JJ enlargement_NN or_CC pain_NN in_IN the_DT glands_NNS anywhere_RB ._.
On_IN January_NNP 4th_CD ,_, had_VBD passed_VBN a_DT bad_JJ night_NN and_CC felt_VBD very_RB ill_RB ,_, temperature_NN 104.6_CD ,_, pulse_RB 113_CD ,_, respiration_NN 25_CD ,_, tongue_NN still_RB moist_VB ,_, with_IN a_DT little_JJ fur_NN behind_IN ,_, and_CC no_DT sordes_NNS about_IN the_DT lips_NNS or_CC teeth_NNS ;_: the_DT other_JJ symptoms_NNS as_IN before_RB ._.
During_IN the_DT night_NN he_PRP began_VBD to_TO cough_VB and_CC brought_VB up_RP some_DT watery_NN sero-mucous_JJ fluid_NN ,_, slightly_RB blood-tinged_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT pain_NN remained_VBD in_IN the_DT same_JJ place_NN ,_, only_RB more_RBR diffused_JJ now_RB ,_, being_VBG felt_VBN over_IN an_DT area_NN of_IN a_DT square_JJ inch_NN ._.
At_IN this_DT part_NN some_DT moist_NN sounds_NNS could_MD be_VB heard_VBN like_IN those_DT of_IN early_JJ pneumonia_NN ,_, and_CC they_PRP could_MD also_RB be_VB heard_RB just_RB below_IN the_DT left_JJ clavicle_NN ;_: the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT lungs_NNS and_CC other_JJ organs_NNS appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB normal_JJ ,_, as_IN did_VBD the_DT lymphatic_JJ glands_NNS ._.
Patient_NN considered_VBD that_IN he_PRP had_VBD pneumonia_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT symptoms_NNS were_VBD not_RB like_JJ ordinary_JJ pneumonia_NN ._.
For_IN the_DT onset_NN was_VBD different_JJ ,_, the_DT condition_NN of_IN the_DT tongue_NN and_CC mouth_NN different_JJ ,_, there_EX was_VBD no_DT dyspna_NN or_CC pneumonic_JJ disproportion_NN of_IN pulse_NN and_CC respiration_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT sputum_NN was_VBD not_RB at_IN all_DT like_IN rusty_JJ sputum_NN ;_: for_IN it_PRP was_VBD loose_JJ and_CC free_JJ ,_, coming_VBG up_RP with_IN the_DT slightest_JJS cough_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD watery_NN ,_, looking_VBG more_RBR like_IN serum_NN than_IN mucus_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP was_VBD slightly_RB pink_JJ ,_, not_RB rusty_JJ yellow_NN at_IN all_DT ._.
Also_RB there_EX was_VBD the_DT striking_JJ fact_NN that_IN the_DT patient_NN 's_POS general_JJ condition_NN was_VBD far_RB worse_JJR than_IN could_MD be_VB explained_VBN by_IN the_DT small_JJ amount_NN of_IN lung-disease_JJ present_NN ._.
So_RB I_PRP examined_VBD the_DT sputum_NN under_IN the_DT microscope_NN ,_, and_CC found_VBD it_PRP full_JJ of_IN bacilli_JJ looking_VBG like_IN those_DT of_IN plague_NN ,_, and_CC cultures_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN which_WDT a_DT pure_NN growth_NN of_IN the_DT plague-bacillus_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN ._.
During_IN 4th_CD and_CC 5th_CD ,_, patient_NN became_VBD steadily_RB worse_JJR ,_, his_PRP$ temperature_NN remained_VBD about_IN 104_CD ,_, and_CC his_PRP$ expectoration_NN became_VBD most_JJS profuse_NN ;_: the_DT moist_NN sounds_NNS were_VBD heard_VBN over_IN a_DT larger_JJR area_NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN slightly_RB at_IN the_DT bases_NNS ;_: the_DT respirations_NNS increased_VBD to_TO 35_CD ,_, and_CC then_RB to_TO 45_CD ,_, and_CC the_DT pulse_NN to_TO 120_CD and_CC 135_CD ;_: and_CC he_PRP ultimately_RB died_VBD early_JJ on_IN January_NNP 6th_CD ._.
There_EX is_VBZ also_RB the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT nurse_NN who_WP attended_VBD him_PRP ,_, who_WP unfortunately_RB died_VBD of_IN a_DT similar_JJ form_NN of_IN plague_NN ._.
In_IN brief_NN ,_, she_PRP became_VBD ill_RB on_IN the_DT evening_NN of_IN January_NNP 7th_CD ,_, and_CC showed_VBD MEDICAL_NNP ASPECTS_NNP OF_NNP PLAGUE_NNP ._. ]_NN
109_CD symptoms_NNS of_IN pneumonia_NN on_IN January_NNP 8th_CD ._.
She_PRP rapidly_RB became_VBD worse_JJR and_CC died_VBD on_IN the_DT 10th_CD ,_, but_CC her_PRP$ sputum_NN was_VBD not_RB nearly_RB so_RB profuse_JJ as_IN in_IN the_DT former_JJ case_NN ,_, and_CC symptoms_NNS of_IN exhaustion_NN came_VBD on_IN much_JJ earlier_JJR ._.
She_PRP also_RB had_VBD no_DT glandular_JJ pain_NN or_CC enlargement_NN whatever_NN ,_, and_CC bacteriologically_RB her_PRP$ sputum_NN was_VBD exactly_RB as_IN described_VBN above_IN ._.
Other_JJ cases_NNS were_VBD met_VBN with_IN ,_, in_IN which_WDT ,_, besides_IN plague-pneumonia_JJ ,_, there_EX was_VBD also_RB general_JJ enlargement_NN of_IN the_DT glands_NNS ,_, -_: plague-septicmia_NN ;_: and_CC clinically_VB it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN either_CC the_DT pneumonia_NN was_VBD primary_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT glandular_JJ enlargement_NN secondary_JJ ,_, or_CC that_IN the_DT disease_NN first_RB shewed_VBD itself_PRP in_IN the_DT glands_NNS and_CC later_RB on_IN in_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ;_: and_CC whilst_VB some_DT of_IN the_DT latter_NN recovered_VBD ,_, the_DT former_JJ were_VBD usually_RB rapidly_RB fatal_JJ ._.
Also_RB the_DT sputum_NN was_VBD not_RB always_RB as_IN has_VBZ been_VBN described_VBN above_IN ,_, for_IN in_IN some_DT cases_NNS the_DT presence_NN of_IN blood_NN in_IN it_PRP was_VBD a_DT marked_JJ feature_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP was_VBD either_RB moderate_JJ or_CC abund-_JJ ant_NN in_IN quantity_NN ._.
These_DT pneumonic_JJ forms_NNS of_IN plague_NN are_VBP highly_RB infectious_JJ ,_, and_CC probably_RB take_VB a_DT large_JJ share_NN in_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ;_: for_IN in_IN these_DT cases_NNS the_DT patient_NN 's_POS sputum_NN is_VBZ practically_RB a_DT virulent_JJ pure_JJ culture_NN of_IN the_DT plague-bacillus_JJ ,_, and_CC as_IN there_EX is_VBZ reason_NN to_TO believe_VB that_IN many_JJ of_IN the_DT cases_NNS are_VBP not_RB recognised_VBN as_IN plague_NN at_IN all_DT ,_, precautions_NNS are_VBP not_RB taken_VBN by_IN the_DT patients_NNS '_POS friends_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT dangerous_JJ nature_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ not_RB appreciated_VBN ._.
I_PRP have_VBP no_DT means_NNS of_IN knowing_VBG how_WRB frequent_JJ this_DT variety_NN of_IN plague_NN has_VBZ been_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ epidemic_JJ ,_, but_CC there_EX is_VBZ some_DT evidence_NN to_TO show_VB that_IN a_DT consider-_JJ able_JJ number_NN of_IN cases_NNS have_VBP occurred_VBN ._.
Moreover_RB ,_, it_PRP seems_VBZ likely_JJ that_IN a_DT ship_NN 's_POS passenger_NN suffering_NN from_IN this_DT form_NN of_IN plague_NN might_MD escape_VB detection_NN by_IN sanitary_JJ officers_NNS ,_, and_CC might_MD be_VB permitted_VBN to_TO land_VB at_IN his_PRP$ destination_NN as_IN though_IN he_PRP were_VBD the_DT subject_NN of_IN simple_JJ pneumonia_NN ;_: and_CC so_RB a_DT centre_NN of_IN infection_NN for_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN plague_NN would_MD be_VB established_VBN ._.
With_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT literature_NN on_IN this_DT subject_NN ,_, I_PRP have_VBP not_RB been_VBN able_JJ to_TO find_VB a_DT published_JJ description_NN of_IN this_DT variety_NN of_IN plague_NN ;_: *_CC but_CC an_DT allusion_NN to_TO it_PRP is_VBZ made_VBN in_IN the_DT accounts_NNS of_IN the_DT Pali_NNP epidemic_NN of_IN 1836_CD ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ stated_VBN that_IN the_DT Astrakhan_NNP outbreak_NN of_IN 1877_CD was_VBD first_RB regarded_VBN as_RB croupous_JJ pneumonia_NN or_CC as_IN typhus_RB complicated_VBN by_IN pneumonia_NN ;_: from_IN the_DT reports_NNS on_IN the_DT Hongkong_NNP epidemic_VB it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN plague-pneumonia_NN did_VBD not_RB occur_VB there_RB ._.
There_EX is_VBZ just_RB this_DT to_TO add_VB :_: the_DT usual_JJ definition_NN of_IN plague_NN in_IN works_NNS on_IN medicine_NN is-_NN ''_'' A_NNP specific_JJ fever_NN attended_VBN by_IN bubo_NN of_IN the_DT inguinal_JJ or_CC other_JJ glands_NNS ,_, ''_'' but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ clear_JJ that_IN such_PDT a_DT form_NN of_IN words_NNS does_VBZ not_RB include_VB all_DT varieties_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.

Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP has_VBZ carried_VBN out_RP a_DT long_JJ series_NN of_IN researches_NNS on_IN the_DT action_NN of_IN disinfectants_NNS on_IN the_DT microbe_NN of_IN bubonic_JJ plague_NN ._.
He_PRP finds_VBZ that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ somewhat_RB resistant_JJ to_TO the_DT action_NN of_IN carbolic_JJ acid_NN ._.
Both_DT phenyle_JJ ,_, lysol_JJ ,_, and_CC izal_RB appear_VBP to_TO have_VB a_DT more_RBR energetic_JJ action_NN ._.
Phenyle_NNP and_CC lysol_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, were_VBD found_VBN not_RB to_TO exert_VB a_DT marked_JJ bactericidal_JJ action_NN on_IN a_DT cow-_JJ dung_NN floor_NN ._.
Naphthaline_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO have_VB no_DT action_NN on_IN the_DT plague-microbe_NN ._.
The_DT plague-_JJ microbe_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB comparatively_RB resistant_JJ to_TO the_DT action_NN of_IN alkalies_NNS ,_, and_CC especially_RB sensitive_JJ to_TO the_DT action_NN of_IN acids_NNS ._.
Even_RB weak_JJ organic_JJ acids_NNS appear_VBP to_TO destroy_VB it_PRP readily_RB ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, usually_RB able_JJ to_TO exist_VB for_IN some_DT hours_NNS in_IN acid_JJ urine_NN ._.

Inorganic_JJ acids_NNS are_VBP naturally_RB still_RB more_RBR active_JJ ,_, and_CC Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP thinks_VBZ that_IN sulphuric_JJ acid_NN might_MD be_VB used_VBN as_IN a_DT cheap_JJ disinfectant_NN against_IN the_DT plague_JJ infection_NN ._.
The_DT microbe_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB resistant_JJ to_TO the_DT action_NN of_IN reducing_VBG agents_NNS ,_, and_CC sensitive_JJ to_TO the_DT action_NN of_IN oxidising_VBG agents_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN permanganate_NN of_IN potash_NN or_CC chloride_NN of_IN lime_NN ._.

Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP discusses_VBZ the_DT bearing_NN of_IN his_PRP$ observation_NN of_IN the_DT sensitiveness_NN of_IN the_DT microbe_NN to_TO oxidising_VBG agents_NNS on_IN the_DT generally_RB advocated_JJ plan_NN of_IN combating_VBG the_DT infection_NN by_IN means_NNS of_IN ventilation_NN ,_, which_WDT ,_, he_PRP shows_VBZ ,_, is_VBZ probably_RB a_DT means_NNS of_IN producing_VBG oxidation_NN under_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN air_NN and_CC light_NN ._.
A_DT series_NN of_IN observations_NNS was_VBD made_VBN in_IN houses_NNS undergoing_VBG disinfection_NN ._.
Results_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN throwing_VBG doubt_NN on_IN the_DT utility_NN of_IN sulphur_JJ fumigation_NN and_CC whitewashing_NN as_IN a_DT means_NN of_IN destroying_VBG the_DT microbe_NN ._.
Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP comes_VBZ to_TO the_DT conclusion_NN that_IN the_DT only_JJ substance_NN capable_JJ of_IN satisfactorily_RB disinfecting_VBG a_DT cowdung_NN floor_NN is_VBZ sublimate_JJ in_IN an_DT acid_JJ solution_NN ._.
Sublimate_NNP in_IN a_DT neutral_JJ solution_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB without_IN action_NN on_IN the_DT microbes_JJ present_NN ._.
As_IN an_DT after-treatment_JJ and_CC as_IN a_DT means_NN of_IN treating_VBG court-yards_NNS ,_, passages_NNS ,_, and_CC drains_NNS ,_, Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP recommends_VBZ sulphuric_JJ acid_NN in_IN a_DT strength_NN of_IN 1_CD in_IN 250_CD ,_, which_WDT solution_NN he_PRP shows_VBZ to_TO be_VB far_RB cheaper_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN other_JJ disinfectants_NNS in_IN common_JJ use_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ likely_JJ that_IN this_DT will_MD make_VB the_DT treated_JJ places_NNS for_IN some_DT time_NN unfitted_VBN to_TO act_VB as_IN a_DT nidus_NN for_IN the_DT microbe_NN ,_, for_IN the_DT latter_NN is_VBZ shown_VBN to_TO be_VB destroyed_VBN within_IN 5_CD minutes_NNS by_IN a_DT solution_NN of_IN the_DT strength_NN of_IN 1_CD in_IN 1429_CD ._.
Another_DT method_NN of_IN disinfecting_VBG floors_NNS investigated_VBN by_IN Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP is_VBZ by_IN covering_VBG them_PRP with_IN a_DT layer_NN of_IN combustible_JJ material_NN at_IN least_JJS two_CD inches_NNS thick_VBP ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ then_RB set_VBN on_IN fire_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD shown_VBN that_IN this_DT treatment_NN is_VBZ far_RB more_RBR efficacious_JJ than_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN ordinary_JJ disinfectants_NNS ._.
Though_IN it_PRP is_VBZ pointed_VBN out_RP the_DT risk_NN of_IN fire_NN may_MD prevent_VB the_DT wide_JJ application_NN of_IN the_DT method_NN in_IN towns_NNS ,_, it_PRP may_MD find_VB application_NN in_IN the_DT treatment_NN of_IN public_JJ latrines_NNS that_WDT may_MD be_VB supposed_VBN to_TO be_VB infected_VBN ,_, and_CC which_WDT are_VBP commonly_RB built_VBN of_IN incombustible_JJ materials_NNS ._.
Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP has_VBZ also_RB carried_VBN out_RP a_DT series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS on_IN the_DT asserted_JJ possibility_NN of_IN finding_VBG the_DT bubonic_JJ microbe_NN in_IN the_DT earth_NN of_IN infected_JJ houses_NNS ._.
He_PRP has_VBZ examined_VBN large_JJ num-_JJ bers_NNS of_IN specimens_NNS brought_VBN from_IN places_NNS in_IN which_WDT many_JJ people_NNS had_VBD recently_RB succumbed_VBN to_TO the_DT infection_NN without_IN finding_VBG the_DT microbe_NN in_IN any_DT case_NN ,_, with_IN one_CD probable_JJ exception_NN ._.
The_DT search_NN has_VBZ been_VBN carried_VBN out_RP by_IN several_JJ methods_NNS ,_, including_VBG one_CD communicated_VBN to_TO him_PRP by_IN Professor_NNP Calmette_NNP ,_, which_WDT method_VBP appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN the_DT one_CD employed_VBN by_IN Yersin_NNP in_IN Hongkong_NNP ,_, and_CC which_WDT led_VBD him_PRP to_TO positive_JJ results_NNS ._.
In_IN Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP 's_POS hands_VBZ no_DT such_JJ results_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN ,_, thus_RB throwing_VBG doubt_NN on_IN the_DT statement_NN that_IN the_DT microbe_NN can_MD be_VB readily_RB found_VBN in_IN the_DT soil_NN of_IN infected_JJ houses_NNS ,_, at_IN any_DT rate_NN by_IN existing_VBG methods_NNS ._.
The_DT only_JJ case_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT microbe_NN probably_RB identical_JJ with_IN that_DT of_IN plague_NN was_VBD met_VBN with_IN was_VBD in_IN some_DT salt-water_NN in_IN a_DT field_NN near_IN Siwri_NNP ,_, at_IN the_DT time_NN that_IN the_DT epidemic_NN was_VBD present_JJ in_IN the_DT place_NN ._.
Some_DT of_IN this_DT water_NN was_VBD injected_VBN into_IN a_DT mouse_NN ._.
On_IN its_PRP$ death_NN a_DT microbe_NN was_VBD isolated_VBN from_IN its_PRP$ organs_NNS ,_, which_WDT resembled_VBD that_IN of_IN plague_NN in_IN most_JJS respects_NNS ,_, but_CC which_WDT differ-_JJ ed_NN from_IN it_PRP in_IN the_DT rapidity_NN with_IN which_WDT it_PRP formed_VBD involution_NN forms_NNS on_IN agar-agar_NN ._.
Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP found_VBD that_IN the_DT plague-microbe_NN could_MD be_VB changed_VBN into_IN a_DT microbe_NN having_VBG these_DT aberrant_JJ characters_NNS by_IN cultivation_NN on_IN agar-agar_NN containing_NN three_CD or_CC four_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN salt_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN further_VBZ the_DT microbe_NN from_IN Siwri_NNP was_VBD pathogenic_JJ to_TO a_DT rabbit_NN that_WDT had_VBD not_RB been_VBN protected_VBN by_IN Haffkine_NNP 's_POS plague_NN vaccine_NN ,_, but_CC had_VBD no_DT effect_NN on_IN a_DT rabbit_NN that_WDT had_VBD been_VBN so_RB protected_JJ ._.

MEDICAL_JJ ASPECTS_NNP OF_NNP PLAGUE_NNP ._. ]_NN
111_CD Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP has_VBZ investigated_VBN the_DT relation_NN of_IN insects_NNS to_TO the_DT dissemination_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
He_PRP has_VBZ found_VBN the_DT microbe_NN in_IN bugs_NNS from_IN the_DT Infectious_NNP Diseases_NNP Hospital_NNP ._.
He_PRP has_VBZ also_RB found_VBN it_PRP in_IN auts_NNS that_WDT had_VBD recently_RB been_VBN eating_VBG rats_NNS dead_JJ of_IN plague_NN ._.
A_DT long_JJ series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS showed_VBD that_IN ants_NNS do_VBP not_RB retain_VB the_DT plague_NN infection_NN long_RB ,_, and_CC further_RB that_IN no_DT trace_NN of_IN infection_NN is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN ants_NNS from_IN localities_NNS in_IN which_WDT rats_NNS have_VBP not_RB been_VBN dying_VBG recently_RB ._.
Hence_NNP these_DT insects_NNS can_MD not_RB be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN important_JJ agents_NNS for_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
Experiments_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP on_IN different_JJ kinds_NNS of_IN grain_NN and_CC other_JJ articles_NNS of_IN export_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD infected_VBN with_IN plague-microbes_JJ under_IN many_JJ different_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
At_IN stated_VBN inter-_JJ vals_NNS extracts_NNS of_IN specimens_NNS of_IN the_DT infected_JJ grain_NN were_VBD prepared_JJ and_CC injected_VBN into_IN mice_NN ._.
By_IN this_DT means_VBZ it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN the_DT infection_NN usually_RB died_VBD out_IN within_IN 4_CD to_TO 6_CD days_NNS ._.
The_DT possibility_NN was_VBD indicated_VBN that_IN it_PRP might_MD in_IN exceptional_JJ cases_NNS survive_VBP for_IN so_RB long_RB as_IN 13_CD days_NNS ,_, but_CC of_IN this_DT no_DT definite_JJ proof_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN ._.
Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP points_VBZ out_RP that_DT grain_NN ,_, when_WRB it_PRP becomes_VBZ rotten_JJ ,_, usually_RB acquires_VBZ a_DT well-marked_JJ acid_NN reaction_NN owing_VBG to_TO the_DT production_NN of_IN various_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS from_IN the_DT decomposition_NN of_IN carbohydrates_NNS ._.
He_PRP has_VBZ found_VBN that_IN such_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS act_NN as_IN disinfectants_NNS for_IN the_DT bubonic_JJ microbe_NN ._.
Hence_NN it_PRP is_VBZ difficult_JJ to_TO believe_VB that_IN the_DT microbe_NN can_MD exist_VB in_IN rotten_JJ grain_NN ,_, as_IN has_VBZ been_VBN frequently_RB assumed_VBN ._.
The_DT matter_NN was_VBD put_VBN to_TO an_DT experimental_JJ test_NN by_IN Dr._NNP Srinivasa_NNP Rao_NNP while_IN working_VBG in_IN Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP 's_POS laboratory_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN the_DT microbe_NN always_RB dies_VBZ out_RP in_IN rotten_JJ grain_NN within_IN 2_CD to_TO 24_CD hours_NNS ._.
The_DT microbe_NN ,_, though_IN usually_RB dying_VBG out_RP ,_, when_WRB placed_VBN in_IN sterilised_JJ water_NN ,_, within_IN three_CD days_NNS ,_, appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB able_JJ to_TO survive_VB in_IN sterilised_JJ cowdung_NN for_IN several_JJ days_NNS ._.
The_DT observation_NN appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB some_DT bearing_NN on_IN the_DT question_NN of_IN the_DT persistence_NN of_IN the_DT infection_NN in_IN houses_NNS hav-_JJ ing_NN cowdung_NN and_CC mud_NN floors_NNS ._.
Through_IN lack_NN of_IN time_NN these_DT experiments_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB continued_VBN sufficiently_RB for_IN any_DT conclusion_NN to_TO be_VB arrived_VBN at_IN as_IN to_TO whether_IN any_DT particular_JJ kind_NN of_IN filth_NN is_VBZ more_RBR suitable_JJ than_IN another_DT to_TO sustain_VB the_DT life_NN of_IN the_DT microbe_NN ._.
But_CC the_DT general_JJ trend_NN of_IN Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP 's_POS observations_NNS is_VBZ to_TO indicate_VB that_IN the_DT chief_JJ source_NN of_IN infection_NN is_VBZ not_RB likely_JJ to_TO be_VB in_IN a_DT saprophytie_JJ form_NN of_IN the_DT microbe_NN in_IN the_DT outside_JJ world_NN ,_, but_CC more_JJR probably_RB in_IN the_DT recently_RB passed_VBN excreta_NN of_IN men_NNS or_CC animals_NNS suffering_VBG from_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
[_JJ Special_NNP emphasis_NN has_VBZ been_VBN laid_VBN on_IN the_DT last_JJ sentence_NN of_IN Dr._NNP Childe_NNP 's_POS Report_NNP ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO draw_VB attention_NN to_TO a_DT conjecture_NN ._.

113_CD CHAPTER_NN III_NNP ._.
Part_NN I.-_NNP The_DT Rise_NNP of_IN the_DT Plague_NNP Research_NNP Laboratory_NNP ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBN by_IN Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP in_IN Calcutta_NNP with_IN his_PRP$ anti-cholera_JJ inoculations_NNS -on_VBP which_WDT he_PRP had_VBD been_VBN engaged_VBN in_IN India_NNP since_IN 1893-had_CD been_VBN so_RB encouraging_JJ that_IN the_DT Government_NNP of_IN India_NNP sent_VBD him_PRP to_TO Bombay_NNP when_WRB plague_NN broke_VBD out_IN there_RB to_TO endeavour_VB to_TO discover_VB some_DT similar_JJ method_NN of_IN dealing_VBG with_IN that_DT disease_NN ._.
He_PRP reached_VBD Bombay_NNP on_IN the_DT 7th_CD of_IN October_NNP 1896_CD ,_, soon_RB after_IN the_DT existence_NN of_IN plague_NN had_VBD been_VBN publicly_RB recognised_VBN ,_, and_CC on_IN the_DT 8th_CD October_NNP began_VBD work_NN in_IN the_DT Petit_NNP Laboratory_NNP at_IN the_DT Grant_NNP Medical_NNP College_NNP His_PRP$ laboratory_NN consisted_VBD of_IN one_CD room_NN and_CC a_DT corridor_NN ,_, and_CC his_PRP$ staff_NN of_IN one_CD clerk_NN and_CC three_CD peons_NNS ._.
None_NN of_IN these_DT persons_NNS knew_VBD anything_NN of_IN bacteriological_JJ methods_NNS ,_, and_CC had_VBD therefore_VBN to_TO be_VB trained_VBN by_IN Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP personally_RB ._.
In_IN this_DT laboratory_NN Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP worked_VBD for_IN three_CD months_NNS before_IN he_PRP could_MD be_VB sure_JJ that_IN he_PRP had_VBD found_VBN a_DT means_NN of_IN diagnosing_VBG the_DT plague-microbe_NN with_IN unfailing_JJ certainty_NN ._.
This_DT he_PRP discovered_VBD in_IN a_DT distin-_JJ guishing_NN and_CC characteristic_JJ pendent_NN growth_NN having_VBG the_DT form_NN of_IN stalactites_NNS assumed_VBN by_IN the_DT microbes_NNS when_WRB they_PRP are_VBP cultivated_VBN in_IN a_DT suitable_JJ fluid_NN medium_NN ,_, and_CC allowed_VBD to_TO hang_VB together_RB in_IN chains_NNS composed_VBN of_IN numerous_JJ individuals_NNS ._.
From_IN pure_JJ cultivations_NNS of_IN the_DT plague_NN microbe_NN ,_, grown_VBN in_IN nutrient_JJ bouillon_NN ,_, as_IN above_IN ,_, Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP obtained_VBD a_DT fluid_NN with_IN which_WDT he_PRP was_VBD able_JJ to_TO work_VB out_RP a_DT preventive_JJ inoculation_NN to_TO check_VB the_DT susceptibility_NN of_IN man_NN and_CC of_IN animals_NNS to_TO the_DT disease_NN produced_VBN by_IN the_DT plague-germ_NN ._.
The_DT first_JJ demonstration_NN of_IN the_DT value_NN of_IN this_DT fluid_NN as_IN a_DT means_NN of_IN prophylaxis_NN to_TO plague_NN was_VBD made_VBN on_IN rabbits_NNS in_IN the_DT laboratory_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN rabbits_VBZ ar_RB tificially_RB infected_VBN with_IN virulent_JJ plague-microbes_JJ died_NN of_IN plague_NN ,_, whereas_IN rabbits_NNS which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN previously_RB inoculated_VBN with_IN this_DT protective_JJ fluid_NN resisted_VBD the_DT virulent_NN microbes_NN ,_, so_IN that_IN they_PRP were_VBD unable_JJ to_TO produce_VB the_DT disease_NN ._.
These_DT observations_NNS ,_, made_VBN in_IN December_NNP 1896_CD ,_, encouraged_VBD the_DT trial_NN of_IN the_DT fluid_NN on_IN human_JJ beings_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT 10th_CD January_NNP 1897_CD Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP underwent_JJ inoculation_NN with_IN this_DT same_JJ fluid_NN (_( Dr._NNP Surveyor_NNP ,_, who_WP had_VBD by_IN that_DT time_NN joined_VBD him_PRP in_IN the_DT laboratory_NN ,_, operating_VBG )_) ,_, and_CC proved_VBD on_IN his_PRP$ own_JJ person_NN the_DT harmlessness_NN of_IN the_DT vaccine_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT last_JJ week_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ month_NN the_DT historic_JJ outbreak_NN of_IN plague_NN in_IN the_DT Byculla_NNP House_NNP of_IN Correction_NNP in_IN Bombay_NNP took_VBD place_NN ,_, which_WDT afforded_VBD the_DT first_JJ opportunity_NN of_IN testing_VBG the_DT immunising_NN properties_NNS of_IN the_DT vaccine_NN Here_RB was_VBD a_DT population_NN of_IN 321_CD adult_NN prisoners_NNS living_VBG under_IN identical_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN life_NN ,_, exposed_VBN to_TO the_DT same_JJ chances_NNS of_IN infection_NN ._.
Of_IN these_DT 148_CD submitted_VBD to_TO inoculation_NN ._.
The_DT subsequent_JJ incidence_NN of_IN plague_NN in_IN this_DT population_NN was_VBD as_IN follows-_JJ Cases_NNS ._.
Deaths_NNS ._.
172_CD Uninoculated_JJ persons_NNS ..._: ..._: 12_CD 6_CD 147_CD Inoculated_JJ persons_NNS ..._: ..._: 2_CD 0_CD This_DT result_NN served_VBD as_IN an_DT inducement_NN to_TO many_JJ persons_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT room_NN in_IN the_DT laboratory_NN became_VBD crowded_VBN with_IN applicants_NNS for_IN inoculation_NN ._.
Dr._NNP Suveyor_NNP 's_POS health_NN having_VBG broken_VBN down_RP in_IN February_NNP 1897_CD ,_, his_PRP$ place_NN in_IN the_DT laboratory_NN was_VBD taken_VBN by_IN Dr._NNP Kalapesi_NNP ,_, and_CC help_NN in_IN other_JJ ways_NNS was_VBD given_VBN by_IN numerous_JJ volunteers_NNS among_IN whom_WP the_DT Professors_NNS of_IN the_DT Grant_NNP Medical_NNP College_NNP may_MD be_VB specially_RB mentioned_VBN ._.
Shortly_RB after_IN Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP came_VBD to_TO Bombay_VB on_IN this_DT special_JJ work_NN ,_, a_DT Plague_NNP Research_NNP Committee_NNP ,_, consisting_VBG of-_JJ Major_NNP Manser_NNP ,_, I._NNP M._NNP S._NNP ..._: ..._: President_NNP ,_, Captain_NNP L._NNP F._NNP Childe_NNP ,_, I._NNP M._NNP S._NNP ,_, W._NNP M._NNP Haffkine_NNP ,_, Esq._NNP ,_, C._NNP I._NNP E._NNP ,_, Members_NNP ,_, E._NNP H._NNP Hankin_NNP ,_, Esq._NNP ,_, Dr._NNP Surveyor_NNP ,_, 29_CD 114_CD [_JJ CHAP_NNP ._.
III._NNP ,_, PT_NNP ._.
I._NN was_VBD appointed_VBN by_IN Government_NNP in_IN October_NNP 1898_CD ._.
The_DT objects_NNS of_IN this_DT Committee_NNP covered_VBD a_DT very_RB wide_JJ range_NN and_CC were_VBD roughly_RB distributed_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: -Major_JJ Manser_NNP ,_, -whose_JJ unfortunate_JJ death_NN from_IN pneumonic-plague_NN in_IN February_NNP 1897_CD necessitated_VBD his_PRP$ place_NN being_VBG filled_VBN by_IN Major_JJ Lyons_NNS ,_, I._NNP M._NNP S.-clinical_JJ aspects_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN ;_: Captain_NNP Childe_NNP ,_, pathology_NN of_IN plague_NN ;_: Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP ,_, the_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT microbe_NN and_CC its_PRP$ relation_NN to_TO man_NN and_CC animals_NNS ,_, prophylaxis_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.
;_: Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP ,_, value_NN of_IN disinfectants_NNS and_CC mode_NN of_IN dissemination_NN in_IN Nature_NNP ;_: Dr._NNP Surveyor_NNP ,_, plague_NN in_IN animals_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ both_DT fitting_JJ and_CC interesting_JJ to_TO record_VB here_RB that_IN Dr._NNP Manser_NNP 's_POS case_NN afforded_VBD the_DT first_JJ demonstration_NN of_IN the_DT plague-bacillus_NN in_IN the_DT sputum_NN of_IN the_DT victims_NNS of_IN the_DT pneumonic_JJ form_NN of_IN plague_NN (_( a_DT form_NN previously_RB described_VBN by_IN Dr._NNP White_NNP in_IN 1815_CD in_IN a_DT little_JJ known_JJ report_NN *_NN )_) ;_: a_DT pure_JJ culture_NN of_IN the_DT plague-bacillus_JJ being_VBG recovered_VBN from_IN his_PRP$ handkerchief_NN by_IN Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP ;_: to_TO whom_WP it_PRP was_VBD sent_VBN for_IN examination_NN by_IN Captain_NNP Childe_NNP ,_, who_WP was_VBD row_VB the_DT first_JJ to_TO suspect_VB this_DT new_JJ development_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
Suspicions_NNS of_IN the_DT infectious_JJ nature_NN of_IN this_DT type_NN of_IN plague_NN were_VBD now_RB first_JJ arosued_VBN by_IN the_DT death_NN ,_, from_IN this_DT very_RB type_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, of_IN Miss_NNP Joyce_NNP ,_, the_DT lady_NN nurse_NN who_WP attended_VBD Major_NNP Manser_NNP in_IN his_PRP$ last_JJ illness_NN ._.
Full_NNP details_NNS of_IN Dr._NNP Manser_NNP 's_POS case_NN are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Chapter_NNP II._NNP ,_, p._VBD 108_CD ._.
For_IN the_DT next_JJ year_NN and_CC more_JJR ,_, therefore_RB ,_, Haffkine_NNP 's_POS Laboratory_NNP ,_, such_JJ as_IN it_PRP was_VBD ,_, although_IN its_PRP$ staff_NN and_CC a_DT portion_NN of_IN Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP 's_POS salary_NN were_VBD defrayed_VBN by_IN the_DT Municipality_NNP ,_, was_VBD but_CC a_DT branch_NN of_IN this_DT Committee_NNP ._.

At_IN this_DT stage_NN Major_NNP Bannerman_NNP ,_, I._NNP M._NNP S._NNP ,_, who_WP had_VBD been_VBN deputed_VBN by_IN the_DT Government_NNP of_IN Madras_NNP to_TO study_VB under_IN Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP ,_, became_VBD associated_VBN with_IN him_PRP ,_, and_CC they_PRP ,_, with_IN two_CD civilian_JJ doctors_NNS ,_, had_VBD the_DT assistance_NN of_IN a_DT staff_NN of_IN two_CD clerks_NNS ,_, three_CD peons_NNS ,_, and_CC four_CD hamals_NNS in_IN the_DT work_NN of_IN the_DT laboratory_NN ._.
The_DT Cliff_NNP bungalow_NN was_VBD in_IN use_NN till_NN November_NNP 1897_CD ,_, when_WRB ,_, it_PRP being_VBG required_VBN for_IN other_JJ purposes_NNS ,_, a_DT move_NN was_VBD made_VBN to_TO another_DT house_NN in_IN Nepean_NNP Sea_NNP Road_NNP ,_, also_RB provided_VBN by_IN the_DT Municipality_NNP ._.
At_IN this_DT time_NN H._NNP H._NNP Aga_NNP Khan_NNP ,_, head_NN of_IN the_DT Khoja_NNP community_NN ,_, who_WP had_VBD all_DT along_IN taken_VBN great_JJ interest_NN in_IN inoculation_NN ,_, and_CC had_VBD ,_, indeed_RB ,_, opened_VBD a_DT station_NN for_IN the_DT benefit_NN of_IN this_DT com-_JJ munity_NN in_IN one_CD of_IN his_PRP$ houses_NNS in_IN Love_NNP Lane_NNP ,_, Bombay_NNP ,_, offered_VBN to_TO place_VB at_IN Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP 's_POS disposal_NN the_DT large_JJ house_NN called_VBD Khushru_NNP Lodge_NNP in_IN Nesbit_NNP Lane_NNP ,_, Mazagaon_NNP ._.
This_DT house_NN was_VBD fitted_VBN up_RP with_IN gas_NN and_CC water_NN ,_, and_CC otherwise_RB rendered_VBN suitable_JJ for_IN a_DT laboratory_NN ,_, at_IN His_PRP$ Highness_NNP '_POS expense_NN :_: and_CC for_IN a_DT year_NN from_IN February_NNP 1898_CD ,_, Khushru_NNP Lodge_NNP fulfilled_VBD its_PRP$ function_NN admirably_RB ._.
The_DT staff_NN under_IN Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP at_IN this_DT time_NN (_( February_NNP 1898_CD )_) consisted_VBD of_IN one_CD Commissioned_JJ Officer_NNP ,_, I._NNP M._NNP S._NNP ,_, four_CD special_JJ Plague_NNP Medical_NNP Officers_NNP sent_VBD out_RP by_IN the_DT Secretary_NNP of_IN State_NNP for_IN India_NNP ,_, four_CD local_JJ medical_JJ men_NNS ,_, three_CD clerks_NNS ,_, three_CD peons_NNS ,_, and_CC six_CD hamals_NNS ._.

PLAGUE_NNP RESEARCH_NNP LABORATORY_NNP ._. ]_NN
115_CD were_VBD accepted_VBN by_IN the_DT Government_NNP of_IN India_NNP *_NN :_: the_DT Laboratory_NNP itself_PRP thus_RB becoming_VBG an_DT Im-_JJ perial_JJ concern_NN ._.
Fortunately_RB ,_, a_DT sufficiently_RB large_JJ place_NN was_VBD available_JJ in_IN the_DT old_JJ Government_NNP House_NNP at_IN Parel_NNP ,_, and_CC hither_VBZ the_DT Laboratory_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN finally_RB moved_VBN ,_, and_CC hero_NN it_PRP will_MD have_VB room_NN to_TO expand_VB as_IN circumstances_NNS may_MD demand_VB ._.
The_DT new_JJ Laboratory_NNP at_IN Government_NNP House_NNP ,_, Parel_NNP ,_, was_VBD formally_RB opened_VBN by_IN H._NNP E._NNP the_DT Governor_NNP ,_, Lord_NNP Sandhurst_NNP ,_, on_IN the_DT 10th_CD and_CC 26th_CD of_IN August_NNP 1899_CD ,_, in_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ and_CC representative_JJ gathering_NN of_IN Europeans_NNPS and_CC natives_NNS ._.
The_DT following_JJ accounts_NNS of_IN these_DT functions_NNS are_VBP taken_VBN from_IN the_DT Times_NNP of_IN India_NNP :_: -_: ``_`` The_DT new_JJ Plague_NNP Laboratory_NNP at_IN Parel_NNP was_VBD yesterday_NN (_( 10th_CD August_NNP 1899_CD )_) evening_VBG formally_RB opened_VBN by_IN His_PRP$ Excellency_NN the_DT Governor_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
There_EX were_VBD a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN the_DT principal_JJ European_JJ residents_NNS present_JJ ,_, and_CC many_JJ influential_JJ natives_NNS were_VBD also_RB in_IN attendance_NN ._.
The_DT entire_JJ premises_NNS had_VBD been_VBN most_JJS carefully_RB prepared_VBN for_IN the_DT occasion_NN ,_, so_IN that_IN visitors_NNS would_MD be_VB able_JJ to_TO see_VB the_DT whole_JJ process_NN of_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN plague_JJ prophylactic_NN ._.
Besides_IN this_DT ,_, there_EX were_VBD several_JJ micioscopes_NNS through_IN which_WDT might_MD be_VB seen_VBN various_JJ forms_NNS of_IN bacteria_NNS ,_, and_CC excellent_JJ plates_NNS made_VBD clearer_NN ,_, in_IN certain_JJ instances_NNS ,_, the_DT life_NN history_NN of_IN disease-_JJ germs_NNS ._.
At_IN every_DT point_NN were_VBD those_DT capable_JJ and_CC willing_JJ to_TO explain_VB ,_, and_CC few_JJ could_MD have_VB left_VBN the_DT building_NN without_IN being_VBG wiser_NN in_IN some_DT particular_JJ than_IN when_WRB they_PRP entered_VBD ._.
His_PRP$ Excellency_NN appeared_VBD to_TO take_VB the_DT deepest_JJS interest_NN in_IN all_DT he_PRP saw_VBD and_CC heard_NN ,_, and_CC great_JJ credit_NN is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT officers_NNS of_IN the_DT Laboratory_NNP for_IN the_DT excellent_JJ arrangements_NNS which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN made_VBN ._.
These_DT officers_NNS ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB mentioned_VBN ,_, are_VBP :_: -Major_JJ Bannerman_NNP ,_, Captain_NNP Milne_NNP ,_, Dr._NNP Marsh_NNP ,_, Dr._NNP Maitland_NNP Gibson_NNP ,_, Dr._NNP Hanna_NNP ,_, Dr._NNP Starkey_NNP ,_, Dr._NNP Paymaster_NNP ,_, Dr._NNP Kapadia_NNP ,_, and_CC Dr._NNP Cordeiro_NNP ._.
``_`` After_IN the_DT tour_NN of_IN inspection_NN had_VBD been_VBN completed_VBN ,_, all_DT returned_VBN to_TO the_DT porch_NN ,_, where_WRB ,_, at_IN the_DT request_NN of_IN His_PRP$ Excellency_NN ,_, Major_NNP Bannerman_NNP gave_VBD a_DT brief_JJ account_NN of_IN the_DT prophylactic_JJ and_CC its_PRP$ action_NN ._.
His_PRP$ speech_NN was_VBD as_IN follows_VBZ :_: -_: ``_`` Your_PRP$ Excellency_NN ,_, Mr._NNP Woodburn_NNP ,_, Ladies_NNP and_CC Gentlemen-'It_NNP is_VBZ an_DT unexpected_JJ pleasure_NN that_WDT has_VBZ fallen_VBN to_TO my_PRP$ lot_NN ,_, as_IN I_PRP was_VBD not_RB aware_JJ that_IN I_PRP should_MD be_VB called_VBN upon_IN to_TO explain_VB the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN the_DT prophylactic_NN ,_, which_WDT you_PRP have_VBP just_RB had_VBN demonstrated_VBN to_TO you_PRP ._.
I_PRP will_MD try_VB ,_, however_RB ,_, to_TO explain_VB in_IN as_IN few_JJ words_NNS as_IN possible_JJ this_DT somewhat_RB technical_JJ subject_NN ._.
The_DT first_JJ thing_NN to_TO do_VB is_VBZ to_TO find_VB a_DT suitable_JJ medium_NN or_CC soil_NN on_IN which_WDT to_TO grow_VB the_DT plague-germ_NN ._.
The_DT process_NN of_IN preparation_NN you_PRP have_VBP all_DT seen_VBN and_CC had_VBD demonstrated_VBN to_TO you_PRP by_IN Captain_NNP Milne_NNP ._.
Nothing_NN has_VBZ been_VBN hidden_VBN from_IN you_PRP ,_, for_IN there_EX is_VBZ nothing_NN requiring_VBG concealment_NN ,_, you_PRP have_VBP seen_VBN the_DT goat_NN 's_POS flesh_NN minced_VBD up_RP ,_, mixed_JJ with_IN acid_JJ ,_, digested_VBN by_IN heat_NN ,_, filtered_VBN ,_, neutralised_JJ and_CC finally_RB sterilised_VBN in_IN the_DT large_JJ steriliser_NN ._.
We_PRP have_VBP now_RB got_VBN our_PRP$ soil_NN ready_NN for_IN sowing_NN ,_, so_IN the_DT seed_NN must_MD be_VB procured_VBN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ got_RB ,_, as_IN you_PRP all_DT know_VBP ,_, from_IN the_DT bubo_NN of_IN a_DT plague-patient_NN ._.
Now_RB ,_, in_IN agriculture_NN two_CD things_NNS are_VBP required_VBN to_TO produce_VB a_DT good_JJ crop_NN ,_, viz._NN ,_, a_DT good_JJ soil_NN and_CC good_JJ seed_NN ._.
Similarly_RB ,_, our_PRP$ seed_NN must_MD be_VB pure_JJ and_CC unmixed_JJ with_IN the_DT seeds_NNS of_IN any_DT other_JJ disease_NN ,_, for_IN we_PRP wish_VBP to_TO have_VB a_DT pure_JJ growth_NN ._.
For_IN this_DT purpose_NN we_PRP first_RB sow_VBD our_PRP$ plague-seed_NN in_IN a_DT tube_JJ full_JJ of_IN jelly_RB ,_, on_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN which_WDT it_PRP is_VBZ spread_VBN out_RP ._.
I_PRP trust_VBP you_PRP have_VBP all_DT noticed_VBN those_DT tubes_NNS of_IN jelly_RB as_IN you_PRP passed_VBD through_IN the_DT rooms_NNS ._.
Two_CD days_NNS after_IN it_PRP is_VBZ sown_VBN we_PRP can_MD tell_VB by_IN looking_VBG at_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT jelly_NN ,_, whether_IN the_DT growth_NN now_RB visible_JJ is_VBZ pure_JJ plague_NN or_CC not_RB ,_, just_RB as_IN any_DT of_IN you_PRP can_MD tell_VB the_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT buttercups_NNS and_CC daisies_NNS growing_VBG in_IN your_PRP$ gardens_NNS ,_, or_CC as_IN you_PRP can_MD pick_VB out_RP your_PRP$ friends_NNS in_IN a_DT crowd_NN by_IN '_'' head_NN mark_NN '_'' as_IN it_PRP were_VBD ._.
To_TO make_VB assurance_NN doubly_RB sure_JJ ,_, however_RB ,_, we_PRP take_VBP a_DT few_JJ of_IN these_DT plague-bacilli_NNS from_IN the_DT jelly_NN tube_NN ,_, and_CC sow_VB them_PRP in_IN a_DT small_JJ flask_NN of_IN clear_JJ broth_NN and_CC watch_NN to_TO see_VB whether_IN these_DT long_JJ silky_NN stalactites_NNS are_VBP formed_VBN ,_, which_WDT ,_, I_PRP am_VBP sure_RB ,_, you_PRP must_MD all_DT have_VBP admired_VBN in_IN the_DT dark_NN room_NN inside_IN ._.
This_DT appearance_NN is_VBZ an_DT absolutely_RB certain_JJ sign_NN that_IN we_PRP are_VBP dealing_VBG with_IN the_DT plague-_JJ germ_NN ,_, for_IN no_DT other_JJ known_VBN germ_JJ produces_NNS similar_JJ stalactites_NNS ._.
This_DT important_JJ discovery_NN made_VBN by_IN Haffkine_NNP ,_, renders_VBZ it_PRP possible_JJ for_IN us_PRP to_TO make_VB an_DT anti-plague_JJ vaccine_NN ,_, and_CC to_TO save_VB thousands_NNS of_IN lives_NNS which_WDT would_MD otherwise_RB be_VB lost_VBN ._.
When_WRB we_PRP are_VBP thus_RB quite_RB certain_JJ ,_, then_RB ,_, that_IN we_PRP are_VBP dealing_VBG with_IN the_DT plague-germ_JJ alone_NN ,_, and_CC have_VBP no_DT other_JJ germs_NNS in_IN our_PRP$ flask_NN ,_, we_PRP transfer_VBP its_PRP$ contents_NNS to_TO the_DT long-nosed_JJ Pasteur_NNP flask_NN ,_, which_WDT you_PRP saw_VBD Dr._NNP Maitland_NNP Gibson_NNP working_VBG with_IN ._.
By_IN means_NNS of_IN this_DT ingenious_JJ contrivance_NN we_PRP can_MD sow_VB any_DT number_NN of_IN large_JJ fermentation_NN flasks_NNS ._.
These_DT large_JJ flasks_NNS are_VBP then_RB placed_VBN on_IN tables_NNS in_IN the_DT dark_NN room_NN ,_, and_CC allowed_VBD to_TO ferment_VB for_IN six_CD weeks_NNS ,_, when_WRB the_DT prophylactic_NN is_VBZ ready_JJ for_IN use_NN ,_, after_IN the_DT live_JJ germs_NNS in_IN the_DT flasks_NNS have_VBP been_VBN killed_VBN by_IN heat_NN ._.

The_DT room_NN then_RB contained_VBD 1,238_CD flasks_NNS ,_, containing_VBG 2,058_CD litres_NNS of_IN fermenting_VBG bouillon_NN ,_, weighing_VBG 2_CD tons_NNS ,_, 1_CD cwt._NN ,_, or_CC about_IN 411,600_CD adult_NN doses_NNS of_IN vaccine_NN ._.
