119_CD CHAPTER_NN III_NNP ._.
Part_NN II.-The_NNP Bacteriology_NNP of_IN Plague_NNP ._.
Plague_NNP is_VBZ an_DT acute_JJ disease_NN caused_VBN by_IN a_DT bacillus_NN belonging_VBG to_TO a_DT class_NN of_IN specifically_RB pathogenic_JJ micro-organisms_NNS ,_, whose_WP$ morphological_JJ and_CC other_JJ characters_NNS show_VBP considerable_JJ resemblance_NN ._.
Such_JJ organisms_NNS are_VBP those_DT of_IN swine-fever_JJ ,_, chicken-cholera_NN ,_, &_CC c._NN ,_, (_( Klein_NNP )_) ._.
*_NN To_TO a_DT Japanese_JJ investigator-Kitasato-belongs_NNS the_DT honour_NN of_IN having_VBG first_JJ identified_VBN the_DT organism_NN of_IN plague_NN ._.
This_DT he_PRP did_VBD in_IN 1894_CD ,_, when_WRB plague_NN was_VBD raging_VBG in_IN Hongkong_NNP ,_, and_CC his_PRP$ results_NNS have_VBP since_IN been_VBN verified_VBN and_CC amplified_VBN by_IN numerous_JJ observers_NNS throughout_IN the_DT world_NN ,_, but_CC more_JJR particularly_RB in_IN India_NNP ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ now_RB been_VBN for_IN 3_CD years_NNS the_DT most_RBS important_JJ focus_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN THE_NNP BACILLUS_NNP OF_NNP PLAGUE-'BACILLUS_NNP PESTIS_NNP ORIENTALIS_NNP '_POS (_( Kitasato_NNP ,_, Yersin_NNP )_) ._.
Morphology_NNP ._.
The_DT plague-bacillus_JJ ,_, as_IN it_PRP appears_VBZ in_IN microscopical_JJ specimens_NNS from_IN the_DT blood_NN and_CC tissues_NNS of_IN animals_NNS ,_, is_VBZ a_DT short_JJ rod_NN with_IN rounded_JJ ends_NNS ,_, 08._CD to_TO 16._CD in_IN length_NN ,_, and_CC less_JJR than_IN half_NN that_IN in_IN breadth_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ sporeless_JJ ,_, and_CC non-motile_JJ in_IN the_DT ordinary_JJ sense_NN of_IN the_DT word_NN ._.
The_DT bacillus_NN is_VBZ stained_VBN readily_RB by_IN the_DT ordinary_JJ basic_JJ dyes_NNS ._.
A_DT weak_JJ solution_NN of_IN Carbol-Fuchsin_NNP or_CC of_IN Aniline-Gentian-Violet_NNP applied_VBD for_IN 1-2_JJ minutes_NNS will_MD be_VB found_VBN satis-_JJ factory_NN for_IN ordinary_JJ purposes_NNS ._.
On_IN examination_NN ,_, such_JJ stained_VBN specimens_NNS taken_VBN from_IN tissues_NNS show_VBP an_DT intensification_NN of_IN colour_NN at_IN the_DT poles_NNS (_( vide_IN Plate_NNP I_PRP ._. )_)
which_WDT is_VBZ very_RB characteristic_JJ and_CC careful_JJ focussing_NN discloses_NNS also_RB an_DT appearance_NN like_IN a_DT capsule_NN ._.
But_CC it_PRP is_VBZ doubtful_JJ if_IN this_DT capsule_NN is_VBZ a_DT true_JJ one_CD ._.
The_DT bacillus_NN does_VBZ not_RB retain_VB the_DT stain_NN by_IN Grams_NNP '_POS method_NN ._.
In_IN ordinary_JJ bubonic_JJ plague_NN in_IN man_NN the_DT micro-organism_NN is_VBZ found_VBN in_IN the_DT bubo_NN ._.
Just_RB before_IN death_NN it_PRP is_VBZ often_RB found_VBN in_IN the_DT blood_NN ,_, but_CC in_IN septicmic_JJ cases_NNS it_PRP appears_VBZ in_IN that_DT fluid_NN in_IN the_DT early_JJ stages_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ noteworthy_JJ that_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN the_DT bacillus_NN in_IN ._.
the_DT blood_NN does_VBZ not_RB necessarily_RB indicate_VB a_DT fatal_JJ attack_NN ._.
In_IN pneumonic_JJ cases_NNS plague-bacilli_JJ may_MD be_VB demonstrated_VBN in_IN the_DT sputum_NN ,_, In_IN post-mortems_NNS of_IN ordinary_JJ bubonic_JJ plague_NN cases_NNS the_DT bacilli_NN are_VBP found_VBN not_RB only_RB in_IN the_DT bubo_NN ,_, but_CC in_IN great_JJ abundance_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT liver_NN and_CC spleen_NN ._.
Sometime_RB these_DT organs_NNS may_MD be_VB swarming_VBG with_IN bacilli_NNS ,_, while_IN the_DT blood_NN is_VBZ almost_RB free_JJ ._.
This_DT occurs_VBZ more_RBR frequently_RB in_IN rats_NNS than_IN in_IN man_NN ._.
Dr_NNP ._.
Bitter_NNP says_VBZ there_EX are_VBP relatively_RB more_RBR bacilli_NNS in_IN the_DT spleen_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT other_JJ organs_NNS or_CC tissues_NNS ._.
Bacilli_NNP grown_VBN artificially_RB on_IN solid_JJ media_NNS show_VBP in_IN young_JJ cultures_NNS ,_, after_IN staining_VBG ,_, appearances_NNS similar_JJ to_TO those_DT found_VBN in_IN the_DT tissues_NNS ,_, except_IN that_IN they_PRP take_VBP the_DT dye_NN uniformly_RB and_CC seldom_VB show_VBP the_DT intensification_NN of_IN the_DT stain_NN at_IN the_DT poles_NNS mentioned_VBN above_IN ._.
Elougated_VBN forms_NNS are_VBP also_RB to_TO be_VB noted_VBN ,_, and_CC are_VBP very_RB characteristic_JJ ._.
(_( Vide_NNP Plate_NNP II_NNP ._. )_)
If_IN an_DT agar_JJ culture_NN be_VB examined_VBN daily_RB for_IN some_DT ten_JJ days_NNS ,_, gradual_JJ changes_NNS inform_NN and_CC size_NN and_CC in_IN effects_NNS of_IN staining_NN will_MD be_VB observed_VBN ._.
The_DT bacilli_NN become_NN swollen_NN ,_, assuming_VBG ,_, after_IN the_DT first_JJ 2_CD or_CC 3_CD days_NNS ,_, lemon_NN and_CC pear_JJ shapes_NNS ,_, and_CC later_RB exhibiting_VBG polymorphic_JJ *_NNP Metschnikoff_NNP ,_, however_RB ,_, classifies_VBZ the_DT plague-bacillus_JJ ,_, in_IN a_DT group_NN of_IN cocco-bacilli_NN ,_, along_IN with_IN bacillus_JJ typh-_JJ abdominalis_NN ,_, bacillus_NN coli_NNS ,_, etc._FW ,_, all_DT characterised_VBN by_IN the_DT facility_NN with_IN which_WDT ,_, at_IN some_DT period_NN of_IN their_PRP$ existence_NN ,_, they_PRP can_MD be_VB stained_VBN to_TO show_VB the_DT bi-polar_JJ appearance_NN ._.
Mr._NNP Morvyn-Gordon_NNP has_VBZ stained_VBN flagella_NN in_IN specimens_NNS from_IN an_DT Agar-culture_JJ grown_NN for_IN 24_CD hours_NNS at_IN 37_CD C._NNP 120_CD [_NNP CHAP_NNP ._.

II_NNP ._.
figures-spindle_JJ ,_, dumb-bell_JJ or_CC disc-shaped-some_JJ of_IN these_DT being_VBG many_JJ times_NNS larger_JJR than_IN the_DT original_JJ bacilli_NN ._.
Such_JJ appearances_NNS are_VBP known_VBN as_IN ``_`` involution_NN forms_NNS ,_, ''_'' and_CC in_IN the_DT early_JJ days_NNS of_IN plague_NN bacteriology_NN ,_, they_PRP were_VBD considered_VBN to_TO be_VB very_RB important_JJ from_IN a_DT diagnostiv_JJ point_NN of_IN view_NN ._.
(_( Vide_NNP Plates_NNP III_NNP ._.
and_CC IV_NNP ._. )_)
A_DT number_NN of_IN cultures_NNS were_VBD however_RB found_VBN by_IN Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP which_WDT did_VBD not_RB show_VB these_DT appearances_NNS ;_: and_CC he_PRP afterwards_VBZ found_VBN ,_, in_IN an_DT enquiry_NN made_VBD together_RB with_IN Major_NNP Bannerman_NNP ,_, that_IN these_DT appearances_NNS belong_VBP to_TO microbes_VB taken_VBN recently_RB from_IN plague_NN patients_NNS and_CC that_IN they_PRP gradually_RB lose_VBP them_PRP in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN cultivation_NN in_IN the_DT Laboratory_NNP ._.
Mr._NNP Hankin_NNP and_CC Capt_NNP ._.
Leumann_NNP aver_NN that_IN these_DT forms_NNS are_VBP produced_VBN most_RBS readily_RB by_IN employing_VBG Agar_NNP to_TO which_WDT an_DT excess_NN of_IN salt_NN has_VBZ been_VBN added_VBN ._.
Mr._NNP Haftkine_NNP finds_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, that_IN they_PRP are_VBP equally_RB demonstrable_JJ ,_, in_IN cultures_NNS of_IN bacilli_NN taken_VBN direct_JJ from_IN the_DT body_NN ,_, on_IN ordinary_JJ Agar_NNP ,_, if_IN it_PRP is_VBZ ``_`` dry_JJ ``_`` and_CC has_VBZ a_DT definite_JJ alkaline_JJ reaction_NN :_: and_CC adds_VBZ that_DT involution_NN forms_NNS are_VBP most_RBS readily_RB demonstrable_JJ on_IN old_JJ and_CC dry_JJ Agar_NNP ,_, especially_RB when_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ inseminated_JJ very_RB abundantly_RB ;_: and_CC that_IN they_PRP are_VBP never_RB seen_VBN in_IN liquid_JJ cultures_NNS ,_, but_CC can_MD be_VB observed_VBN in_IN the_DT tissues_NNS of_IN animals_NNS ._.
Captain_NNP Childe_NNP reports_NNS that_IN similar_JJ ``_`` rounded_VBD or_CC swollen_VBN ''_'' forms_NNS are_VBP to_TO be_VB found_VBN in_IN the_DT tissues_NNS of_IN the_DT human_JJ body_NN ,_, if_IN the_DT examination_NN be_VB made_VBN from_IN 5_CD to_TO 12_CD hours_NNS after_IN death_NN ;_: the_DT change_NN being_VBG ,_, in_IN his_PRP$ opinion_NN ,_, a_DT post-mortem_JJ one_NN ._.
Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP had_VBD previously_RB found_VBN such_JJ forms_NNS in_IN the_DT body_NN of_IN a_DT rabbit_NN ,_, and_CC suggested_VBD that_IN they_PRP might_MD be_VB present_JJ in_IN human_JJ bodies_NNS also_RB ._.
The_DT bacilli_NN cultivated_VBN in_IN Bouillon_NNP show_VBP a_DT tendency_NN to_TO form_VB short_JJ chains_NNS of_IN 5_CD or_CC 6_CD bacilli_NN (_( vide_JJ Plate_NNP V._NNP )_) -each_VBP chain_NN showing_VBG generally_RB a_DT slight_JJ but_CC very_RB remarkable_JJ bend_NN :_: but_CC this_DT latter_JJ characteristic_NN is_VBZ not_RB yet_RB perhaps_RB fully_RB established_VBN ._.
They_PRP also_RB stain_VBP evenly_RB and_CC very_RB deeply_RB ,_, but_CC in_IN old_JJ cultures_NNS most_JJS of_IN the_DT bacilli_NN disintegrate_NN and_CC they_PRP do_VBP not_RB then_RB take_VB the_DT stain_NN well_RB ._.
Biology_NNP and_CC cultural_JJ characters_NNS ._.
The_DT plague-bacillus_JJ forms_NNS characteristic_JJ appearances_NNS on_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT common_JJ media_NNS ._.
In_IN India_NNP ,_, for_IN general_JJ work_NN ,_, preparations_NNS of_IN Agar-agar_NNP are_VBP usually_RB employed_VBN ._.
Gelatine_NNP liquefies_NNS at_IN the_DT ordinary_JJ tempera-_JJ ture_NN of_IN hot_JJ climates_NNS ,_, and_CC cool_JJ incubators_NNS ,_, etc._NN ,_, are_VBP necessary_JJ for_IN its_PRP$ use_NN ._.
Growth_NNP in_IN Bouillon_NNP ._.
Haffkine_NNP 's_POS Stalactites_NNP ._.
In_IN ordinary_JJ faintly_RB alkaline_VBP or_CC neutral_JJ peptone_NN bouillon_NN ,_, and_CC especially_RB if_IN a_DT few_JJ drops_NNS of_IN oil_NN or_CC fat_NN (_( ghi_NN ,_, cocoanut_NN ,_, olive_JJ ,_, or_CC linseed_VB oil_NN )_) are_VBP added_VBN to_TO it_PRP ,_, the_DT appearances_NNS known_VBN as_IN ``_`` Haffkine_NNP 's_POS stalactite_JJ growth_NN ''_'' will_MD be_VB seen_VBN ._.
Ten_CD to_TO twelve_VB hours_NNS after_IN insemination_NN a_DT diffuse_NN cloudiness_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT universal_JJ growth_NN of_IN the_DT bacilli_NN throughout_IN the_DT liquid_NN is_VBZ to_TO be_VB observed_VBN ._.
The_DT diffuse_NN cloudi-_JJ ness_NN disappears_NNS later_RB on_IN ,_, and_CC colonies_NNS of_IN bacilli_NN are_VBP to_TO be_VB seen_VBN hanging_VBG from_IN the_DT surface_NN in_IN stalactite_JJ form_NN ,_, sometimes_RB reaching_VBG to_TO the_DT bottom_NN or_CC sides_NNS of_IN the_DT flask_NN to_TO which_WDT they_PRP may_MD be_VB attached_VBN ._.
These_DT colonies_NNS ,_, thin_JJ ,_, and_CC more_RBR or_CC less_RBR numerous_JJ at_IN first_JJ ,_, quickly_RB increase_NN in_IN size_NN and_CC number_NN so_RB as_IN to_TO form_VB a_DT thick_JJ jungle_NN of_IN stalactites_NNS ._.
This_DT appearance_NN is_VBZ ,_, so_RB far_RB as_IN we_PRP know_VBP at_IN present_JJ ,_, absolutely_RB diagnostic_JJ of_IN plague_NN ._.
Sometimes_RB no_DT stalactites_NNS are_VBP to_TO be_VB seen_VBN in_IN the_DT begin-_JJ ning_NN ,_, but_CC white_JJ spots_NNS ,_, due_JJ to_TO the_DT zoogleic_NN masses_NNS of_IN bacilli_NN ,_, appear_VBP on_IN the_DT sides_NNS of_IN the_DT flask_NN and_CC on_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT liquid_NN ._.
Later_RB on_IN ,_, when_WRB the_DT stalactites_NNS appear_VBP ,_, these_DT white_JJ masses_NNS of_IN growth_NN are_VBP found_VBN to_TO correspond_VB to_TO the_DT points_NNS of_IN attachment_NN of_IN the_DT stalactites_NNS ._.
(_( Vide_NNP Plate_NNP VI_NNP ._. )_)
This_DT stalactite_JJ growth_NN is_VBZ very_RB fragile_JJ ,_, and_CC for_IN its_PRP$ proper_NN development_NN requires_VBZ that_IN the_DT bouillon_NN be_VB kept_VBN absolutely_RB at_IN rest_NN ._.
A_DT solid_JJ table_NN in_IN a_DT dark_JJ room_NN on_IN the_DT ground_NN floor_NN should_MD therefore_RB be_VB chosen_VBN for_IN the_DT resting_VBG place_NN of_IN the_DT culture_NN flask_NN ;_: and_CC a_DT convenient_JJ method_NN of_IN displaying_VBG the_DT growth_NN is_VBZ to_TO hold_VB a_DT light_JJ behind_IN the_DT flask_NN and_CC to_TO look_VB through_IN the_DT fluid_NN from_IN the_DT opposite_JJ side_NN ._.

BACTERIOLOGY_NNP OF_NNP PLAGUE_NNP ._. ]_NN
121_CD If_IN the_DT flask_NN containing_VBG the_DT stalactite_JJ formation_NN be_VB gently_RB moved_VBN ,_, the_DT appearance_NN of_IN a_DT snow-_JJ fall_NN is_VBZ produced-each_JJ stalactite_NN apparently_RB rolling_VBG itself_PRP into_IN a_DT small_JJ mass_NN and_CC falling_VBG to_TO the_DT bottom_NN (_( vide_JJ Plate_NNP VII_NNP ._.
)_) -the_NN supernatant_JJ fluid_NN becoming_VBG again_RB perfectly_RB clear_JJ ._.
Then_RB a_DT fresh_JJ surface_NN growth_NN with_IN stalactites_NNS shorter_JJR than_IN the_DT first_JJ is_VBZ produced-again_JJ to_TO fall_VB in_IN snow-_JJ like_IN flakes_NNS on_IN agitation_NN ._.
A_DT series_NN of_IN crops_NNS of_IN stalactites_NNS may_MD thus_RB be_VB observed_VBN in_IN a_DT culture_NN flask_NN until_IN the_DT nutritive_JJ material_NN is_VBZ exhausted_VBN ._.
As_IN mentioned_VBN above_IN ,_, in_IN bouillon_NN cultures_NNS ,_, inseminated_VBN from_IN animal_JJ bodies_NNS direct_VBP ,_, or_CC from_IN even_RB fresh_JJ cultures_NNS from_IN animals_NNS ,_, it_PRP sometimes_RB happens_VBZ that_IN stalactites_NNS do_VBP not_RB readily_RB appear_VB :_: the_DT persistency_NN of_IN the_DT zoogleic_NN stage_NN in_IN such_JJ cases_NNS being_VBG remarkable_JJ ._.
Gently_RB agitating_VBG the_DT flask_NN will_MD have_VB the_DT effect_NN in_IN these_DT cases_NNS of_IN causing_VBG the_DT stalactite_JJ growth_NN to_TO appear_VB after_IN a_DT lapse_NN of_IN from_IN 24_CD to_TO 36_CD hours_NNS ._.
It_PRP must_MD be_VB noted_VBN that_IN the_DT stalactites_NNS thus_RB produced_VBN from_IN a_DT recent_JJ animal_JJ culture_NN are_VBP finer_NN and_CC scantier_NN as_IN a_DT rule_NN than_IN those_DT which_WDT are_VBP the_DT result_NN of_IN inoculating_VBG a_DT flask_NN with_IN an_DT old_JJ and_CC artificial_JJ growth_NN ._.
Very_RB old_JJ cultures_NNS ,_, re-transplanted_JJ ,_, often_RB ,_, however_RB ,_, show_VBP very_RB ragged_JJ stalactites_NNS ._.
Growth_NNP in_IN milk_NN ._.
In_IN milk_NN the_DT growth_NN is_VBZ not_RB distinctive_JJ ._.
Klein_NNP says_VBZ that_IN after_IN a_DT month_NN 's_POS incubation_NN at_IN 37_CD C._NNP in_IN litmus_JJ milk_NN ,_, curdling_NN and_CC a_DT change_NN of_IN reaction_NN will_MD occur_VB ._.
*_JJ Growth_NNP on_IN Agar_NNP ._.
The_DT growth_NN on_IN Agar-_NNP (_( Peptone-Salt_NNP Agar_NNP )_) -is_NNP characteristic_JJ ,_, provided_VBD the_DT culture_NN mate-_JJ rial_NN has_VBZ been_VBN evenly_RB spread_NN over_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT slant_NN ,_, and_CC also_RB that_IN the_DT Agar_NNP is_VBZ ``_`` dry_JJ ._. ''_''
If_IN these_DT conditions_NNS are_VBP fulfilled_VBN ,_, in_IN 24_CD hours_NNS at_IN the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT air_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP (_( 255-298C_JJ ._.
)_) ,_, minute_JJ grey_NN translucent_JJ colonies_NNS cover_VBP the_DT whole_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT Agar-the_NNP appearance_NN ,_, when_WRB held_VBD up_RB to_TO the_DT light_NN ,_, and_CC looked_VBD at_IN from_IN below_IN ,_, being_VBG similar_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN fine_JJ ground_NN glass_NN ._.
With_IN age_NN the_DT culture_NN deepens_VBZ lightly_RB and_CC reaches_VBZ a_DT maximum_NN in_IN about_IN 5-7_JJ days_NNS ._.
Here_RB and_CC there_RB more_JJR opaque_JJ colonies_NNS will_MD often_RB be_VB noticed_VBN ,_, and_CC these_DT eventually_RB become_VBP very_RB prominent_JJ and_CC of_IN a_DT faintly_RB yellowish-brown_JJ colour_NN ._.
These_DT are_VBP ``_`` Giant_JJ Colonies_NNP ,_, ``_`` and_CC they_PRP often_RB appear_VBP to_TO contain_VB more_RBR elongated_JJ forms_NNS than_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT culture_NN ._.
(_( Vide_NNP Plate_NNP VIII_NNP ._. )_)
These_DT were_VBD originally_RB termed_VBN ``_`` Cannibal_JJ Colonies_NNPS ''_'' by_IN Mr._NNP Haffkine_NNP ._.
Isolated_JJ colonies_NNS on_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN Agar_NNP ,_, examined_VBD under_IN a_DT magnification_NN of_IN 75_CD diameters_NNS with_IN transmitted_JJ light_NN ,_, show_VBP after_IN 24-36_JJ hours_NNS '_POS growth_NN a_DT raised_VBN angularly-marked_JJ centre_NN ,_, with_IN a_DT faint_JJ marginal_NN layer_NN which_WDT has_VBZ an_DT uneven_JJ border_NN ._.
In_IN 3_CD to_TO 4_CD days_NNS this_DT centre_NN thickens_VBZ so_RB as_IN to_TO become_VB opaque_JJ and_CC brownish_JJ in_IN colour_NN ._.
It_PRP then_RB forms_VBZ a_DT regular_JJ oval_NN or_CC circular_JJ shape_NN ,_, surrounded_VBN by_IN the_DT flat_JJ uneven_JJ clear_JJ margin_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ now_RB plainly_RB defined_VBN and_CC sometimes_RB shows_VBZ radiate_JJ markings_NNS ._.
Occasionally_RB such_JJ colonies_NNS go_VBP on_IN growing_VBG until_IN they_PRP become_VBP 5-7cm_JJ ._.
in_IN breadth_NN ,_, and_CC to_TO the_DT naked_JJ eye_NN appear_VBP to_TO exhibit_VB raised_VBN concentric_JJ rings_NNS around_IN the_DT nucleus-like_JJ centre_NN ._.
(_( Vide_NNP Plates_NNP IX_NNP and_CC X_NNP ._. )_)
Growth_NN on_IN gelatine_NN ._.
The_DT appearances_NNS produced_VBN by_IN the_DT growth_NN of_IN the_DT plague-bacillus_NN on_IN gelatine_NN are_VBP some-_JJ what_WP similar_JJ to_TO those_DT already_RB described_VBN on_IN Agar-agar_NNP ._.
Klein*_NNP states_VBZ that_IN on_IN gelatine-plates_NNS grey_JJ punctiform_JJ translucent_NN colonies_NNS occur_VBP after_IN 24_CD hours_NNS '_POS incubation_NN at_IN 20-21_JJ C._NNP They_PRP are_VBP visible_JJ to_TO the_DT naked_JJ eye_NN ._.
Later_RB (_( 3-7_JJ days_NNS )_) the_DT superficial_JJ colonies_NNS become_VBP larger_JJR greyish-white_JJ patches_NNS distinctly_RB raised_VBN in_IN the_DT centre_NN ._.
Their_PRP$ margins_NNS are_VBP distinctly_RB angular_JJ or_CC crenate_NN ,_, and_CC ,_, according_VBG to_TO McFarland_NNP ,_, they_PRP often_RB show_VBP a_DT fine_JJ semi-transparent_JJ zone_NN around_IN the_DT central_JJ part_NN ,_, which_WDT appearance_NN has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN noted_VBN with_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT growth_NN of_IN *_$ 26th_CD Annual_NNP Report_NNP of_IN Medical_NNP Officer_NNP to_TO Local_JJ Government_NNP Board-1896-97_NNP ._.

Growth_NNP in_IN water_NN ._.
According_VBG to_TO the_DT German_NNP Plague_NNP Commission_NNP ,_, in_IN ordinary_JJ tap_NN water_NN ,_, after_IN five_CD days_NNS the_DT virulence_NN of_IN the_DT microbe_NN is_VBZ lost_VBN ,_, and_CC ,_, similarly_RB ,_, in_IN sterile_JJ tap_NN water_NN after_IN ten_JJ days_NNS ._.
Effects_NNS of_IN disinfectants_NNS on_IN the_DT plague-bacillus_NN ._.
By_IN drying_VBG ,_, exposure_NN to_TO direct_VB sunlight_NN or_CC by_IN heating_VBG at_IN 60_CD C._NNP for_IN 5_CD minutes_NNS (_( Klein_NNP )_) the_DT vitality_NN of_IN a_DT plague_JJ culture_NN is_VBZ destroyed_VBN ._.
Live_JJ plague-_NN microbes_NNS ,_, spread_NN as_IN a_DT thin_JJ layer_NN on_IN a_DT slip_NN of_IN glass_NN ,_, and_CC exposed_VBD directly_RB to_TO the_DT sun_NN 's_POS light_NN ,_, are_VBP killed_VBN within_IN an_DT hour_NN ._.
With_IN a_DT thicker_NN layer_VBZ the_DT bacilli_NN remain_VBP alive_JJ and_CC virulent_NN for_IN about_RB two_CD hours_NNS ,_, but_CC not_RB longer_JJR than_IN four_CD hours_NNS ._.
Cultures_NNS growing_VBG on_IN Agar_NNP live_VBP for_IN several_JJ hours_NNS ,_, but_CC a_DT day_NN 's_POS exposure_NN kills_VBZ them_PRP outright_RP ._.
In_IN the_DT words_NNS of_IN the_DT German_NNP Plague_NNP Commission_NNP (_( loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._.
p._RB 281_CD )_) :_: -_: ''_'' The_DT bacilli_NN are_VBP very_RB little_JJ resistant_NN to_TO external_JJ influences_NNS ,_, e._FW g._NNS ,_, drying_VBG ,_, disinfectants_NNS ,_, sunlight_NN and_CC ordinary_JJ water_NN ;_: and_CC as_IN no_DT spores_NNS are_VBP found_VBN ,_, their_PRP$ propagation_NN through_IN the_DT dust_NN of_IN the_DT air_NN ,_, especially_RB in_IN tropical_JJ countries_NNS ,_, where_WRB they_PRP are_VBP quickly_RB killed_VBN by_IN sunlight_NN and_CC drying_NN ,_, certainly_RB does_VBZ not_RB usually_RB occur_VBP ;_: only_RB dried_VBD organisms_NNS being_VBG capable_JJ of_IN dissemination_NN by_IN the_DT atmos-_JJ phere_NN ._.

''_''
The_DT effects_NNS of_IN various_JJ antiseptics_NNS and_CC disinfectants_NNS on_IN plague_NN cultures_NNS have_VBP been_VBN thoroughly_RB studied_VBN by_IN Messrs._NNP Hankin_NNP ,_, Pitchford_NNP and_CC Marsh_NNP and_CC the_DT German_JJ Commission_NNP ._.
The_DT former_JJ found_VBD that_IN Corrosive_NNP Sublimate_NNP is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS reliable_JJ for_IN general_JJ use_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN a_DT solution_NN of_IN 1-5000_CD was_VBD sufficient_JJ to_TO destroy_VB the_DT vitality_NN of_IN the_DT plague-_JJ bacillus_NN in_IN 5_CD minutes_NNS ._.
1-1000_CD is_VBZ stated_VBN by_IN the_DT German_JJ Commission_NNP to_TO destroy_VB a_DT culture_NN at_IN once_RB ._.
To_TO Carbolic_NNP Acid_NNP and_CC its_PRP$ allies_NNS and_CC alkalies_VBZ the_DT bacillus_NN was_VBD more_RBR resistant_JJ than_IN to_TO acids_NNS and_CC various_JJ oxidising_VBG agents_NNS ,_, particularly_RB Chloride_NNP of_IN Lime_NNP and_CC Permanganate_NNP of_IN Potash_NNP ._.
The_DT Incidence_NNP of_IN Bubonic_NNP Plague_NNP in_IN Animals_NNP ._.
Animals_NNS of_IN several_JJ species_NNS whose_WP$ habit_NN of_IN life_NN brings_VBZ them_PRP into_IN contact_NN with_IN human_JJ habitations_NNS ,_, are_VBP naturally_RB more_RBR susceptible_JJ to_TO plague_VB than_IN others_NNS ._.
Such_JJ are_VBP rats_NNS ,_, monkeys_NNS ,_, and_CC squirrels_NNS ._.
*_NN When_WRB plague_NN was_VBD at_IN its_PRP$ height_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, guinea-pigs_JJ and_CC rabbits_NNS in_IN confinement_NN were_VBD attacked_VBN by_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN an_DT epidemic_JJ form_NN ,_, and_CC there_EX is_VBZ little_JJ doubt_NN but_CC that_IN rats_NNS were_VBD instrumental_JJ in_IN originating_VBG the_DT outbreak_NN ,_, Rats_NNP are_VBP particularly_RB affected_VBN by_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, and_CC they_PRP are_VBP ,_, in_IN all_DT probability_NN ,_, the_DT chief_JJ disseminators_NNS of_IN infection_NN ._.
The_DT ordinary_JJ brown_JJ rat_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS liable_JJ to_TO be_VB attacked_VBN ,_, while_IN the_DT musk_NN rat_NN appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB immune_JJ ._.
Mice_NNP ,_, too_RB ,_, are_VBP less_RBR susceptible_JJ than_IN rats_NNS ._.

123_CD If_IN a_DT rat_NN is_VBZ artificially_RB inoculated_VBN with_IN a_DT very_RB minute_JJ quantity_NN of_IN a_DT virulent_JJ plague_NN cul-_JJ ture_NN ,_, death_NN generally_RB ensues_VBZ in_IN 24-48_JJ hours_NNS ._.

It_PRP sits_VBZ huddled_VBD up_RP in_IN a_DT corner_NN of_IN its_PRP$ cage_NN ,_, and_CC is_VBZ disinclined_VBN to_TO move_VB or_CC eat_NN ._.

On_IN opening_VBG the_DT animal_NN a_DT hmorrhagic_JJ dema_NN at_IN the_DT seat_NN of_IN inoculation_NN is_VBZ noticeable_JJ ._.
Similar_JJ conditions_NNS often_RB exist_VBP in_IN the_DT inguinal_JJ ,_, cervical_JJ ,_, and_CC axillary_JJ regions_NNS ,_, but_CC glandular_JJ enlargements_NNS are_VBP seldom_RB ,_, if_IN ever_RB ,_, visible_JJ to_TO the_DT naked_JJ eye_NN ._.
The_DT heart_NN is_VBZ engorged_VBN with_IN dark_JJ fluid_NN blood_NN ,_, teeming_VBG ,_, as_IN a_DT rule_NN ,_, with_IN plague-bacilli_NN ._.
The_DT lungs_NNS are_VBP collapsed_VBN and_CC show_VB pneumonic_JJ patches_NNS ._.
Drs_NNP ._.
Gibson_NNP and_CC Ransome_NNP have_VBP observed_VBN in_IN rats_NNS appearances_NNS similar_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN true_JJ pueumonic_JJ plague_NN in_IN man_NN ._.
The_DT liver_NN and_CC spleen_NN are_VBP both_DT enlarged_JJ ._.
The_DT latter_NN is_VBZ often_RB double_JJ its_PRP$ normal_JJ size_NN ._.
Bacilli_NNP are_VBP easily_RB demonstrable_JJ in_IN these_DT organs_NNS ._.
The_DT bladder_NN is_VBZ frequently_RB distended_VBN with_IN urine_JJ ,_, and_CC in_IN a_DT few_JJ instances_NNS plague-bacilli_NNS have_VBP been_VBN obtained_VBN from_IN this_DT source_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT country_NN like_IN India_NNP ,_, where_WRB the_DT decomposition_NN of_IN organic_JJ matter_NN is_VBZ accelerated_VBN by_IN climatic_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, putrefactive_JJ bacteria_NNS rapidly_RB outgrow_VBP the_DT plague-bacilli_NN ,_, and_CC after_IN 12_CD hours_NNS at_IN the_DT most_RBS the_DT chances_NNS of_IN isolating_VBG the_DT plague-bacilli_NN by_IN culture_NN from_IN such_JJ organic_JJ matter_NN are_VBP very_RB remote_JJ ._.
*_JJ Klein_NNP and_CC other_JJ observers_NNS remark_VBP that_IN passage_NN of_IN the_DT bacillus_NN through_IN several_JJ animals_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ species_NNS has_VBZ the_DT effect_NN of_IN increasing_VBG the_DT virulence_NN of_IN the_DT micro-organism_NN ,_, at_IN least_JJS for_IN that_DT species_NNS ._.
Dr._NNP Balfour-Stewart_NNP t_NN has_VBZ recently_RB noted_VBN that_IN if_IN a_DT series_NN of_IN rabbits_NNS be_VB inoculated_VBN with_IN increasing_VBG doses_NNS of_IN a_DT 10_CD days_NNS '_POS culture_NN of_IN living_NN plague_NN a_DT greater_JJR proportion_NN of_IN those_DT receiving_VBG a_DT large_JJ dose_NN survive_NN ,_, than_IN of_IN those_DT injected_VBN with_IN the_DT smaller_JJR quan_JJ tities_NNS ._.
This_DT he_PRP thought_VBD due_RB to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT larger_JJR doses_NNS contained_VBD a_DT larger_JJR amount_NN of_IN immunising_VBG constituent_NN ,_, and_CC so_RB rendered_VBD the_DT inoculated_JJ animal_NN immune_NN to_TO the_DT microbes_NNS contained_VBN in_IN the_DT culture_NN injected_VBN ._.
Dogs_NNS ,_, cats_NNS ,_, horses_NNS ,_, cattle_NNS ,_, sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS are_VBP not_RB susceptible_JJ to_TO plague_VB ;_: although_IN inoculation_NN with_IN plague_NN cultures_NNS causes_VBZ in_IN them_PRP a_DT distinct_JJ febrile_NN and_CC local_JJ reaction_NN ._.
Goats_NNS appear_VBP to_TO suffer_VB most_JJS ._.
Not_RB infrequently_RB they_PRP slowly_VBP sicken_JJ and_CC die-a_JJ fact_NN which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN occasionally_RB observed_VBN in_IN rabbits_NNS also_RB ._.
Birds_NNS are_VBP apparently_RB immune_JJ ._.
Sick_JJ pigeons_NNS and_CC crows_NNS have_VBP been_VBN examined_VBN at_IN the_DT Laboratory_NNP ,_, but_CC the_DT plague-bacillus_NN has_VBZ never_RB been_VBN isolated_VBN from_IN them_PRP ._.
The_DT rle_NN of_IN insects_NNS in_IN the_DT propagation_NN of_IN disease_NN is_VBZ attracting_VBG attention_NN ._.
In_IN relation_NN to_TO plague_VB ,_, Yersin_NNP has_VBZ stated_VBN that_IN he_PRP has_VBZ found_VBN the_DT bacillus_NN in_IN flies_NNS ,_, while_IN the_DT German_JJ Plague_NNP Commission_NNP infected_VBD guinea-pigs_NNS with_IN an_DT emulsion_NN made_VBD from_IN fleas_NNS taken_VBN off_RP a_DT rat_NN ._.

of_IN affected_JJ animals_NNS and_CC apart_RB from_IN the_DT artificial_JJ conditions_NNS already_RB detailed_VBN is_VBZ practically_RB nil_JJ ._.

TOWN_NNP AND_NNP ISLAND_NNP OF_NNP BOMBAY_NNP ._.
Bombay_NNP City_NNP is_VBZ a_DT narrow_JJ island_NN ,_, some_DT eleven_JJ miles_NNS long_RB by_IN three_CD broad_JJ ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ joined_VBN to_TO the_DT larger_JJR island_NN of_IN Salsette_NNP (_( some_DT twenty_NN miles_NNS by_IN ten_NN )_) by_IN two_CD causeways_NNS and_CC two_CD railway_NN lines_NNS ._.
Bombay_NNP Harbour_NNP and_CC Bassein_NNP Creek_NNP separate_JJ these_DT two_CD islands_NNS from_IN the_DT mainland_NN of_IN India_NNP ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN stated_VBN that_IN the_DT existence_NN of_IN bubonic_JJ plague_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP City_NNP was_VBD first_RB discovered_VBN in_IN the_DT latter_JJ half_NN of_IN September_NNP 1896_CD ._.
The_DT various_JJ theories_NNS as_IN to_TO its_PRP$ origin_NN may_MD be_VB briefly_RB summarized_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: (_( 1_CD )_) Importation_NN from_IN Hongkong_NNP ,_, where_WRB a_DT plague_NN epidemic_NN was_VBD then_RB raging_VBG ;_: (_( 2_CD )_) importation_NN from_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT Red_NNP Sea_NNP ports_NNS ;_: (_( 3_CD )_) importation_NN from_IN Mesopotamia_NNP ;_: (_( 4_CD )_) importation_NN from_IN Egypt_NNP ;_: (_( 5_CD )_) importation_NN from_IN Persia_NNP ,_, or_CC from_IN the_DT Levant_NNP ._.
The_DT most_RBS popular_JJ of_IN these_DT theories_NNS is_VBZ that_IN which_WDT ascribes_VBZ the_DT origin_NN to_TO Hongkong_NNP ;_: but_CC there_EX can_MD not_RB be_VB said_VBD to_TO exist_VB the_DT least_JJS evidence_NN in_IN favour_NN of_IN any_DT one_CD theory_NN over_IN any_DT other_JJ ._.
The_DT administrative_JJ measures_NNS taken_VBN in_IN Bombay_NNP from_IN September_NNP 1896_CD to_TO May_NNP 1897_CD are_VBP treated_VBN in_IN great_JJ detail_NN in_IN Nathan_NNP 's_POS and_CC Couchman_NNP 's_POS Reports_NNS ._.
Those_DT for_IN the_DT year_NN May_NNP 1897_CD to_TO May_NNP 1898_CD ,_, together_RB with_IN some_DT information_NN on_IN the_DT symptoms_NNS and_CC medical_JJ aspects_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, are_VBP given_VBN in_IN General_NNP Gatacre_NNP 's_POS and_CC in_IN Sir_NNP James_NNP Campbell_NNP 's_POS Reports_NNS ,_, while_IN both_DT these_DT branches_NNS are_VBP very_RB fully_RB dealt_VB with_IN in_IN Mr._NNP W._NNP L._NNP Harvey_NNP ,_, the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP 's_POS Report_NNP for_IN 1898-99_JJ ._.
It_PRP would_MD therefore_RB be_VB clearly_RB superfluous_JJ to_TO deal_VB at_IN any_DT length_NN here_RB with_IN the_DT epidemics_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP City_NNP ;_: and_CC for_IN information_NN under_IN this_DT head_NN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, the_DT above_JJ works_NNS should_MD be_VB consulted_VBN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, both_DT for_IN the_DT sake_NN of_IN completeness_NN ,_, and_CC because_IN Bombay_NNP City_NNP is_VBZ the_DT Capital_NN of_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT starting_NN point_NN ,_, both_DT of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, and_CC of_IN the_DT various_JJ measures_NNS introduced_VBN at_IN different_JJ times_NNS to_TO combat_VB it_PRP ,_, a_DT brief_JJ outline_NN ,_, as_IN well_RB of_IN plague_NN administration_NN ,_, as_IN of_IN the_DT progress_NN of_IN the_DT pestilence_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, is_VBZ given_VBN below_IN ._.
Up_RB to_TO the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN 1896_CD ,_, plague_NN did_VBD not_RB assume_VB any_DT formidable_JJ proportions_NNS ._.
The_DT measures_NNS taken_VBN to_TO suppress_VB it_PRP were_VBD both_DT prompt_JJ and_CC vigorous_JJ :_: sanitation_NN of_IN the_DT infected_JJ por-_JJ tions_NNS of_IN the_DT city_NN where_WRB it_PRP seemed_VBD to_TO be_VB required_VBN was_VBD at_IN once_RB energetically_RB taken_VBN in_IN hand_NN ;_: houses_NNS and_CC gullies_NNS which_WDT lay_VBP under_IN any_DT suspicion_NN of_IN infection_NN were_VBD at_IN once_RB flushed_VBN and_CC disinfected_VBN ;_: drains_NNS were_VBD opened_VBN up_RP ,_, remodelled_VBN ,_, and_CC repaired_VBD ;_: manholes_NNS were_VBD carefully_RB disinfected_VBN ,_, drains_VBZ being_VBG thoroughly_RB flushed_VBN with_IN sea-water_NN and_CC carbolic_NN acid_NN which_WDT was_VBD poured_VBN into_IN them_PRP by_IN a_DT centrifugal_JJ pump_NN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 3,000,000_CD gallons_NNS a_DT day_NN ;_: all_DT cases_NNS of_IN fever_NN were_VBD treated_VBN as_IN ``_`` suspects_NNS ''_'' ;_: segregation_NN of_IN contacts_NNS and_CC removal_NN to_TO hospital_NN of_IN all_DT plague_NN patients_NNS was_VBD strictly_RB enforced_VBN ._.
But_CC the_DT presence_NN of_IN the_DT dread_NN disease_NN itself_PRP ,_, combined_VBN with_IN these_DT stringent_JJ precautions_NNS soon_RB produced_VBD an_DT unreasoning_NN panic_NN throughout_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, which_WDT resulted_VBD at_IN first_JJ in_IN flight_NN and_CC concealment_NN and_CC afterwards_NNS in_IN open_JJ opposition_NN ._.
Mr_NNP ._.
Snow_NNP ,_, the_DT then_RB Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP ,_, writes_VBZ of_IN this_DT period_NN :_: ``_`` Of_IN all_PDT the_DT measures_NNS taken_VBN at_IN this_DT time_NN for_IN combating_VBG plague_NN ,_, the_DT one_CD which_WDT caused_VBD most_JJS alarm_NN was_VBD segregation_NN or_CC removal_NN to_TO hospital_NN ._.
The_DT people_NNS not_RB only_RB regarded_JJ hospital_NN treatment_NN with_IN detestation_NN ,_, but_CC reports_NNS were_VBD freely_RB circulated_VBN that_IN the_DT authorities_NNS merely_RB took_VBD them_PRP there_EX to_TO make_VB a_DT speedy_JJ end_NN of_IN them_PRP ._.
A_DT gang_NN of_IN scoundrels_NNS took_VBD to_TO blackmailing_VBG by_IN personating_VBG the_DT Police_NNP and_CC Municipal_NNP servants_NNS ,_, and_CC increased_VBD the_DT general_JJ terror_NN ,_, extorting_VBG money_NN as_IN they_PRP did_VBD under_IN threats_NNS of_IN removal_NN to_TO hospital_NN ._.
Several_JJ of_IN these_DT free_JJ lances_NNS were_VBD at_IN 32_CD 126_CD [_JJ CHAP_NNP ._.
IV_NNP ._.
last_JJ brought_VBD to_TO book_NN by_IN the_DT Police_NNP ,_, and_CC with_IN a_DT few_JJ salutary_JJ convictions_NNS and_CC sentences_NNS by_IN the_DT Magistrates_NNP ,_, that_IN danger_NN disappeared_VBD ._.
None_NN the_DT less_RBR surely_RB ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT panic_NN increased_VBD ,_, and_CC while_IN our_PRP$ Municipal_NNP employs_VBZ showed_VBD signs_NNS of_IN wavering_NN ,_, the_DT great_JJ body_NN of_IN mill-hands_NNS began_VBD to_TO be_VB infected_VBN by_IN the_DT general_JJ alarm_NN and_CC flight_NN of_IN so_RB many_JJ persons_NNS from_IN the_DT City_NNP ._. ''_''
It_PRP was_VBD from_IN the_DT mill-hands_NNS ,_, indeed_RB ,_, that_IN danger_NN threatened_VBD ,_, and_CC that_IN danger_NN came_VBD ._.
On_IN the_DT 10th_CD of_IN October_NNP a_DT number_NN of_IN them_PRP assembled_VBD outside_JJ Arthur_NNP Road_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, threatening_VBG violence_NN and_CC its_PRP$ speedy_NN demolition_NN ._.
After_IN causing_VBG great_JJ alarm_NN in_IN it_PRP they_PRP dispersed_VBD ._.
On_IN the_DT 29th_CD about_IN 1,000_CD of_IN them_PRP attacked_VBD this_DT same_JJ hospital_NN with_IN sticks_NNS and_CC stones_NNS ,_, entering_VBG the_DT compound_NN ,_, injuring_VBG the_DT building_NN ,_, striking_VBG the_DT patients_NNS ,_, intimidating_VBG the_DT staff_NN ._.
Nor_CC was_VBD order_NN restored_VBN until_IN the_DT arrival_NN of_IN the_DT Commissioner_NNP and_CC Deputy_NNP Commissioner_NNP of_IN Police_NNP ,_, with_IN a_DT strong_JJ force_NN of_IN European_JJ and_CC Native_JJ Constables_NNP ._.
This_DT demonstration_NN was_VBD directed_VBN against_IN segregation_NN and_CC removal_NN to_TO hospital_NN ,_, the_DT one_CD measure_NN which_WDT the_DT whole_NN people_NNS ,_, high_JJ and_CC low_JJ ,_, viewed_VBN with_IN the_DT wildest_JJS hostility_NN ._.
The_DT gravity_NN of_IN the_DT situation_NN induced_VBD the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP ,_, after_IN conferring_VBG with_IN the_DT Commissioner_NNP of_IN Police_NNP and_CC the_DT Health_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, to_TO somewhat_VB relax_VB the_DT stringency_NN of_IN these_DT two_CD measures_NNS ;_: but_CC ``_`` it_PRP must_MD not_RB be_VB supposed_VBN ,_, ''_'' he_PRP writes_VBZ ,_, ``_`` that_IN all_DT attempts_NNS at_IN isolation_NN were_VBD given_VBN up_RP ._. ''_''
This_DT unreasoning_JJ fear_NN of_IN plague_NN hospitals_NNS extended_VBD at_IN first_JJ even_RB to_TO hospitals_NNS established_VBN and_CC managed_VBN by_IN Hindoos_NNP for_IN their_PRP$ own_JJ caste_NN fellows_NNS ._.
As_RB early_RB as_IN October_NNP such_JJ hospitals_NNS were_VBD opened_VBN in_IN Mandvi_NNP and_CC Bhulesh-_NNP war_NN ,_, but_CC were_VBD rendered_VBN useless_JJ by_IN this_DT attitude_NN ._.
At_IN this_DT time_NN ,_, October_NNP 1896_CD ,_, the_DT power_NN to_TO deal_VB with_IN plague_NN had_VBD been_VBN vested_VBN by_IN Government_NNP in_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP ;_: it_PRP remained_VBD vested_VBN in_IN him_PRP till_VB the_DT appointment_NN of_IN the_DT first_JJ Plague_NNP Committee_NNP on_IN the_DT 5th_CD of_IN March_NNP 1897_CD ._.
This_DT Committee_NNP consisted_VBD of_IN Brigadier-_NNP General_NNP Gatacre_NNP ,_, Mr_NNP ._.
Snow_NNP ,_, Surgeon-Major_NNP Dimmock_NNP ,_, and_CC Mr._NNP James_NNP ,_, Deputy_NNP Executive_NNP Engineer_NNP ._.
Its_PRP$ Secretary_NNP was_VBD Major_JJ Cahusac_NNP ._.
It_PRP should_MD be_VB mentioned_VBN here_RB ,_, however_RB ,_, that_IN a_DT Committee_NNP consisting_NN of_IN Dr._NNP Lowson_NNP ,_, Surgeon-Major_NNP Reade_NNP ,_, and_CC Surgeon-Captain_NNP Beveridge_NNP (_( who_WP had_VBD had_VBN previous_JJ experience_NN in_IN Hongkong_NNP )_) was_VBD appointed_VBN to_TO enquire_VB into_IN ,_, report_NN on_IN ,_, and_CC suggest_JJS measures_NNS to_TO combat_VB the_DT progress_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN throughout_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP ._.
Of_IN this_DT Committee_NNP ,_, which_WDT was_VBD dissolved_VBN in_IN the_DT latter_JJ half_NN of_IN 1897_CD ,_, Surgeon-Major_NNP Reade_NNP is_VBZ the_DT only_JJ member_NN at_IN present_JJ remaining_VBG in_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP ._.
He_PRP was_VBD appointed_VBN to_TO Poona_NNP at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN 1897_CD ,_, or_CC the_DT beginning_NN of_IN 1898_CD ,_, being_VBG shortly_RB afterwards_NNS appointed_VBN Chief_NNP Plague_NNP Authority_NNP in_IN that_DT city_NN ._.
To_TO return_VB to_TO the_DT original_JJ Committee_NNP for_IN Bombay_NNP City_NNP ._.
The_DT Committee_NNP ,_, though_IN not_RB dissolved_VBN ,_, underwent_JJ considerable_JJ changes_NNS of_IN personnel_NNS ._.
The_DT first_JJ of_IN these_DT was_VBD the_DT instalment_NN of_IN Sir_NNP J._NNP Campbell_NNP as_IN President_NNP on_IN General_NNP Gatacre_NNP 's_POS departure_NN from_IN India_NNP in_IN July_NNP 1897_CD ._.
This_DT was_VBD followed_VBN shortly_RB afterwards_NNS (_( August_NNP )_) by_IN the_DT substitution_NN of_IN Mr._NNP Vining_NNP ,_, R._NNP N._NNP ,_, for_IN Major_JJ Cahusac_NNP as_IN Secretary_NNP ;_: and_CC by_IN the_DT successive_JJ appointment_NN to_TO the_DT Committee_NNP (_( towards_IN the_DT close_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN )_) of_IN Surgeon-General_NNP Bainbridge_NNP ;_: and_CC ,_, in_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN 1898_CD ,_, of_IN Surgeon-_NNP Colonel_NNP Hay_NNP and_CC Mr._NNP Playford_NNP Reynolds_NNP ,_, Superintending_NNP Engineer_NNP ,_, who_WP were_VBD added_VBN in_IN order_NN to_TO strengthen_VB it_PRP ._.
The_DT plague_JJ administration_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP City_NNP remained_VBD in_IN the_DT hands_NNS of_IN this_DT Committee_NNP from_IN March_NNP 1897_CD to_TO May_NNP 1898_CD ,_, when_WRB ,_, on_IN Sir_NNP J._NNP Campbell_NNP 's_POS departure_NN from_IN India_NNP ,_, it_PRP was_VBD replaced_VBN by_IN an_DT entirely_RB new_JJ system_NN ._.
This_DT consisted_VBN in_IN the_DT abolition_NN of_IN the_DT Plague_NNP Committee_NNP ,_, the_DT revesting_NN of_IN all_DT plague_NN control_NN in_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP and_CC a_DT deputy_NN ,_, who_WP was_VBD specially_RB appointed_VBN for_IN this_DT purpose_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT orders_NNS inaugurating_VBG this_DT radical_JJ change_NN do_VBP not_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB fully_RB quoted_VBN in_IN any_DT report_NN previously_RB published_VBN ,_, they_PRP are_VBP given_VBN in_IN full_JJ here_RB ._.
The_DT scheme_NN was_VBD briefly_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ ._.
A_DT Plague_NNP Commissioner_NNP was_VBD appointed_VBN for_IN the_DT whole_JJ Presidency_NNP ,_, who_WP BOMBAY_NNP TOWN_NNP AND_NNP ISLAND_NNP ._. ]_NN
127_CD was_VBD and_CC is_VBZ under_IN Government_NNP the_DT Supreme_NNP Plague_NNP Authority_NNP in_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP ,_, as_RB well_RB for_IN the_DT centralization_NN and_CC concentration_NN of_IN control_NN ,_, as_IN for_IN the_DT quick_JJ despatch_NN of_IN business_NN ._.
The_DT Plague_NNP Commissioner_NNP was_VBD shortly_RB afterwards_NNS also_RB appointed_VBD Secretary_NNP to_TO Government_NNP in_IN the_DT Plague_NNP Department_NNP ._.
The_DT first_JJ of_IN these_DT Plague_NNP Commissioners_NNP was_VBD Sir_NNP Andrew_NNP Wingate_NNP ,_, who_WP ,_, in_IN the_DT beginning_NN ,_, had_VBD two_CD colleagues_NNS (_( Surgeon-General_JJ Cleghorn_NNP and_CC Surgeon-Col._NNP Hay_NNP )_) ,_, also_RB termed_VBD Plague_NNP Commissioners_NNPS :_: and_CC who_WP was_VBD appointed_VBN Joint_NNP Secretary_NNP to_TO Government_NNP in_IN charge_NN of_IN the_DT Plague_NNP Branch_NNP of_IN the_DT General_NNP Department_NNP in_IN addition_NN to_TO his_PRP$ duties_NNS as_IN Plague_NNP Commissioner_NNP by_IN Government_NNP Resolution_NNP No_NNP ._.

On_IN the_DT 3rd_CD of_IN September_NNP 1898_CD ,_, Sir_NNP Andrew_NNP Wingate_NNP again_RB took_VBD up_RP the_DT Plague_NNP Com-_NNP missionership_NN and_CC Secretaryship_NNP to_TO Government_NNP ,_, which_WDT post_VBD he_PRP held_VBD till_VB his_PRP$ departure_NN from_IN India_NNP on_IN furlough_NN in_IN May_NNP 1899_CD ._.
Mr._NNP A._NNP F._NNP Woodburn_NNP ,_, I._NNP C._NNP S._NNP ,_, succeeded_VBD him_PRP ._.

His_PRP$ Excellency_NN the_DT Governor_NNP in_IN Council_NNP is_VBZ pleased_VBN to_TO direct_VB that_IN the_DT responsibility_NN for_IN all_DT plague_JJ operations_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP shall_MD be_VB undertaken_VBN by_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP subject_JJ to_TO the_DT direct_JJ control_NN of_IN the_DT Plague_NNP Commissioner_NNP as_IN representing_VBG Government_NNP and_CC their_PRP$ expert_NN advisers_NNS ._.

``_`` Whereas_NNP certain_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP are_VBP visited_VBN by_IN ,_, and_CC others_NNS threatened_VBD with_IN ,_, an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN dangerous_JJ epidemic_JJ disease_NN known_VBN as_IN Plague_NNP ;_: and_CC whereas_IN the_DT Governor_NNP General_NNP in_IN Council_NNP ,_, in_IN exercise_NN of_IN the_DT powers_NNS conferred_VBN by_IN Section_NN 2_CD ,_, Sub-section_NNP 3_CD ,_, of_IN the_DT Epidemic_NNP Diseases_NNP Act_NNP ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN pleased_VBN to_TO direct_VB that_IN the_DT powers_NNS conferred_VBN by_IN the_DT said_VBD Act_NNP may_MD ,_, within_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, be_VB exercised_VBN by_IN the_DT Governor_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP in_IN Council_NNP ;_: and_CC whereas_IN the_DT Governor_NNP in_IN Council_NNP thinks_VBZ that_IN the_DT ordinary_JJ provisions_NNS of_IN the_DT law_NN for_IN the_DT time_NN being_VBG in_IN force_NN are_VBP insufficient_JJ to_TO prevent_VB the_DT spread_NN of_IN this_DT disease_NN ,_, he_PRP is_VBZ pleased_JJ ,_, in_IN supersession_NN of_IN the_DT Notifications_NNP of_IN Government_NNP in_IN the_DT General_NNP Department_NNP specified_VBD in_IN the_DT margin_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN modification_NN of_IN Government_NNP ._.

For_IN the_DT said_VBD purposes_VBZ the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP ,_, in_IN addition_NN to_TO the_DT powers_NNS conferred_VBN on_IN him_PRP by_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP City_NNP Municipal_NNP Act_NNP ,_, 1888_CD ,_, by_IN the_DT Government_NNP Notifications_NNP marginally_RB specified_VBD ,_, and_CC by_IN the_DT Notification_NNP of_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP Commis-_NNP sioner_NN ,_, dated_VBD 6th_CD October_NNP 1896_CD ,_, is_VBZ invested_VBN with_IN the_DT following_JJ powers_NNS :_: (_( 1_CD )_) To_TO appoint_VB special_JJ officers_NNS either_CC by_IN name_NN or_CC by_IN virtue_NN of_IN office_NN to_TO carry_VB out_RP or_CC perform_VB under_IN his_PRP$ general_JJ direction_NN any_DT measures_NNS or_CC acts_NNS devised_VBN or_CC ordered_VBN by_IN him_PRP to_TO be_VB taken_VBN for_IN the_DT suppression_NN or_CC prevention_NN of_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN plague_NN ._.

129_CD (_( 1_CD )_) To_TO inspect_VB any_DT building_NN or_CC other_JJ premises_NNS for_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN ascertaining_VBG the_DT sanitary_JJ condition_NN thereof_NN ,_, and_CC if_IN it_PRP shall_MD appear_VB to_TO him_PRP necessary_JJ for_IN sanitary_JJ reasons_NNS so_RB to_TO do_VB ,_, to_TO require_VB the_DT owner_NN or_CC occupier_JJR of_IN any_DT building_NN so_RB inspected_JJ ,_, to_TO cause_VB the_DT same_JJ or_CC some_DT portion_NN thereof_NN to_TO be_VB limewashed_VBN or_CC otherwise_RB cleansed_VBN ,_, either_DT externally_RB or_CC internally_RB ,_, or_CC both_DT externally_RB and_CC internally_RB ._.

(_( b_NN )_) Compensation_NN may_MD be_VB paid_VBN by_IN him_PRP ,_, in_IN any_DT case_NN which_WDT he_PRP thinks_VBZ fit_NN ,_, to_TO any_DT person_NN who_WP sustains_VBZ substantial_JJ loss_NN by_IN the_DT destruction_NN of_IN any_DT such_JJ hut_NN or_CC shed_VBN ;_: but_CC except_IN as_IN so_RB allowed_VBN by_IN the_DT said_VBD Deputy_NNP Commissioner_NNP ,_, no_DT claim_NN for_IN compensation_NN shall_MD lie_VB for_IN any_DT loss_NN or_CC damage_NN caused_VBN by_IN any_DT exercise_NN of_IN the_DT power_NN conferred_VBN by_IN this_DT rule_NN ._.

(_( Sd_NNP ._. )_)
A._NN CUMINE_NNP ,_, Acting_NNP Secretary_NNP to_TO Government_NNP ._. ''_''
Turning_VBG now_RB to_TO the_DT progress_NN of_IN plague_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD at_IN first_JJ gradual_JJ ._.
Armies_NNS of_IN rats_NNS ,_, which_WDT had_VBD first_RB infected_VBN ,_, and_CC then_RB were_VBD in_IN turn_NN infected_VBN by_IN ,_, the_DT locality_NN in_IN which_WDT they_PRP found_VBD themselves_PRP ,_, fled_VBD from_IN east_NN to_TO west_VB ,_, from_IN west_JJS to_TO north_DT ._.
In_IN the_DT wake_NN of_IN these_DT fleeing_VBG armies_NNS of_IN vermin_NN followed_VBD the_DT deadly_JJ pestilence_NN ._.
``_`` The_DT enquiries_NNS made_VBN ,_, ''_'' writes_VBZ Mr_NNP ._.
Snow_NNP ,_, the_DT then_RB Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP ,_, ``_`` showed_VBD that_IN vast_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN rats_NNS ,_, flying_VBG from_IN the_DT danger_NN of_IN the_DT pestilence_NN ,_, moved_VBD steadily_RB in_IN those_DT directions_NNS ,_, and_CC were_VBD noticed_VBN in_IN numbers_NNS in_IN places_NNS where_WRB they_PRP had_VBD not_RB before_RB caused_JJ remark_NN ._. ''_''
At_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN December_NNP 1896_CD the_DT epidemic_JJ became_VBD worse_JJR ,_, and_CC the_DT total_JJ mortality_NN of_IN the_DT City_NNP for_IN the_DT next_JJ three_CD months_NNS averaged_VBN well_RB over_IN 1,500_CD per_IN week_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD during_IN this_DT period_NN that_IN the_DT great_JJ exodus_NN from_IN the_DT City_NNP took_VBD place_NN ;_: that_WDT while_IN the_DT City_NNP itself_PRP wore_VBD the_DT aspect_NN of_IN a_DT ``_`` City_NNP of_IN the_DT Dead_NNP ,_, ''_'' the_DT Railway_NNP Stations_NNP teemed_VBD with_IN masses_NNS of_IN fleeing_VBG humanity_NN ._.
Special_JJ after_IN Special_JJ bore_VBD away_RB thousands_NNS of_IN old_JJ and_CC young_JJ ,_, laden_JJ with_IN enormous_JJ bundles_NNS representing_VBG their_PRP$ entire_JJ worldly_RB goods_NNS ._.
And_CC as_IN Special_JJ after_IN Special_JJ left_VBD the_DT station_NN ,_, disappointed_JJ crowds_NN ,_, rather_RB than_IN lose_VB the_DT next_JJ opportunity_NN ,_, settled_VBD down_RB to_TO wait_VB on_IN the_DT platforms_NNS ._.
Business_NN was_VBD paralyzed_VBN ,_, offices_NNS were_VBD closed_VBN ,_, and_CC thoroughfares_NNS ,_, ordinarily_RB teeming_VBG with_IN life_NN ,_, were_VBD characterised_VBN by_IN a_DT desolate_NN emptiness_NN ._.
By_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN January_NNP 1897_CD some_DT 400,000_CD people-about_JJ one-half_NN of_IN the_DT entire_JJ population_NN of_IN the_DT City-had_NNP fled_VBD ._.
This_DT great_JJ exodus_NN undoubtedly_RB lessened_VBD the_DT mortality_NN ._.
The_DT weekly_JJ figures_NNS for_IN this_DT as_RB well_RB as_IN for_IN the_DT succeeding_NN epidemics_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Appendix_NNP A_NNP ._.
An_DT important_JJ step_NN taken_VBN in_IN December_NNP may_MD here_RB be_VB mentioned_VBN ._.
Most_JJS of_IN the_DT dwellings_NNS of_IN the_DT poorer_NN classes_NNS are_VBP of_IN flimsy_JJ construction_NN ,_, easily_RB saturated_VBN throughout_IN by_IN leaking_VBG pipes_NNS ._.
Natives_NNS ,_, moreover_RB ,_, habitually_RB turn_VB taps_RP full_JJ on_IN ,_, whether_IN to_TO clean_VB their_PRP$ clothes_NNS ,_, bodies_NNS ,_, their_PRP$ legs_NNS ,_, arms_NNS or_CC faces_VBZ ;_: and_CC they_PRP as_IN habitually_RB avoid_VBZ the_DT trouble_NN of_IN turning_VBG off_RP the_DT taps_NNS when_WRB they_PRP have_VBP finished_VBN ._.
A_DT system_NN of_IN meters_NNS was_VBD repeatedly_RB but_CC unsuccessfully_RB urged_VBD upon_IN the_DT Corporation_NNP ._.
The_DT only_JJ remedy_NN was_VBD to_TO cut_VB off_RP the_DT water-_JJ supply_NN ._.
In_IN December_NNP 1896_CD it_PRP was_VBD cut_VBN off_RP from_IN all_DT houses_NNS in_IN Kamatipoora_NNP ,_, stand-pipes_JJ being_VBG erected_VBN in_IN the_DT streets_NNS for_IN the_DT people_NNS 's_POS use_NN ._.
In_IN January_NNP 1897_CD drastic_JJ measures_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN under_IN Section_NNP 426_CD of_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP Act_NNP for_IN the_DT demolition_NN of_IN huts_NNS ._.
The_DT evacuation_NN of_IN infected_JJ houses_NNS was_VBD seriously_RB considered_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT prevention_NN of_IN overcrowding_VBG was_VBD provided_VBN for_IN by_IN the_DT powers_NNS conferred_VBD upon_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP in_IN a_DT notification_NN published_VBN in_IN the_DT Gazette_NNP of_IN the_DT 10th_CD of_IN February_NNP ._.
BOMBAY_NNP TOWN_NNP AND_NNP ISLAND_NNP ._. ]_NN
131_CD Second_JJ epidemic_JJ ,_, 1897-98_JJ ._.
In_IN March_NNP 1897_CD the_DT epidemic_JJ slowly_NN subsided_VBN ,_, and_CC by_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN May_NNP the_DT total_JJ mortality_NN of_IN the_DT City_NNP had_VBD fallen_VBN to_TO normal_JJ ._.
During_IN the_DT months_NNS of_IN April_NNP ,_, May_NNP and_CC June_NNP 1897_CD a_DT large_JJ portion_NN of_IN those_DT who_WP had_VBD fled_VBN from_IN the_DT City_NNP returned_VBD ._.
By_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN June_NNP ,_, plague_NN appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB on_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN extinction_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT population_NN of_IN the_DT City_NNP was_VBD estimated_VBN at_IN over_IN 750,000_CD ._.
``_`` At_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN August_NNP complaints_NNS were_VBD general_JJ ,_, and_CC to_TO some_DT extent_NN well_RB founded_VBD ,_, ''_'' writes_VBZ Sir_NNP James_NNP Campbell_NNP ,_, ``_`` that_IN the_DT City_NNP was_VBD infested_VBN with_IN numbers_NNS of_IN starved_JJ idlers_NNS whose_WP$ feeble_JJ condition_NN ,_, predisposing_VBG to_TO plague_VB ,_, was_VBD a_DT menace_NN to_TO public_JJ health_NN ._. ''_''
Accordingly_RB the_DT question_NN of_IN relief_NN was_VBD considered_VBN ,_, 9,422_CD rupees_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN by_IN subscription_NN ;_: 10,000_CD rupees_NNS more_RBR were_VBD received_VBN from_IN the_DT Secretary_NNP of_IN the_DT Famine_NNP Relief_NNP Fund_NNP ;_: relief-works_NNS ,_, consisting_VBG of_IN filling-in_JJ low_JJ land_NN ,_, and_CC of_IN stone-breaking_JJ ,_, were_VBD opened_VBN ;_: and_CC subsistence_VB rates-3_JJ annas_NNS per_IN day_NN for_IN men_NNS ,_, 2_CD annas_NNS for_IN women_NNS ,_, and_CC 11/2_CD annas_NNS for_IN children-were_JJ paid_NN ._.
The_DT recipients_NNS of_IN this_DT relief_NN numbered_VBN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN August_NNP 8,770_CD men_NNS ,_, 1,952_CD women_NNS ,_, and_CC 33_CD children-a_JJ total_NN of_IN 10,755_CD persons_NNS ._.
During_IN September_NNP 15,033_CD persons_NNS were_VBD similarly_RB relieved_VBN ,_, and_CC during_IN October_NNP 17,925_CD received_VBD the_DT same_JJ support_NN ._.
Meanwhile_RB ,_, although_IN the_DT total_JJ mortality_NN was_VBD some_DT 200_CD above_IN the_DT average_NN ,_, the_DT numbers_NNS of_IN plague_NN cases_NNS and_CC deaths_NNS recorded_VBN was_VBD small_JJ ._.
From_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN May_NNP to_TO the_DT middle_NN of_IN November_NNP 1897_CD ,_, indeed_RB the_DT highest_JJS figures_NNS reported_VBN were_VBD 77_CD cases-60_JJ deaths_NNS ._.
In_IN early_JJ December_NNP a_DT second_JJ epidemic_NN appeared_VBD probable_JJ :_: and_CC two_CD measures_NNS received_VBD special_JJ considera-_JJ tion_NN ._.
These_DT were_VBD ,_, first_RB ,_, the_DT segregation_NN of_IN contacts_NNS ;_: and_CC second_JJ ,_, the_DT vacating_NN of_IN infected_JJ or_CC unhealthy_JJ houses_NNS ,_, together_RB with_IN the_DT removal_NN of_IN the_DT inmates_NNS to_TO health_NN camps_NNS ._.
Both_DT these_DT measures_NNS were_VBD ,_, without_IN undue_JJ severity_NN ,_, enforced_VBD ;_: private_JJ segregation_NN camps_NNS were_VBD permitted_VBN ;_: special_JJ leniency_NN was_VBD shown_VBN to_TO goldsmiths_NNS ,_, weavers_NNS ,_, and_CC other_JJ craftsmen_NNS ;_: detention_NN was_VBD limited_VBN to_TO 10_CD days_NNS ,_, and_CC might_MD be_VB reduced_VBN to_TO 7_CD ;_: a_DT modified_JJ system_NN of_IN surveillance_NN was_VBD sanctioned_VBN ;_: and_CC every_DT effort_NN was_VBD made_VBN to_TO redress_VB reasonable_JJ complaints_NNS ._.
With_IN the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT epidemic_NN at_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN 1898_CD ,_, certain_JJ measures_NNS were_VBD ,_, after_IN careful_JJ consideration_NN ,_, introduced_VBN for_IN the_DT first_JJ time_NN ,_, chief_JJ amongst_IN these_DT may_MD be_VB mentioned_VBN :_: (_( 1_CD )_) prevention_NN of_IN depopulation_NN by_IN flight_NN ;_: (_( 2_CD )_) notification_NN of_IN sickness_NN ;_: (_( 3_CD )_) corpse-inspection_NN ;_: (_( 4_CD )_) the_DT securing_NN of_IN the_DT correct_JJ address_NN at_IN which_WDT death_NN took_VBD place_NN ._.
These_DT measures_NNS ,_, unfamiliar_JJ and_CC inconvenient_JJ as_IN they_PRP were_VBD ,_, added_VBD to_TO the_DT fear_NN of_IN death_NN ,_, a_DT constant_JJ presence_NN of_IN disinfection_NN gangs_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT frequency_NN of_IN funerals_NNS ,_, were_VBD not_RB long_RB in_IN producing_VBG discontent_NN ._.
The_DT perverse_JJ attitude_NN now_RB assumed_VBN by_IN the_DT people_NNS towards_VBP plague_NN and_CC plague_NN measures_NNS ,_, strengthened_VBD as_IN it_PRP was_VBD by_IN racial_JJ characteristics_NNS and_CC innate_NN prejudices_NNS ,_, soon_RB resulted_VBD in_IN disturbances_NNS ,_, which_WDT ,_, on_IN the_DT 17th_CD of_IN March_NNP 1898_CD ,_, terminated_VBN in_IN a_DT riot_NN ._.
It_PRP should_MD here_RB be_VB mentioned_VBN that_IN the_DT military_NN were_VBD largely_RB employed_VBN during_IN the_DT first_JJ two_CD epidemics_NNS for_IN disinfection_NN ,_, search-work_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT keeping_VBG of_IN order_NN ._.
They_PRP proved_VBD most_RBS useful_JJ ._.
The_DT figures_NNS for_IN this_DT second_JJ epidemic_JJ were_VBD considerably_RB higher_JJR than_IN those_DT for_IN the_DT first_JJ ;_: but_CC ,_, taking_VBG into_IN consideration_NN the_DT more_RBR numerous_JJ and_CC stringent_JJ measures_NNS which_WDT undoubtedly_RB lessened_VBD concealment_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT normal_JJ size_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB doubted_VBN whether_IN the_DT actual_JJ virulence_NN of_IN the_DT second_JJ epidemic_NN was_VBD any_DT greater_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT first_JJ ._.
Third_JJ epidemic_JJ ,_, 1898-99_JJ ._.
The_DT distinguishing_VBG characteristic_NN of_IN plague_JJ operations_NNS during_IN the_DT third_JJ epidemic_NN was_VBD a_DT definite_JJ system_NN ,_, methodically_RB enforced_VBN ._.
The_DT original_JJ design_NN comprised_VBD the_DT division_NN of_IN the_DT City_NNP into_IN districts_NNS or_CC wards_NNS ;_: each_DT ward_NN to_TO be_VB in_IN the_DT charge_NN of_IN a_DT Staff_NNP Corps_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, assisted_VBN by_IN a_DT European_NNP Medical_NNP Officer_NNP and_CC a_DT district_NN or_CC ward_NN Volunteer_NNP agency_NN ._.

Camps_NNS ._.

60,000_CD ._.

Outward_NNP Inspection_NNP ._.
For_IN twelve_CD years_NNS before_IN the_DT advent_NN of_IN the_DT present_JJ plague_NN epidemic_NN in_IN India_NNP ,_, a_DT perfect_JJ system_NN of_IN inspection_NN of_IN vessels_NNS ,_, passengers_NNS and_CC crews_NNS bound_NN for_IN Aden_NNP ,_, Red_NNP Sea_NNP ports_NNS ,_, Europe_NNP vi_VBZ the_DT Canal_NNP ,_, Persian_NNP Gulf_NNP and_CC Mauritius_NNP ,_, was_VBD in_IN existence_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP for_IN the_DT detection_NN of_IN passengers_NNS or_CC crews_NNS suffering_VBG from_IN infectious_JJ or_CC contagious_JJ disease_NN ._.
In_IN January_NNP 1897_CD it_PRP became_VBD clear_JJ that_IN a_DT panic-stricken_JJ population_NN was_VBD fleeing_VBG from_IN the_DT City_NNP by_IN all_DT available_JJ routes_NNS ,_, and_CC was_VBD spreading_VBG plague_NN to_TO the_DT inland_NN towns_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN to_TO the_DT ports_NNS in_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP Presidency_NNP ,_, more_RBR especially_RB to_TO those_DT near_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
It_PRP was_VBD there-_JJ fore_NN absolutely_RB necessary_JJ that_IN all_DT crews_NNS and_CC passengers_NNS ,_, leaving_VBG Bombay_NNP by_IN sea_NN ,_, should_MD be_VB thoroughly_RB and_CC systematically_RB examined_VBN ,_, and_CC all_DT that_WDT was_VBD necessary_JJ was_VBD to_TO extend_VB the_DT system_NN mentioned_VBD in_IN paragraph_NN 2_CD to_TO all_DT crews_NNS and_CC passengers_NNS on_IN vessels_NNS and_CC native_JJ craft_NN leaving_VBG for_IN any_DT place_NN or_CC port_NN vi_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP Harbour_NNP ._.
On_IN the_DT 6th_CD February_NNP 1897_CD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, rules_NNS were_VBD promulgated_VBN under_IN the_DT Epidemic_NNP Diseases_NNP Act_NNP (_( III_NNP ._.
of_IN 1897_CD )_) ,_, which_WDT precluded_VBD the_DT delivery_NN of_IN a_DT Port_NNP clearance_NN to_TO any_DT vessel_NN without_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN the_DT Port_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP 's_POS bill_NN of_IN health_NN ,_, certifying_VBG that_IN the_DT ``_`` master_NN or_CC person_NN in_IN charge_NN ,_, officers_NNS ,_, crew_NN and_CC passengers_NNS (_( if_IN any_DT )_) of_IN such_JJ vessel_NNS were_VBD free_JJ from_IN any_DT dangerous_JJ epidemic_JJ disease_NN ._. ''_''
Inspections_NNS had_VBD now_RB to_TO be_VB simultaneously_RB conducted_VBN at_IN different_JJ centres_NNS in_IN a_DT very_RB large_JJ harbour_NN ,_, at_IN various_JJ places_NNS along_IN an_DT extensive_JJ foreshore_NN and_CC within_IN wet_JJ docks_NNS ,_, where_WRB tidal_JJ conditions_NNS had_VBD to_TO be_VB reckoned_VBN with_IN ._.

V._NNP In_IN addition_NN to_TO the_DT foregoing_JJ staff_NN ,_, the_DT Customs_NNP Department_NNP appointed-_JJ Two_CD qualified_JJ private_JJ practitioners_NNS ._.
One_CD Lady_NNP Doctor_NNP and_CC later_RB on_IN a_DT third_JJ private_JJ practitioner_NN was_VBD entertained_VBN ._.
The_DT Customs_NNP Medical_NNP Staff_NNP examined_VBD the_DT crew_NN and_CC passengers_NNS of_IN all_DT native_JJ craft_NN proceeding_VBG to_TO ports_NNS between_IN Karachi_NNP on_IN the_DT North_NNP ,_, and_CC Bhatkal_NNP the_DT southernmost_NN port_NN in_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP Presidency_NNP ._.
The_DT Customs_NNP Medical_NNP Staff_NNP was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, supervised_VBN by_IN the_DT Port_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT two_CD local_JJ Shipping_VBG Companies-Messrs._JJ Shepherd_NNP and_CC Company_NNP and_CC the_DT British_JJ India_NNP Steam_NNP Navigation_NNP Company-which_NNP carried_VBD away_RP the_DT bulk_NN of_IN the_DT fleeing_VBG population_NN ,_, to_TO mention_VB that_IN they_PRP had_VBD already_RB provided_VBN a_DT Medical_JJ Inspection_NN of_IN their_PRP$ own_JJ ._.
Lieut.-Colonel_NNP F._NNP F._NNP MacCartie_NNP ,_, C.I.E._NNP ,_, I._NNP M._NNP S._NNP ,_, Port_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, during_IN the_DT first_JJ epidemic_JJ ,_, thus_RB describes_VBZ the_DT inspections_NNS :_: -_: ``_`` The_DT object_NN aimed_VBN at_IN being_VBG the_DT prevention_NN of_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN plague_NN to_TO other_JJ Indian_JJ ports_NNS ,_, to_TO ports_NNS outside_IN India_NNP ,_, and_CC ,_, above_IN all_DT ,_, to_TO Europe_NNP ,_, with_IN its_PRP$ incalculable_JJ effects_NNS on_IN Indian_JJ com-_JJ merce_NN ,_, no_DT measures_NNS were_VBD spared_VBN to_TO obtain_VB that_IN end_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT most_RBS characteristic_JJ feature_NN of_IN the_DT inspection_NN became_VBD its_PRP$ extreme_JJ strictness_NN and_CC searching_JJ nature_NN ._.
Plague_NNP ,_, moreover_RB ,_, is_VBZ a_DT disease_NN which_WDT requires_VBZ a_DT very_RB rigid_JJ and_CC close_JJ inspection_NN for_IN its_PRP$ recognition_NN ._.
Its_PRP$ main_JJ and_CC chiefest_JJS signs_NNS during_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP outbreak_NN were_VBD fever_RB and_CC buboes_NNS ,_, and_CC all_DT natives_NNS with_IN either_DT of_IN these_DT signs_NNS became_VBD objects_NNS of_IN suspicion_NN ;_: their_PRP$ temperatures_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN and_CC they_PRP were_VBD subjected_VBN to_TO the_DT most_RBS searching_JJ examination_NN in_IN private_JJ ._.
During_IN the_DT months_NNS of_IN February_NNP ,_, March_NNP ,_, and_CC April_NNP ,_, the_DT number_NN of_IN persons_NNS placed_VBN on_IN one_CD side_NN for_IN temperature_NN observation_NN ranged_VBD from_IN 20_CD to_TO 25_CD per_IN cent._NN ,_, and_CC as_RB many_JJ as_IN a_DT dozen_NN rapid-registering_NN thermometers_NNS were_VBD in_IN use_NN at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN ._.
It_PRP need_VBP hardly_RB be_VB said_VBD that_IN to_TO eliminate_VB the_DT suspicious_JJ cases_NNS a_DT care-_JJ ful_JJ individual_JJ examination_NN of_IN each_DT native_NN was_VBD necessary_JJ ,_, and_CC this_DT included_VBD not_RB merely_RB a_DT look_NN at_IN a_DT man_NN 's_POS tongue_NN and_CC face_NN ,_, and_CC pulse-observation_NN ,_, but_CC a_DT careful_JJ exploration_NN of_IN his_PRP$ body_NN for_IN glandular_JJ enlargement_NN ._.
Nor_CC was_VBD the_DT examination_NN confined_VBD to_TO the_DT persons_NNS sailing_VBG on_IN a_DT vessel_NN ._.
The_DT vessel_NN itself_PRP was_VBD overhauled_VBN and_CC a_DT high_JJ sanitary_JJ condition_NN insisted_VBN on_IN ._.
This_DT included_VBD the_DT opening_NN and_CC thorough_IN cleansing_NN of_IN lascars_NNS '_POS boxes_NNS ,_, which_WDT were_VBD often_RB found_VBN to_TO contain_VB filthy_JJ clothes_NNS and_CC rubbish_JJ quite_RB capable_JJ of_IN supporting_VBG the_DT plague_NN microbe_NN in_IN comfort_NN and_CC affluence_NN ._.
In_IN fact_NN ,_, it_PRP would_MD be_VB impossible_JJ ,_, humanly_RB speaking_VBG ,_, to_TO devise_VB a_DT more_RBR stringent_JJ or_CC exhaustive_JJ examination_NN for_IN the_DT prevention_NN of_IN the_DT export_NN of_IN plague_NN ._. ''_''
It_PRP was_VBD no_DT wonder_NN ,_, then_RB ,_, that_IN when_WRB the_DT Indian_JJ Delegate_NNP to_TO the_DT Venice_NNP Sanitary_NNP Conven-_NNP tion_NN ,_, after_IN close_JJ personal_JJ observation_NN ,_, described_VBD the_DT measures_NNS in_IN force_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, his_PRP$ state-_JJ ment_NN was_VBD received_VBN with_IN ``_`` satisfaction_NN mingled_VBD with_IN incredulity_NN ._. ''_''
Members_NNS of_IN the_DT Foreign_NNP Scientific_NNP Commissions_NNP that_WDT visited_VBD India_NNP to_TO study_VB the_DT plague_NN expressed_VBD their_PRP$ surprise_NN and_CC admiration_NN at_IN the_DT completeness_NN of_IN the_DT inspection_NN system_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN the_DT changed_JJ attitude_NN of_IN Europe-_NNP resulting_VBG from_IN their_PRP$ favourable_JJ representation_NN ,_, is_VBZ presumably_RB to_TO be_VB found_VBN the_DT reason_NN for_IN the_DT relaxation_NN of_IN the_DT severe_JJ quarantine_NN in_IN force_NN at_IN Brindisi_NNP ,_, Marseilles_NNP ,_, and_CC other_JJ ports_NNS ._.
When_WRB the_DT Venice_NNP Convention_NNP Regulations_NNPS were_VBD published_VBN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN they_PRP provided_VBD nothing_NN essential_JJ that_WDT was_VBD not_RB already_RB in_IN existence_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
The_DT Convention_NNP ,_, however_RB ,_, ruled_VBD that_IN the_DT examination_NN of_IN all_DT persons_NNS sailing_VBG on_IN a_DT ship_NN was_VBD to_TO be_VB conducted_VBN on_IN shore_NN prior_JJ to_TO embarkation_NN ._.
Arrangements_NNS were_VBD made_VBN ,_, as_RB soon_RB as_IN possible_JJ ,_, to_TO give_VB effect_NN to_TO this_DT recommendation_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT crew_NN and_CC passengers_NNS of_IN all_DT vessels_NNS ,_, including_VBG native_JJ craft_NN ,_, bound_NN to_TO ports_VB out_IN of_IN India_NNP ,_, have_VBP been_VBN examined_VBN on_IN shore_NN prior_JJ to_TO embarkation_NN and_CC conveyed_VBN on_IN board_NN under_IN Police_NNP escort_NN ._.
The_DT great_JJ majority_NN of_IN passengers_NNS for_IN the_DT Indian_JJ coast_NN ports_NNS leave_VBP by_IN the_DT British_JJ India_NNP and_CC Messrs._NNP Shepherd_NNP and_CC Company_NNP 's_POS coasting_NN steamers_NNS ,_, and_CC they_PRP were_VBD examined_VBN on_IN shore_NN ,_, prior_RB to_TO embarkation_NN ,_, in_IN sheds_NNS specially_RB arranged_VBN for_IN the_DT purpose_NN ,_, even_RB before_IN the_DT Venice_NNP Convention_NNP came_VBD into_IN force_NN ._.
As_IN an_DT additional_JJ precaution_NN ,_, the_DT clothing_NN and_CC bedding_NN of_IN native_JJ crew_NN and_CC all_DT 3rd_CD class_NN and_CC deck_NN passengers_NNS leaving_VBG for_IN ports_NNS out_IN of_IN India_NNP are_VBP subjected_VBN to_TO disinfection_NN by_IN means_NNS of_IN saturated_JJ steam_NN for_IN 15_CD minutes_NNS at_IN a_DT pressure_NN of_IN .10_NNP lbs_NN ._.
to_TO the_DT square_NN inch_NN ._.
This_DT pressure_NN gives_VBZ a_DT temperature_NN of_IN 239_CD F._NNP ,_, and_CC is_VBZ said_VBD to_TO be_VB capable_JJ of_IN destroying_VBG the_DT most_RBS resistant_JJ organisms_NNS yet_RB isolated_VBN ._.
The_DT following_JJ statement_NN shows_VBZ the_DT number_NN of_IN outward_JJ bound_NN vessels_NNS ,_, passengers_NNS and_CC crews_NNS examined_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT number_NN of_IN persons_NNS rejected_VBN during_IN the_DT periods_NNS from_IN February_NNP to_TO SEA_NNP INSPECTION_NNP ._. ]_NN

During_IN the_DT period_NN covered_VBN by_IN this_DT review_NN ,_, over_IN 21/2_CD years_NNS ,_, and_CC during_IN which_WDT time_NN Bombay_NNP City_NNP suffered_VBD from_IN three_CD virulent_JJ epidemics_NNS of_IN plague_NN and_CC has_VBZ not_RB once_RB been_VBN free_JJ since_IN the_DT commencement_NN ,_, seven_CD ocean-going_JJ steamers_NNS were_VBD reported_VBN to_TO have_VB had_VBN a_DT case_NN of_IN plague_NN on_IN board_NN of_IN each_DT ._.

V._NNP Whenever_NNP any_DT of_IN the_DT crew_NN or_CC passengers_NNS ,_, removed_VBN from_IN a_DT vessel_NN bound_NN for_IN a_DT foreign_JJ port_NN ,_, developed_VBD plague_NN ,_, the_DT fact_NN was_VBD communicated_VBN by_IN telegraph_NN to_TO the_DT authorities_NNS at_IN the_DT first_JJ port_NN for_IN which_WDT the_DT vessel_NN was_VBD bound_VBN ._.

Inward_NNP Inspection_NNP ._.
When_WRB the_DT plague_NN declined_VBD in_IN Bombay_NNP City_NNP large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN people_NNS returned_VBN to_TO Bombay_NNP as_RB eagerly_RB as_IN they_PRP had_VBD left_VBN it_PRP ._.
In_IN the_DT meanwhile_NN ,_, the_DT infection_NN had_VBD spread_VBN far_RB and_CC wide_JJ over_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP ,_, and_CC many_JJ of_IN the_DT places_NNS from_IN which_WDT people_NNS returned_VBD were_VBD now_RB in_IN their_PRP$ turn_NN active_JJ disseminators_NNS of_IN plague_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD necessary_JJ therefore_RB to_TO protect_VB Bombay_NNP as_RB far_RB as_IN possible_JJ ,_, and_CC with_IN that_DT view_NN inspection_NN of_IN inward_JJ passengers_NNS was_VBD commenced_VBN early_RB in_IN April_NNP 1897_CD ._.
All_DT passengers_NNS coming_VBG from_IN any_DT place_NN on_IN the_DT sea_NN coast_NN between_IN Bhatkal_NNP on_IN the_DT south_NN and_CC a_DT line_NN ten_JJ miles_NNS north_RB of_IN Karachi_NNP ,_, or_CC coining_VBG by_IN vessels_NNS which_WDT touched_VBD at_IN any_DT intermediate_JJ port_NN ,_, were_VBD inspected_VBN under_IN the_DT direction_NN of_IN the_DT Port_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP by_IN an_DT establishment_NN of_IN the_DT strength_NN shown_VBN below_IN ,_, provided_VBN by_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP Plague_NNP Committee_NNP :_: -_: Three_CD Commissioned_NNP Medical_NNP Officers_NNP ._.

One_CD Lady_NNP Nurse_NNP ._.
One_CD Lady_NNP Medical_NNP Student_NNP ._.
Passengers_NNS were_VBD disembarked_VBN at_IN Modi_NNP Bandar_NNP ,_, at_IN the_DT Docks_NNP '_POS Harbour_NNP Walls_NNP ,_, or_CC at_IN anchorages_NNS in_IN the_DT open_JJ harbour_NN ,_, except_IN those_DT coming_VBG by_IN native_JJ craft_NN ,_, who_WP were_VBD examined_VBN at_IN the_DT Dutiable_NNP and_CC Free_NNP anchorages_NNS and_CC at_IN a_DT special_JJ anchorage_NN near_IN Tucker_NNP 's_POS Beacon_NNP ._.
At_IN Modi_NNP Bandar_NNP and_CC at_IN the_DT Docks_NNP the_DT existing_VBG arrangements_NNS had_VBD to_TO be_VB augmented_VBN ,_, and_CC this_DT was_VBD cheer-_JJ fully_RB done_VBN by_IN Messrs._NNP Shepherd_NNP &_CC Co._NNP ,_, including_VBG even_RB an_DT installation_NN of_IN electric_JJ lighting_NN at_IN Modi_NNP Bandar_NNP for_IN the_DT examination_NN of_IN passengers_NNS arriving_VBG after_IN dark_NN ._.
The_DT manner_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT inspection_NN was_VBD conducted_VBN during_IN the_DT first_JJ few_JJ months_NNS is_VBZ thus_RB described_VBN by_IN Lieutenant-Colonel_NNP MacCartie_NNP :_: -_: ``_`` In_IN dealing_VBG with_IN the_DT masses_NNS of_IN people_NNS who_WP came_VBD under_IN inspection_NN during_IN the_DT four_CD months_NNS ,_, April_NNP to_TO July_NNP ,_, and_CC who_WP represented_VBD arrivals_NNS from_IN heavily_RB infected_VBN places_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN Karachi_NNP ,_, Janjira_NNP ,_, Alibg_NNP ,_, etc._NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN from_IN ports_NNS where_WRB plague_NN had_VBD not_RB reached_VBN epidemic_JJ proportions_NNS ,_, although_IN each_DT case_NN was_VBD decided_VBN on_IN its_PRP$ own_JJ merits_NNS ,_, it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN necessary_JJ to_TO decide_VB on_IN some_DT defined_JJ plan_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO eliminate_VB the_DT healthy_JJ from_IN the_DT suspected_VBN ,_, A_DT sliding_VBG scale_NN of_IN temperatures_NNS was_VBD accordingly_RB introduced_VBN ,_, and_CC passengers_NNS were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN classes_NNS according_VBG to_TO their_PRP$ own_JJ state_NN of_IN health_NN and_CC to_TO the_DT state_NN of_IN plague_NN at_IN the_DT places_NNS which_WDT they_PRP were_VBD judged_VBN to_TO have_VB arrived_VBN from_IN ._.
A_DT map_NN showing_VBG the_DT progress_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, and_CC altered_VBD according_VBG to_TO the_DT reports_NNS from_IN the_DT mofussil_NN ,_, was_VBD furnished_VBN by_IN the_DT Plague_NNP Committee_NNP ,_, and_CC in_IN accordance_NN with_IN the_DT alterations_NNS in_IN this_DT map_NN the_DT figures_NNS on_IN the_DT sliding_VBG scale_NN of_IN temperatures_NNS would_MD vary_VB ._.
Thus_RB arrivals_NNS from_IN a_DT place_NN only_RB slightly_RB infected_VBN would_MD ,_, if_IN free_JJ from_IN other_JJ signs_NNS of_IN plague_NN ,_, and_CC with_IN temperatures_NNS under_IN 100_CD F._NNP ,_, be_VB passed_VBN as_IN healthy_JJ one_CD week_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT next_JJ week_NN ,_, owing_VBG to_TO unfavourable_JJ reports_NNS from_IN the_DT same_JJ place_NN ,_, would_MD be_VB placed_VBN in_IN the_DT observation_NN camp_NN if_IN found_VBN with_IN temperatures_NNS anything_NN over_IN normal_JJ ._.
This_DT system_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO work_VB well_RB ,_, and_CC as_IN a_DT brisk_JJ house-to-house_NN visitation_NN was_VBD being_VBG carried_VBN out_RP by_IN the_DT Plague_NNP Committee_NNP at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ probable_JJ that_IN few_JJ ,_, if_IN any_DT ,_, cases_NNS of_IN plague_NN which_WDT arrived_VBN by_IN sea_NN during_IN the_DT four_CD months_NNS under_IN report_NN escaped_VBD detection_NN ,_, even_RB if_IN they_PRP succeeded_VBD in_IN passing_VBG through_IN the_DT inspecting_JJ staff_NN 's_POS in_IN the_DT harbour_NN and_CC at_IN the_DT bandars_NNS ._.
Some_DT difficulty_NN was_VBD experienced_VBN in_IN discovering_VBG the_DT places_NNS from_IN which_WDT the_DT passengers_NNS had_VBD really_RB come_VBN ._.
By_IN arrangement_NN the_DT tickets_NNS were_VBD not_RB collected_VBN until_IN the_DT inspection_NN was_VBD over_IN ,_, and_CC in_IN many_JJ cases_NNS tickets_NNS contained_VBD the_DT information_NN required_VBN ._.
In_IN other_JJ instances_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT passengers_NNS Lad_NNP travelled_VBD on_IN foot_NN for_IN many_JJ days_NNS and_CC covered_VBD long_JJ dis-_JJ tances_NNS in_IN order_NN to_TO secure_VB the_DT cheaper_JJR transit_NN by_IN the_DT Dharamtar_NNP ferry-boat_NN ,_, the_DT fare_NN for_IN which_WDT by_IN law_NN is_VBZ fixed_VBN at_IN four_CD annas_NNS ,_, and_CC their_PRP$ original_JJ places_NNS of_IN departure_NN could_MD with_IN difficulty_NN be_VB traced_VBN ,_, and_CC in_IN some_DT instances_NNS not_RB at_IN all_DT ._.
SEA_NNP INSPECTION_NNP ._. ]_NN
139_CD ``_`` When_WRB the_DT process_NN of_IN elimination_NN was_VBD completed_VBN ,_, the_DT suspects_NNS were_VBD transferred_VBN to_TO the_DT Plague_NNP Committee_NNP 's_POS Observation_NNP Camps_NNP ,_, and_CC detained_VBD there_EX for_IN periods_NNS varying_VBG from_IN 3_CD to_TO 5_CD and_CC 8_CD days_NNS ,_, according_VBG as_IN they_PRP had_VBD come_VBN originally_RB from_IN uninfected_JJ ,_, moderately_RB and_CC heavily_RB infected_JJ places_NNS ._.
Actual_NNP plague_NN cases_NNS were_VBD sent_VBN in_IN ambulances_NNS to_TO a_DT plague_JJ hospital_NN ._. ''_''
Such_JJ as_IN it_PRP was_VBD then_RB ,_, such_PDT the_DT inspection_NN has_VBZ remained_VBN up_RP to_TO the_DT present_JJ time_NN ._.
The_DT extent_NN of_IN area_NN from_IN which_WDT passengers_NNS were_VBD examined_VBN was_VBD increased_VBN in_IN August_NNP 1898_CD ,_, and_CC Hongkong_NNP ,_, Madagascar_NNP and_CC Jeddha_NNP were_VBD added_VBN to_TO the_DT list_NN ;_: on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, people_NNS arriving_VBG from_IN non-infected_JJ and_CC lightly_RB infected_VBN ports_NNS on_IN the_DT coast_NN were_VBD exempted_VBN from_IN inspection_NN from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN ._.
So_RB also_RB were_VBD changes_NNS made_VBN in_IN the_DT staff_NN ,_, especially_RB when_WRB imporation_NN of_IN plague_NN into_IN Bombay_NNP City_NNP was_VBD not_RB a_DT matter_NN of_IN much_JJ consequence_NN ,_, owing_VBG to_TO an_DT epidemic_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, or_CC when_WRB the_DT whole_NN of_IN the_DT inspections_NNS ,_, outward_RB and_CC inward_RB ,_, were_VBD conducted_VBN by_IN the_DT Port_NNP Health_NNP Staff_NNP alone_RB ._.
Pilgrims_NNS returning_VBG from_IN Jeddha_NNP were_VBD isolated_VBN in_IN the_DT pilgrim_NN shed_VBD until_IN their_PRP$ kit_NN was_VBD thoroughly_RB disinfected_VBN ,_, after_IN which_WDT they_PRP were_VBD sent_VBN direct_JJ to_TO their_PRP$ final_JJ destination_NN and_CC were_VBD not_RB allowed_VBN to_TO have_VB any_DT unnecessary_JJ communication_NN with_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.

During_IN the_DT period_NN covered_VBN by_IN this_DT review_NN ,_, the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN vessels_NNS ,_, including_VBG native_JJ craft_NN ,_, examined_VBD was_VBD 179,850_CD ._.
They_PRP had_VBD 3,131,049_CD crew_NN and_CC passengers_NNS ,_, and_CC among_IN them_PRP were_VBD discovered_VBN 409_CD cases_NNS of_IN plague_NN ,_, including_VBG the_DT cases_NNS found_VBN on_IN the_DT Harbour_NNP craft_NN ._.
The_DT sea_NN medical_JJ inspection_NN was_VBD ,_, from_IN the_DT importance_NN and_CC magnitude_NN of_IN the_DT interests_NNS involved_VBN by_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN plague_NN out_IN of_IN India_NNP ,_, a_DT source_NN of_IN the_DT greatest_JJS anxiety_NN to_TO Government_NNP ._.
But_CC events_NNS have_VBP proved_VBN that_IN no_DT department_NN of_IN plague_NN administration_NN has_VBZ been_VBN better_RB managed_VBN ;_: and_CC the_DT thoroughness_NN and_CC successful_JJ conduct_NN of_IN the_DT operations_NNS as_IN a_DT whole_NN has_VBZ commanded_VBN warm_JJ admiration_NN ._.
141_CD CHAPTER_NN VI_NNP ._.
RAILWAY_NNP INSPECTION_NNP ._.
Railway_NNP Medical_NNP Inspection_NNP ._.
The_DT adoption_NN of_IN measures_NNS for_IN the_DT prevention_NN of_IN the_DT conveyance_NN of_IN plague_JJ infection_NN by_IN Railway_NNP passengers_NNS engaged_VBD the_DT attention_NN of_IN Government_NNP as_RB early_RB as_IN October_NNP 1896._CD as_RB soon_RB as_IN it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN plague_NN had_VBD become_VBN established_VBN ,_, and_CC was_VBD spreading_VBG in_IN the_DT Town_NNP and_CC Island_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
The_DT authorities_NNS of_IN the_DT G._NNP T._NNP P._NNP and_CC B_NNP ._.
B_NNP ._.
&_CC ,_, C._NNP I._NNP Railways_NNP were_VBD consulted_VBN as_IN to_TO the_DT best_JJS method_NN of_IN securing_VBG ade-_JJ quate_JJ inspection_NN arrangements_NNS ,_, and_CC before_IN plans_NNS were_VBD developed_VBN ,_, a_DT telegram_NN was_VBD received_VBN from_IN the_DT Government_NNP of_IN India_NNP on_IN the_DT 12th_CD October_NNP 1896_CD ,_, urging_VBG the_DT adoption_NN of_IN a_DT systematic_JJ examination_NN of_IN Railway_NNP passengers_NNS ._.
Measures_NNS were_VBD soon_RB organized_VBN for_IN the_DT systematic_JJ and_CC careful_JJ examination_NN of_IN all_DT passengers_NNS leaving_VBG Bombay_NNP by_IN through_IN trains_NNS at_IN Grant_NNP Road_NNP on_IN the_DT B_NNP ._.
B_NNP ._.
&_CC C._NNP I_PRP ._.
Railway_NNP line_NN ,_, and_CC at_IN Victoria_NNP Terminus_NNP on_IN the_DT G._NNP I._NNP P._NNP Railway_NNP line_NN ,_, under_IN Section_NN 47_CD (_( d_NN )_) ,_, 71_CD and_CC 117_CD of_IN the_DT Railway_NNP Act_NNP (_( No_NNP ._.
IX_NNP of_IN 1890_CD )_) ._.
Meanwhile_RB active_JJ steps_NNS had_VBD been_VBN taken_VBN by_IN local_JJ bodies_NNS in_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT important_JJ places_NNS in_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP for_IN their_PRP$ own_JJ protection_NN ,_, and_CC by_IN the_DT 22nd_CD of_IN October_NNP 1896_CD it_PRP was_VBD decided_VBN to_TO make_VB arrangements_NNS for_IN the_DT medical_JJ examination_NN of_IN arrivals_NNS at_IN those_DT places_NNS where_WRB it_PRP did_VBD not_RB already_RB exist_VBP ._.
At_IN about_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN Government_NNP were_VBD informed_VBN that_IN the_DT Southern_NNP Mahratta_NNP Railway_NNP Company_NNP had_VBD of_IN their_PRP$ own_JJ accord_NN instituted_VBD arrangements_NNS for_IN the_DT inspection_NN of_IN passengers_NNS travelling_VBG on_IN their_PRP$ line_NN at_IN Poona_NNP ,_, Miraj_NNP ,_, Belgaum_NNP ,_, Londa_NNP ,_, Hubli_NNP ,_, Gadag_NNP ,_, and_CC Hotgi_NNP ._.
Soon_RB after_IN (_( about_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN December_NNP )_) the_DT large_JJ exodus_NN from_IN Bombay_NNP made_VBD it_PRP im-_JJ possible_JJ for_IN the_DT then_RB existing_VBG staff_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP to_TO cope_VB with_IN the_DT work_NN ._.
A_DT better_JJR and_CC more_RBR compre-_JJ hensive_JJ system_NN ,_, to_TO be_VB worked_VBN by_IN an_DT adequate_JJ staff_NN ,_, was_VBD therefore_RB introduced_VBN ;_: and_CC from_IN the_DT 4th_CD of_IN February_NNP 1897_CD Government_NNP decided_VBD to_TO stop_VB the_DT inspection_NN of_IN through_IN passengers_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, and_CC ,_, instead_RB ,_, to_TO provide_VB for_IN the_DT examination_NN of_IN all_DT passengers_NNS in_IN down_RP through_IN trains_NNS at_IN Kalyan_NNP and_CC Palghar_NNP Stations_NNP on_IN the_DT G._NNP I._NNP P._NNP and_CC B_NNP ._.

&_CC C._NNP I_PRP ._.

These_DT rules_NNS were_VBD shortly_RB after_IN applied_VBN also_RB to_TO Bhusawal_NNP (_( for_IN the_DT protection_NN of_IN the_DT Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS ,_, Bengal_NNP and_CC Calcutta_NNP )_) ,_, to_TO Ahmedabad_NNP (_( for_IN the_DT protection_NN of_IN Kthiwr_NNP and_CC Rjputna_NNP )_) ,_, to_TO Hotgi_NNP (_( for_IN the_DT protection_NN of_IN the_DT Southern_NNP Maratha_NNP Country_NNP ,_, Hyderabad_NNP and_CC Madras_NNP )_) ,_, and_CC to_TO Londa_NNP (_( for_IN the_DT protection_NN of_IN Goa_NNP ,_, Mysore_NNP and_CC Madras_NNP )_) ._.
Inspection_NN posts_NNS under_IN these_DT rules_NNS were_VBD subsequently_RB established_VBN at_IN various_JJ places_NNS in_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP ,_, e._JJ g._NN ,_, Poona_NNP ,_, Rajevadi_NNP ,_, Dhond_NNP and_CC Manmad_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT system_NN of_IN barrier_JJR inspec-_JJ tions_NNS already_RB in_IN force_NN for_IN the_DT inspection_NN of_IN arrivals_NNS at_IN important_JJ places_NNS was_VBD improved_VBN and_CC extended_VBN ._.
Under_IN Government_NNP Resolutions_NNP No_NNP ._.
522-88-p._JJ ,_, dated_VBD the_DT 1st_CD February_NNP 1897_CD ,_, and_CC 1072_CD -542-p._NN ,_, dated_VBD the_DT 27th_CD February_NNP 1897_CD ,_, Surgeon-Major_NNP (_( now_RB Lieut.-Colonel_NNP )_) A._NNP F._NNP W._NNP Street_NNP ,_, D.S.O._NNP ,_, I.M.S._NNP ,_, Deputy_NNP Sanitary_NNP Commissioner_NNP ,_, who_WP had_VBD been_VBN placed_VBN on_IN special_JJ duty_NN in_IN connection_NN with_IN the_DT plague_NN in_IN January_NNP 1897_CD ,_, was_VBD appointed_VBN to_TO control_VB and_CC supervise_VB all_DT measures_NNS for_IN the_DT Medical_NNP Inspection_NNP of_IN passengers_NNS by_IN railway_NN ,_, in_IN and_CC near_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, and_CC at_IN Dhond_NNP and_CC Manmr_NNP and_CC other_JJ stations_NNS in_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP ._.
This_DT control_NN he_PRP exercised_VBD until_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN April_NNP 1897_CD ,_, when_WRB ,_, in_IN consequence_NN of_IN an_DT accident_NN ,_, he_PRP was_VBD compelled_VBN to_TO proceed_VB to_TO Europe_NNP on_IN privilege_NN leave_NN ._.
